Margarita is 26 years old and lives happily with her husband Rudy, who is 27 years old and a banana farmer. They have two restless, but beautiful children: Jack (age 8) and Anais (age 2). They live in a cramped, but comfortable home located in the Peruvian jungle.

Margarita sells “salchipollo” (a dish consisting of French fries and pieces of fried chicken) from the doorstep of her house. In order to do this, she had to rearrange her small patio and install a thatched roof to provide a rustic atmosphere for her diners to enjoy. Every day is a constant struggle to get ahead, so Margarita wakes up early to prepare her children for school. At dusk, she begins preparing the food that she needs for her business so that she can meet the demand that she encounters throughout the evening.

Margarita’s business has been generating good revenues in the short time that she has been in operation. She was able to buy a refrigerator and dishes. In addition, she makes popsicles to sell to customers looking to get relief from the heat. As a businesswoman, Margarita has plans to open a snack shop where she can sell prepared food. She knows that a highway will be built near her house, so she wants to feed those workers who are looking for a place to dine.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Margarita wants to continue forward toward the goals she hopes to accomplish on behalf of her children. With the money she requested, she plans to purchase a scale. She also wants to start selling butchered chickens during the day and use what she has left over to prepare salchipollo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a scale

loans.name: Almaz

texts.en: Ever since their marriage, Almaz E. and her husband have made a living buying and selling sheep. They do their work with lots of care because they enjoy it and because it allows them to meet their expenses and provide an education for their son. This hard-working mother buys her sheep in nearby towns, then feeds and raises them until they are large enough to sell. Her dream is to give her four beloved children security and an education. She has applied for a loan to make this dream possible by buying more sheep and a calf. She needs your help, and thanks you in advance for your kind support.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sheep and one calf

loans.name: Miler

texts.es:
Miler tiene 41 años, vive en la tranquilidad de su hogar con su esposa Eva de 41 años, con quien tiene 4 hijos: Jersy de 19, Sandy de 13, Alexander de 7 y su última pequeña Mayuri de solo 6 meses.

Él es un hombre muy responsable y dedicado a la  agricultura, siembra papa y alverjas en sus propias chacras. Cada día debe trabajar desde muy temprano hasta que anochece, él se va solo a cuidar de sus tierras motivado por el deseo de sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una buena educación. Es por ello que se empeña en su trabajo diario, aunque es muy cansado tener que vigilar con dedicación cada planta para que no se dañe y tenga una buena producción.
Adicionalmente, su esposa lo ayuda a criar su ganado vacuno, lo que le brinda ganancias extras, por la leche que pueden vender. 
Así son los días de este hombre trabajador que se ve en el futuro rodeado de sus hijos profesionales, porque eso quiere que lleguen a ser, tener la oportunidad que él no tuvo.
Además quiere tener una gran cantidad de tierras para dejarlas en herencia a sus hijos y nietos, pues está convencido que las tierras son el mayor recurso inagotable que la naturaleza les puede brindar a los hombres agricultores.

Ya es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser cumplido en cada pago, además está muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, pues sus compañeros son muy solidarios y responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo tiene pensado invertir en la siembra de mayor cantidad de papas y alverjas, que son los productos que más se producen en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Miler is 41 years old and lives peacefully at home with his wife Eva, who is also 41. They have 4 children: Jersy (age 19), Sandy (age 13), Alexander (age 7), and finally little Mayuri (age 6 months).

Miler is a very responsible gentleman who engages in agriculture, growing potatoes and peas in his own fields. He works every day early in the morning until nightfall. Miler cares for his land by himself and is motivated by his desire to see his children succeed and to provide them with a good education. This is why he undertakes his work every day. Monitoring his fields is very tiring, but it is necessary to prevent crop damage and ensure a good harvest.

In addition, his wife helps support the family by raising cows and selling the milk for extra income. In the future, Miler hopes to see a day when his children all become professionals, an opportunity he did not have to pursue. He also wants to acquire lots of land to leave as an inheritance to his children and grandchildren because he is convinced that land is the best natural resource a farmer can have.

This is his third loan with MFP. Miler promises to fulfill each of his payments. His is very satisfied with the work of his Communal Bank and the other members have been very supportive and responsible as well. The money he is requesting will be used to plant more potatoes and peas, which are the crops most commonly grown in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his production of potatoes & peas

loans.name: Filyaz

texts.en: Education is the most important gift Filyaz M. can give their three dear children. They believe this because they are responsible parents who work very hard at farming so their children can finish school, an opportunity they never had because they were so poor. Filyaz has worked in agriculture since her wedding, and with the unconditional help of her husband, also buys and sells sheep to meet the family’s other needs. Despite this, she now finds herself with more expenses than expected, and would like a loan to increase the size of her flock. Filyaz and her family are hoping for a favorable response to their request.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo (Edwin) de 53 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo viven con el menor, Nelson de 17 años; pues los 2 mayores ya han formado sus propias familias.

Ella se levanta cada día bajo el radiante sol de la selva peruana con muchas ganas de trabajar en su pequeña tienda que tiene en su vivienda. Esta actividad la realiza sola porque su esposo trabaja en la chacra y su hijo estudia. Durante los días de la semana no tiene mucha demanda, pero durante los fines de semana puede obtener muy buenas ganancias en la venta de bebidas.
Adicionalmente, Norma brinda el servicio de comida a algunos trabajadores de la zona y así puede ganar algo más de dinero para su familia. 
Esta trabajadora mujer tiene mente ganadora, porque sabe que existen días que debe trabajar con más ahínco, además ha sabido elegir y darse cuenta de lo que faltaba en la zona era que alguien prepare comida para los trabajadores.
Al verla uno se pregunta: ¿así es la mujer peruana, acaso tiene una visión perfecta para salir adelante con lo poco que tiene, y de la nada sacar adelante a su familia entera? Pues la respuesta es sí y como muestra basta la historia de Norma.

Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está segura de ser responsable con sus pagos, pues tiene muchos proyectos en mente y además piensa concretarlos con la ayuda de estos créditos. Norma planea invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas para abastecer su bodega y de esta manera seguir saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking woman who is 48 years old. She lives with her husband Edwin, who is 53. Of their three children, only the youngest one, Nelson who is 17, lives with them. The two older children have families of their own.

Norma wakes up each day under the bright sun of the Peruvian jungle. She is eager to work in the small store she established in her home. Norma works by herself because her husband tends to the farm and her son is a student. There is not much demand during the week, but on the weekends, she generates good earnings from the sale of beverages. In addition, she provides meals to a few workers in the area as a way of earning extra money for her family.

One can ask the question, “Can a Peruvian woman have the perfect vision to succeed in moving her family forward with what little she has?” The answer is “yes” and Norma’s story shows that it is possible.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Norma is careful to be responsible with her payments because she has many projects in mind which can only happen with the help of these loans. She will use the money to restock her business with soft drinks and beer in order to keep it going.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza A. is 37 years old, married and has three children. The difficult circumstances and hardships of her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 10 years, Firuza has been purchasing young sheep in the local market, fattening them, and then selling them at local markets. Firuza is a very hardworking woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income for her family. Thanks to her business, she is able to support her three children's education. Firuza wants to continue educating them because she hopes that they will reach the goals she laid out for herself. 
For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy small sheep in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change lives.

loans.use: To purchase small sheep

loans.name: Valle Del Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Valle del Sol” esta representado por la señora Eufronia y conformada por 10 miembros los cuales se dedican a la comercialización  y venta D. productos como cosméticos, ropa interior, celulares, CDs,  comida y a la atención en hostales en el mercado como ambulantes, en algunos poseen puestos fijos habilitados precariamente en sus domicilios. La competencia existe en el mercado pero los socios tienen la capacidad para mover su puesto o diversificar su mercadería para encontrar la forma D. rescatar su capital y obtener la ganancia diaria que necesita su familia para su sustento. El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. capital para realizar compra D. materiales y mercadería para agrandar sus negocios y obtener una mejor y mayor ganancia. En cuanto a la experiencia D. los miembros ellos van cursando su segundo ciclo juntos demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos, cada una D. las socias tiene una visión a futuro D. hacer crecer sus negocios y brindarles a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The "Valle del Sol" [Sun Valley] group is represented by Ms. Eufronia. It's maD. up of 10 members that deal in the commercialization and sale of products such as cosmetics, underwear, cell phones, CD's and food. They also offer their services in hostels. They are mostly peddlers, although some have fixed stalls precariously set up in their homes.There's a lot of competition in the market but the members of the group are able to move their stalls and diversify their merchandise in order to find a way to recover their capital and obtain the daily income needed to sustain their family. The loan will be dedicated to increase their capital to purchase prime matter and merchandise to expand their businesses and obtain larger and better earnings. Regarding the experience of the members, they are currently in their second loan cycle together, and they have proved their responsibility and honesty in their repayments. Each of the members has a view of the future in which they make their businesses grow and offer their children a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso Group

texts.en:
Facundina, 31, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking Towards Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Facundina and the other borrowers in Caminando Hacia el Progreso live in a small town northwest of San Pedro called El Puerto. Facundina is married and has three children, ages 7, 4, and 7 months. She and her family live in a typical Dominican home: cement floors, wooden panels for exterior walls and a tin roof. With profits from her business, she hopes to improve her house so her children have a safer place to live.

With this loan, her very first with Esperanza International, Facundina plans to purchase ingredients for her small bakery, including flour, oil, sugar, and eggs. She has never used credit before, and is excited for the opportunity provided by extra cash flowing into her business. Facundina hopes to continue growing her bakery and take out more loans in the future. She also has dreams for her children to grow up with good health, study at good schools, and have a better life when they become adults. With an expanding business, Facundina knows that these dreams can come true. Thank you for lending to Facundina and the Caminando Hacia el Progreso group!

loans.use: To purchase oil, flour, sugar, and eggs

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Sofia, 60, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking Towards Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Sofia lives in El Puerto, a small town north-west of San Pedro. She has two children, one of whom still lives at home with her husband. They live in a house made from cement blocks with a tin roof, a significant improvement over the wooden houses of many neighbors. Sofia has used profits from her colmado (small corner store) to build this house, a significant achievement and proof of an expanding business. El Puerto is not an easy place to live: few medical facilities, large distances to nearest towns, little access to electricity, and no potable water access can cripple a population. Despite these difficulties, Sofia and her group have found stability in their loans and look forward to continuing to develop their businesses and community.

Sofia will be using this loan, her ninth with Esperanza International, to buy additional merchandise for her store, including bread, juices and soft drinks. She said that before having loans, it was easy for her and other group members to fail in their businesses because they did not have enough cash flow. Now, however, she and the others in her group have thriving businesses. She is very grateful for past support and excited for the possibilities in the future. Thank you for lending to Sofia and the Caminando Hacia el Progreso group!

loans.use: To buy bread, juices and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Sevinj

texts.en:
Sevinj A. and her family are internally displaced people who have suffered from the war and have lost their home. In 1992, she moved to Bilasuvar city and started her own business. With the loan from AqroInvest Credit Union she was able to purchase her first cow. That is why, seven years ago, she decided to move forward with raising livestock. Every morning, she goes out early so that her beloved cows may graze among the hills all day in the hope that they return happy and satisfied.

Sevinj is motivated to continue in this arduous work by the thought of her future life as she is single and doesn’t have additional financial income. In order to succeed in her business, she seeks to nourish the animals and keep them happy, in the hope of ultimately selling them at a good price. Thanks to her continued activity in her occupation, Sevinj and her elderly parents are able to sustain themselves and this fills her with great satisfaction.

However, with the support of this loan, Sevinj would now like to also purchase more livestock to increase her clientele. She recommended herself as a reliable client with a good loan history. With your support, she will be able to accomplish her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase four cows

loans.name: Safiro Group

texts.es: El grupo “Safiro”  Esta representado por la señora Norka  y conformada por 12 miembros que a pesar D. ser D. escasos recursos saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y trabajo en equipo. La gran mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la comercialización y venta D. productos como   la venta y elaboración D. artesanías, verduras, frutas y al servicio D. construcción D. viviendas. En cuanto a la competencia cada uno D. los socios indica que si existe pero la demanda D. productos como verduras siempre es necesario para cualquier hogar en especial si este es fresco y D. buena calidad como lo que producen los socios.  El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, herramientas y para materia prima para las artesanías. Los socios se encuentran cursando juntos su segundo ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que la mayoría ya trabajo bajo esta modalidad.
texts.en:
The Safiro group is represented by Norka. It is comprised of 12 members, who despite have scant resources, know how to get ahead with effort and to work as a team. The majority of the group’s members are merchants, and they sell products like handicrafts that they make, vegetables, and fruit. Some work building houses. Each one of the members indicates that competition exists. But, the demand for products like vegetables is always present for each household, especially is they are fresh and of good quality like the members produce. The loan is to get merchandise, tools, and raw materials for the members who make handicrafts. They are in their second cycle, and they demonstrate punctuality and responsibility in their payments. Most of them have already worked with type of lending model.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Afqan

texts.en:
Afqan H. raises and sells cattle. He is 32 years old, married and has three kids. He purchases cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Afqan has been in this business since he was 17 years old – thanks to his father who is a farmer and taught him a lot. He is an expert at choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up at five o'clock every morning to feed the cows and look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, but his family is still quite poor because of the high prices they have to pay for everything.

Afqan applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more cattle to expand his business. You could become an important part of his family's life. Afqan deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo “16 D. Julio” esta representado por la señora Carmen Silvia y conformado por 11 miembros, la mayor parte D. las personas que componen este grupo son D. escasos recursos teniendo como ingreso solo un pequeño negocio los cuales montan en las ferias naviD.ñas pero cuando no se dedican a la venta D. juguetes poseen mercadería alternativa como la venta D. cueros, pan, comida, pollo, refrescos y otras se dedican al servicio D. limpieza domiciliaria. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería naviD.ña para la feria y para incrementar su capital D. trabajo.  En cuanto a la experiencia los miembros del grupo ya tienen experiencia en grupo solidarios gracias  a financiamientos anteriores en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital pero los miembros del grupo están contentos por el apoyo económico D. nuestra institución les brinda ya que con ello podrán generar mejores ingresos y así podrán darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The 16 D. Julia group is represented by Carmen Silvia. It is comprised of 11 members. Most of the people who make up this group have scant resources, and their income is solely from their small businesses that they set up at Christmas fairs. When they are not selling toys they sell other merchandise like leather goods, bread, food, chicken, and soft drinks. Some proviD. housecleaning services. The loan is to get Christmas merchandise for the fair and to increase their work capital. The group members have experience with communal banks thanks to previous loans with institutions that are similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. The members are happy with the economic support from our institution because they will be able to generate more income. This way they will be able to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara M. is 33 years old. She is a very active and passionate woman who started her business in 2001 and has become very experienced and skilled in cattle breeding. She is married and has three children.

She has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to expand her herd. Elnara believes this will help her to generate greater revenue and, ultimately, greater profit for her family. In the future, she plans to buy additional calves and increase her income further. We hope that you will play an important role in Elnara's family life, because she deeply appreciates the trust and support lenders give her.

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Bolivianita Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Bolivianita” esta representado por la señora Martha Carola y conformado por14 miembros los cuales una gran mayoría se dedica a la venta D. productos como comida rápida al paso dulces, abarrotes en tienda D. barrio, llantas, frutas, refrescos y al transporte publico D. pasajeros. Dentro del ámbito competitivo se pueD. mencionar que si bien esta presenta la demanda D. sus productos es mayor obteniendo ingresos acorD. a sus necesidades, Desean Ampliar sus negocios con la compra D. mercadería, insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar mejores ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. ser su primer ciclo dentro D. la Institución ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. gracias a créditos en otras instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que están contentos por el apoyo económico brindado.
texts.en:
The La Bolivianita group is represented by Martha Carola. It is comprised of 14 members. The majority of them sell products like fast food, sweets, groceries in neighborhood stores, tires, fruit, and soft drinks. Some work in public transportation of passengers. As far as competition goes, it does exist. The demand for their products is greater, and they get income according to their needs. They want to expand their businesses by purchasing merchandise, supplies, and materials that help them generate greater income in order to give their families a better quality of life. In spite of this being their first cycle with the Institution, they do have experience with communal bank thanks to loans from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. They are very happy with the economic support given by the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Las Valientes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Valientes” esta representado por la señora Zoila Rosario y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales tienen sus propios negocios de venta de productos como ropa, zapatos, dulces, atención en fotocopiadoras, Estilista en su propio salón de belleza y al transporte publico de pasajeros. La gran mayoría de las Socias son personas muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios de ya que la competencia en el mercado es alta y ellas necesitan su ganancia para manutención de sus hogares ya que la mayoría de ellas representan el sustento de sus familias. El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería y para la reparación de los vehículos de los socios que se dedican al trasporte Publico, algunas de las socias dedicara el crédito al mejoramiento de sus hogares para brindarles una mejor calidad debida a sus familias. Es la primera vez que trabajan bajo esta modalidad pero también algunas de las socias ya tenia experiencia en créditos individuales por lo que saben como responder a sus obligaciones y sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las Valientes” group is represented by Mrs. Zoila Rosario and composed of 12 members. Each member has his or her own business. These include clothing sales, shoe sales, candy sales, photocopier service, hair salon, and taxi service.

The large majority of the members are very hardworking people trying to achieve success for their small businesses. The competition in the marketplace is high, and they need their earnings to maintain their homes, as most are supporting a family.

This loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise and the repair of vehicles used as public transport. Some members will also use loan money to improve their homes to provide a better quality of life for their families.

This is the first loan for this group, but several members have had individual loans so they know how to fulfill their obligations. They wish to advance their small businesses and offer a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise, vehicle repair, and home improvement

loans.name: 16 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las características del grupo “16 de Mayo” es que son personas que buscan progresar a pesar de las adversidades junto a su representante la señora Isabel y sus 17 miembros van cursando un segundo ciclo demostrando entusiasmo y responsabilidad en sus pago. Entre las actividades a las cuales se dedican están la venta de dulces, comida, cosméticos y el servicio de albañilería, profesora, empleadas domesticas y de empresas privadas. La competencia con respecto a sus negocios es y difícil, ya que todos tienen que trabajar duro para poder cubrir sus cuotas y tener una ganancia para el sustento de sus familias. El crédito esta destinado a la adquisición de materia prima mercadería y principalmente herramientas de trabajo para realizar un mejor trabajo con mayor rapidez y con un mejor acabado. Alguna de las socias no entraron en el primer ciclo del grupo pero ya cuentan con experiencia gracias a créditos en instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital, a quien dan gracias por el apoyo económico y la confianza depositada en cada una de las integrantes.
texts.en:
The members of the 16 de Mayo group are characterized as being people who look to progress in spite of adversities. Together with their representative, Isabel, the 17 members are in their second cycle. They demonstrate enthusiasm and responsibility with their payments. Their activities are selling sweets, food, and cosmetics. Some work as bricklayers, teachers, domestic employees, or employees of private companies. The competition in their businesses is difficult. They all have to work hard to cover their payments and have enough income to support their families. The loan is to get raw material, merchandise, and work tools to do the best work faster and with a better finish. Some of the members were not in the group’s first cycle, but they have experience thanks to loans from institutions similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. They are thankful to the Agrocapital Foundation for the economic support and the confidence placed in each one of the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
el sr. Sebastian M. tiene 64 años de edad, vive en la Aldea El Comercio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Sebastian es un sr. de edad y este es el unico trabajo que puede realizar para ganarse la vida.
Sebastian esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su pulperia ya que en estos momentos no tiene mucha variedad de productos.
Sebastian vive con su esposa y los dos pasan felices en su hogar.
cuando Sebastian tiene que salir a comprar alguna mercaderia para su negocio, su esposa se queda al cuidado del negocio.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos de los dos.
su meta es poder acondicionar mejor su negocio y tenerlo bien surtido.
texts.en:
Sebastian M. is 64 years old. He lives in Aldea El Comercio, in the city of San Lorenzo. He sells products for popular consumption. He has a general store in his home. Sebastian is a senior, and this is the only job that he can do to earn a living.

Sebastian is requesting a loan to stock up his store, which currently doesn’t have a large variety of products.

Sebastian lives with his wife, and they are both happy in their home.

When Sebastian has to go out to buy some merchandise for his business, his wife takes care of the business.

This is the only source of income between them.

His goal is to equip his store and have it well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase toilet paper, corn and wheat flour, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, candles, soups, spaghetti, juices, sodas, sardines, chiles, salt, tortillas, cookies

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en:
Khatira Q. is 33 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and has four children. As she had only high school education and had never worked, she decided to start her business to financially help her husband, so Khatira dedicates herself to raising and selling cows. The income she generates provides a better quality of life for her family.

She is asking for a loan of 1600 AZN in order to buy calves to sell later when they are fully grown. With this investment, Khatira will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Reina De La Paz Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Reina de La Paz” esta representado por la señora Sintia y conformado por 14 miembros que ya van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas de salir adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación a su trabajo, cada una cuenta con actividades económicas como la venta de pan, empanadas, ropas en el mercado, cosméticos y productos por catalogo que  generalmente realizan su trabajo de forma ambulante, otros se dedican a la venta de gas y a diferentes servicios como el transporte publico de pasajeros, confección de prendas de vestir y al trabajo en diferentes oficinas bajo el cargo de secretaria. La competencia entre ellas depende mucho del tipo de producto que ofrecen por ejemplo aquellas que se dedican a la venta de pan tienen mayor demanda que las que se dedican a la venta de ropa, pero como es grupo unido entre todas se apoyan. El crédito esta destinado a la compra mercadería nueva, insumos, herramientas y repuestos y para algunas para la refacción y mejoramiento de sus viviendas que ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Reina de la Paz" is represented by Sintia and is made up of 14 members. In their second term, they are already showing responsibility and eagerness to get ahead with effort and dedication to their work. Each has economic activities such as selling bread, empanadas, clothes in the market, cosmetics and catalog products. Generally, they carry out their work as street vendors. Others make their living selling gas and with different services such as public passenger transportation, making clothing, and working in different offices in the role of secretary. Their competence depends a lot on the type of product they offer. For example, those that sell bread have a higher demand than those that sell clothes, but since it's a close group they all support each other. The loan is destined for the purchase of new merchandise, ingredients, tools, and replacement parts. For some it's for the repair and improvement of their homes which will help to better their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food goods

loans.name: Jesus Divino Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Jesús Divino” esta representado por la señora Marioly y  conformado por 15 miembros los cuales van ingresando a su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos, cada uno D. los miembros posee su propio negocio D. venta D. pan, ropa, venta y elaboración D. artesanías, verduras y a la prestación D. servicios como la también venden empanadas, otras venden ropas en el mercado como la costura, el transporte público, operador D. maquinaria pesada y el servicio D. lavado D. ropa a domicilio. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante con sus negocios para rescatar su capital y el porcentaje D. ganancia que es el sustento D. su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su mercadería ya que en la época naviD.ña existe mas demanda D. productos y necesitan el efectivo para la adquisición D. materia prima, insumos y mercadería para incrementar sus ventas y por enD. sus ganancias. En el anterior ciclo tuvieron algunos problemas con socias que malgastaron su capital y no supieron administrar su efectivo es por esto que tuvieron conflicto en algunos pagos, actualmente se realizo una depuración D. las socias que no trabajaron en forma solidaria y ahora se encuentran bien entusiastas para seguir trabajando con mas ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios y mejorar cada día mas la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Divine Jesus” cooperative bank is represented by Ms. Marioly and is comprised of 15 members. They are entering into a second loan cycle of demonstrating their responsibility and punctuality with payments. Each one of the members has their own business selling bread, clothes, making and selling handicrafts, and vegetables. Some also sell empanadas, clothes, proviD. transportation services, operate heavy machinery and proviD. in-home laundering services. Competition is high within the business arena, however the members know how to get ahead with their businesses to save their capital and profits in order to support their families. The loan would be destined to help them increase their merchandise for the Christmas holiday season, when their products are in higher demand. They need capital to buy raw materials, supplies, and merchandise. This will help them increase their sales and, ultimately, their incomes. In a previous loan cycle, they had problems with a few members that misspent their funds and didn’t know how to manage their money. This led to some loan payment troubles. Those members that did not work well with the team have been removed, and the remaining participants are enthusiastic about continuing to work hard to grow their businesses and improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Maria del Carmen O. Gutierrez tiene 57 años de edad, vive en en la colonia San
Francisco en donde vende queso, mantequilla y quesillo, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. los lacteos son un producto alimenticio muy vendido, muchas personas comen este tipo de alimementos dos veces al dia (desayuno y cena) tambien lo compran muchos turistas que vienen al puerto de San Lorenzo. 
Maria esta solicitando el credito para cubrir con algunos pedidos al por mayor y no tiene suficiente capital para poder comprar los lacteos.
su meta es remodelar su casa y dejarla bien acondicionada para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive con su Esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Carmen is 57 years old and lives in Colonia San Francisco where she sells cheese, butter, and quesillo (a soft cheese). She has been involved in this activity for some time. Milk products are nutritious and readily sold. Many people eat this type of food twice a day (breakfast and lunch). Also, many tourists who visit the port of San Lorenzo buy it.

Maria is soliciting a loan to cover some wholesale orders and she lacks sufficient capital to buy milk supplies.

Her goal is to remodel her house and improve its condition in order to have a better quality of life. Maria lives with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHEESE, BUTTER, AND SOFT CHEESE TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lourdes Suyapa

texts.es:
la señora Lourdes Suyapa B. V. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Benigno Zamora, tienen 4 hijos, dos dependen de ellos, su compañero de hogar trabaja en finca santa rosa. Lourdes se dedica a vender lacteos,golosinas y refrescos. tiene un año de vender este tipo de productos, las ventas de las golosinas y los refrescos son los fines de semana y los demas
dias son para la venta de lacteos. esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas lacteos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es grande y no cubre con todos los pedidos que tiene en la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes Suyapa is 38 years old and lives in a common law union with Mr. Benigno Zamora. They have 4 children, 2 of whom still depend on them. Her companion works on Santa Rosa farm.

For the last year Lourdes has been selling milk products, sweets, and soft drinks. On weekends she sells the sweets and soft drinks, and on weekdays she sells the milk products.

Lourdes is soliciting a loan to buy more milk products, since customer demand is great and she can't cover all the orders she gets during the week.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHEESE, BUTTER, AND SOFT CHEESE TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khanlar

texts.en:
Khanlar A. is married and has three children. These three children are still in school and help him with his store.

Khanlar has more than 20 years' experience with his business selling groceries. With his small savings and on his own initiative, he decided to set up the store nine years ago. He thought about it because there wasn’t this type of business in his neighborhood.

Thanks to the store, Khanlar was able to buy a small used car, which he uses to do deliveries in the mornings from time to time. His wife doesn’t work and when Khanlar needs to go out she is in charge of selling the groceries. Khanlar works every day of the week from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. This hardworking father is motivated by his great love for his family. He wants to use the loan to invest in his store. He is sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to increase income

loans.name: Dios Nuestro Ayudador Group

texts.en:
Junette is the coordinator of her group, Dios Nuestro Ayudador (God is our helper), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the area surrounding Puerto Plata, an area where the economy is based on tourism and where running water (which is not potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented three-room cement structure with a tin roof, with her husband, brother, brother-in-law, and three children aged 10, 5, and 3.

Junette is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and she believes that it will greatly help her improve her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling clothing, including pants, polo shirts, and shoes, as well as skin creams and perfumes. She sells in the street and also takes orders. She will use the profits to invest in purchasing her own home so that she will no longer have to rent. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell, including pants, polo shirts, tennis shoes, skin creams, and perfumes

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es:
la sra. Maria Santos M. tiene 61 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 6 hijos de los cuales todos ya se casaron. Maria se dedica a la venta de refrescos de cola en difetentes tamaños. tiene 03 años de vender este tipo de producto, Maria vive en la ciudad de Langue, ahi el clima es caliente y los refrescos se venden muy bien cuando estan bien helados.
este negocio le a generado ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
nos comento que se siente muy contenta ya que todo le esta saliendo bien, ahora necesita comprar mas refrescos al por mayor ya que los camiones repartidores solo vienen una vez por semana y esto hace que se le compliquen las ventas a Maria. Tambien en estas epocas hay muchas reuniones y fiestas y los refrescos se venden mas. quiere abastecerse de mucho producto para estar preparada para las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Santos M. is 61 years old, is single, and has 6 children, all of whom are married. Maria is dedicated to selling cola drinks in different sizes. She has sold this type of product for 3 years. Maria lives in the city of Langue, where the climate is hot and sodas sell very well when they are well-chilled. This business has generated income to cover her household expenses. She tells us that she feels very happy since everything is turning out well. Now she needs to buy more soda wholesale since the delivery trucks only come once a week and this has complicated Maria's sales. Also, in these times there are many meetings and parties and soft drinks sell better. Maria wants to stock up on inventory so that she is prepared for her clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks of different sizes.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yolanda Vicenta

texts.es:
Yolanda C. de 53 años, vive en un sector periurbano sin alcantarillado y solo cuenta con electricidad tiene una casa de caña ubicada en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil. Yolanda hace tres años comenzó a vender pañales y cuadernos poco a poco aumento su mercadería ya que hay una escuela cerca de su domicilio donde tiene el pequeño bazar.

Trabaja desde las 6:00Am para vender a los niños que estudian cerca, compra en la Bahía de Guayaquil, 300 pañales que los vende a 0.20 c/u, cuadernos y útiles,  aunque en las lluvias a los clientes le es de obstáculo el acceso al bazar no se da por vencida, su esposo le ayuda vendiendo pañales fuera de casa recorriendo tiendas, por lo que sus hijos ya son mayores y tienen sus propias familias, Yolanda y su esposo quieren seguir adelantes juntos.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, esmaltes, aretes, láminas para poder surtir su negocio, y en el futuro quiere expandir más su negocio y adecuar su local en la esquina de su sector.
texts.en:
Yolanda C. is 53 years old and lives in the outskirts of a city without a sewage system. She only has electricity. She has a house made of reeds located in the Paraíso zone in Guayaquil. Yolanda began to sell diapers and notebooks three years ago and little by little expanded her merchandise. There is a school near her home where she has a small store. She begins working at 6:00 am to sell to the children that study nearby. In the Bay of Guayaquil, she buys 300 diapers that she sells for 20 cents a unit, notebooks, and school supplies. Even though during the rains clients are unable to access her store, she does not get defeated. Her husband helps her sell diapers outside of her house going from door to door. Since her children are older and have their own families, Yolanda and her husband want to move forward together. With this loan, Yolanda would like to buy stationery, nail polish, earrings, and posters in order to supply her business. In the future, she would like to continue to expand her business and move her locale to the corner of her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stationery, nail polish, earrings, and posters

loans.name: Eduvis Eufemia

texts.es:
Euduvis P. de 32 años, de la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, esta ubicada en un lugar periurbano, tiene una casa de ladrillos solo con luz y con falta casi de todos los servicios básicos, ella empezó vendiendo caramelos, juguetes, láminas y otros  artículos para los niños fuera de una escuela cercana de su casa.

Cuando ya la conocieron ella se puso un negocio en su casa pero aun va a vender plumas, lápices, cuadernos, láminas  a la escuela a la entrada que es 6:30Am-7:30Am y a la salida de 12:00-13:00Pm.

Euduvis vio que en su sector no solo eran indispensables los útiles para los niños sino los víveres de comida y quiere comenzar comprando azúcar, arroz, huevos y aceites, ya que su esposo es maestro albañil y le ayuda con los gastos de la familia pero no es suficiente porque tiene 3 hijos pequeños la mayor tiene 7 años, y están en una escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere implementar vendiendo azúcar, arroz, huevos y fideos para así agrandarlo a mas de los útiles, en el futuro quiere  mejorar su tienda surtida para poder tener a sus hijos en una mejor escuela y poder arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Euduvis P. is 32 years old and lives in the zone of Paraíso in Guayaquil, which is located in the outskirts of the city. She has a brick house with only electricity and lacks almost all basic services. She began selling sweets, toys, posters, and other things for children outside of a school near her house. When they got to know her, she moved the business to her house, but she still goes to sell pens, pencils, notebooks, and posters when school begins (between 6:30 and 7:30 am) and ends (between 12:00 and 1:00 pm). Euduvis saw that in her neighborhood not only were school supplies essential but also food supplies are. She would like to buy sugar, rice, eggs, and oils. Her husband is a bricklayer and she helps him with the household expenses, but she is not able to help enough now because they have 3 young children. The oldest is 7 years old and they are are in public school. With this loan, she would like to begin selling sugar, rice, eggs, and noodles to expand her business. In the future, she would like to improve her store and keep it stocked so that she can send her children to a better school and fix her house.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, eggs, and noodles

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is 30 and married with 2 children, who are 5-months and 2 years-old.  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.    Malia needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

In 2009, Malia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics Scores for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score:                3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              3 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín A. de 29 años de edad, vive en la zona de Paraíso de Guayaquil, en un sector con escaso servicios básicos solo tiene el beneficio de tener electricidad, tiene una casa de ladrillos, Agustín comenzó hace un año atrás vendiendo aguas, colas después implemento vendiendo legumbres que le resulto muy favorable ya que en su sector no vendían nada de eso.

Agustín 2 veces a la semana va al mercado de mayoristas a las 5:30Am a comprar legumbres, colas y arroz, tiene algunas dificultades  para ir a comprar al mercado de mayoristas porque tiene que ir en bus con 1 o 2 sacos de arroz.

Su esposa vende formatos DVD en el centro de Paraíso de Guayaquil y con esto le ayuda a sustentar los gastos de su familia ya que tienen dos hijos uno de 6 años que estudia en una escuela Particular del sector que paga $ 2.5 mensual y otro de 4 años que no estudia.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más azúcar, aceites y legumbres para así agrandar la tienda, en el futuro quiere surtir mas la tienda y  tener para comprar un congelador para también vender carnes  y así asegurar el futuro de su familia
texts.en:
Agustín A. is 29 years old and lives in the Paraíso district, an area of scarce basic services, in the city of Guayaquil. Agustín has a brick house, but only has the benefit of an electricity supply. A year ago, he started to sell bottles of water and coca-cola, and, thereafter, began selling vegetables. This proved to be successful as such were previously unavailable in his neighbourhood. Agustín goes to the wholesale market at 5:30am twice a week to buy vegetables, coca-cola and rice. It is somewhat difficult for Agustín to go to the wholesale market because he has to go by bus with 1 or 2 sacks of rice. His wife sells DVDs in the centre of Paraíso de Guayaquil and this helps towards the family’s expenses as they have two children, one six years old who studies in a private school that costs $2.5 monthly, and the other is four years old and does not go to school. With this loan, Agustín wants to buy more sugar, oil and vegetables to expand his product range. In the future, he wants to be able to increase his stock and buy a freezer so that he can also sell meat and ensure the future wellbeing of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SUGAR, OIL, VEGETABLES

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.es:
el sr. Petronilo C. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 14 hijos de los cuales solo 4 dependen de el,  ya que los otros estan adultos y ya formaron su hogar.
Petronilo  se dedica a la venta de abarroteria como: frijoles, azucar, maiz, arroz, café, manteca, aceite, papel higienico, jabon de baño, pastas etc desde hace varios años y su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Langue.
en estos ultimos meses a tenido pocas ventas ya que no tiene muy surtida su tienda, por tal razon esta solicitando el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas ventas y mas ganancias, esta es la unica fuente de trabajo del sr. Petronilo.
el es una persona luchadora, pero dice sentirse cansado.
su meta es poder acodicionar mejor su negocio y hacerlo mas grande para poder estar tranquilo durante varios años.
texts.en:
Mr. Petronilo is 65 years old, lives in a common law union, and has 14 children. Just 4 still depend on him, since the others are adults and have already established their own homes.

Petronilo has for many years sold grocery items such as beans, sugar, corn, rice, coffee, lard, cooking oil, toilet paper, bath soap, pasta, etc. His business is located in the municipal market in the city of Langue.

For the last few months he has had little sales because his store lacks variety of inventory. For that reason, he is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and thus, increase sales and earnings. This is Petronilo's only source of income. He is a determined person but he says he feels tired.

His goal is to be able to improve his business and make it larger in order to be secure in the coming years.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY SOFT DRINKS, BEANS, SUGAR, CORN, RICE, COFFEE, LARD, OIL, TOILET PAPER, BATH SOAP, AND DETERGENT

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban es un joven muy trabajador de 27 años, vive solo con su madre y por ella se esfuerza diariamente.

Él se dedica a la agricultura en su propia chacra; siembra plátano, café y palta, frutos que más se cultiva en esta parte del Perú. Desde muy pequeño Esteban aprendió de su padre y desde entonces perfeccionó su técnica y hoy tiene una de las tierras más fértiles de la zona.
Adicionalmente, se dedica a la cajonería, la cual consiste en fabricar cajones para el transporte de los frutos; él es uno de los pocos cajoneros de la zona es por eso que su trabajo es muy solicitado y le permite obtener buenas ganancias adicionales. Este oficio lo aprendió observando a un hombre para quien trabajaba y así se hizo cajonero. 
Estaban reparte muy bien su tiempo entre su chacra y la cajonería, que según sus palabras: “es fácil, solo hay que tener precisión”.
Aunque aún no tiene familia, debe esforzarse por brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su madre, que es lo más importante que tiene.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que cumplirá con cada pago, pues tiene muchas metas por realizar, y sabe que puede hacerlas realidad con estos préstamos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de madera para seguir dedicándose en la cajonería, que es un oficio muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
Esteban is a hardworking young person who is 27 years old and lives alone with his mother; he works hard for her daily. He works in agriculture on his own farm, harvesting bananas, coffee and avocados, fruits that are often cultivated in this part of Peru. Esteban learned this trade from his father when he was very young and ever since he has perfected his techniques; today he has some of the most fertile land in the area. Additionally, he has a crate business, which consists of making packing crates to transport the fruit. He has one of the only crate-making businesses in the area and for this reason his work is highly sought after, and this allows him to have additional earnings. Esteban shares his time between his farm and crate-making business, that according to him " is easy, you just have to have precision." Although he does not yet have his own family, he must work hard to provide a good quality of life for his mother, who is very important to him. This is his fifth loan with MFP and he is sure that he will make every payment, as he has many goals to fulfill and he knows that he can make them a reality through these loans. With the money that he requests now he will buy a large quantity of wood to continue with his crate-making business, which is a very profitable line of work in this area.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en:
Fuatino is 40 and married with 2 children.  She owns & operates a business venture, selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Fuatino needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Fuatino joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fuatino's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es una simpática mujer que vive con su esposo (Cristóbal), de 42 años, y con sus 4 jóvenes hijos: Noemí de 21, Jivan de 18, Soledad de 15 y Luis de 13 años. Todos comparten una pequeña casa ubicada en la selva peruana.

Ella se dedica a la siembra de plátano, palta, café y frutos cítricos en sus propias tierras. Paralelamente, trabaja junto a su esposo como obrera en tierras de otras personas y por las que también reciben un sueldo, aunque no es mucho, les ayuda en los gastos del hogar. Sin embargo, poco a poco también están logrando construir dos casas en el terreno cercano a sus tierras de cultivo.
Lucy decidió dedicarse a sembrar para otras personas, desde hace un año porque es una buena oportunidad de trabajar y ganar un dinero extra, además que cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores para el cuidado de sus chacras.
Cada día, esta trabajadora mujer se despierta con los primeros rayos de luz y trabaja como jornalera hasta la tarde, posteriormente verifica las labores de sus hijos en sus chacras y así termina el día muy cansada, pero con mucha fe de que algún día podrá realizar todo lo que tiene planeado.

Como Lucy es una mujer trabajadora y puntual, este ya es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y menciona que le gusta trabajar con los miembros de su banco comunal porque son muy personas muy responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir la construcción del piso de una de sus viviendas donde quiere implementar una tienda.
texts.en:
Lucy is a nice woman who lives with her husband, Cristóbal. She is 42 years old and has 4 children: Noemí-21, Jivan-18, Soledad-15, and Luis-13. They all share a little house in the Peruvian jungle.

She makes a living farming plantain, avocado, coffee, and citrus fruits on her own land. She also earns money working with her husband as a laborer on others' land. Although it is not much, it helps them with the expenses of the home. Nevertheless, little by little they are working on building two homes on the land close to their farmland.

Lucy decided to do farmwork for other people a year ago because it is a good opportunity to work and earn extra money, and she can also count on her older children's support in tending to their farmland. Every day, this hardworking woman gets up at first light and works as a day laborer until the afternoon, and then checks on her children's work in their fields and is very tired at the end of the day, but with a lot of faith that someday all her dreams will come true.

Becuase Lucy is such a hardworking and punctual woman, this is her fourth loan with MFP. She mentioned that she likes to work with the members of her community bank because they are very responsible people. She plans to use the money to construct the floor of one of her homes where she wants to start a store.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
Miguela tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo (Edgar) de 37 años y con sus 7 hijos: Jhonny de 21, Fiorella de 19, Flor de 17, Pamela de 16, Hayder de 14, Marisol de 13 y Leonard de 9 años. Aunque su familia es muy numerosa, viven todos juntos en su casa propia en la sierra del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura al lado de su esposo, siembran varios productos en sus fértiles chacras; entre ellas papa, alverja, habas, maíz y ollucos. Desde hace algunos años empezaron con pocas hectáreas, pero con el tiempo han podido ir ampliando sus tierras.
Adicionalmente, Miguela cría ganado vacuno, ovino, porcino, equino, cuyes y gallinas, lo que les permite vivir holgadamente, no pasar penurias económicas y juntar para la educación futura de sus hijos. 
Pero como Miguela no se duerme en sus laureles, también fabrica queso de la leche de sus animales, aunque en pocas cantidades. Todas las actividades que realiza las considera rentables, porque según sus propias palabras: “siempre se debe invertir bien y trabajar duro para salir adelante”. 
Por tal motivo; todos los días, desde muy temprano, se levanta a trabajar con mucha dedicación, por eso su familia es una de las más prósperas de la zona, pero ella considera que aún le falta mucho por crecer, pues tiene varios hijos y quiere que todos estudien una profesión en la ciudad.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene Miguela con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser puntual como en todas las actividades que realiza. Además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas a quienes ella conoce muy bien. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja para sembrar en grandes  cantidades y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Miguela is 39 years old and lives with her husband, Edgar, who is 37 years old, and their 7 children: Jhonny-21, Fiorella-19, Flor-17, Pamela-16, Hayder-14, Marisol-13, and Leonard-9. Even though her family is very large, they live toegether in their own home along the mountain range in Peru.

She makes a living in agriculture, alongside her husband. They farm many products on their fertile lands; among them, potatoes, peas, beans, corn, and olluco. Many years ago they began with few hectares, but with time they have been able to expand their property. Miguela also raises cows, sheep, pigs, horses, guinea pigs, and hens, allowing her to live comfortably, avoid economic hardships, and save for the future education of her children.

As Miguela is not one to rest on her laurels, she also makes cheese from the milk of her animals, although in small quantities. She considers all of her activities to be profitable, because, in her own words: "one must always invest well and work hard to get ahead". With that as her motive, every day she gets up very early to work with much dedication. Because of this, her family is one of the most prosperous of the region, but she thinks she still has a long way to go, since she has so many children and she wants them all to study a profession in the city.

This is the third loan that Miguela has had with MFP, and she promises to once more be punctual in everything she does. She is also in agreement with the work her community bank is doing because it is involving people she knows very well. The money she is requesting will be used to purchase pea seeds to sow in large quantities and be able to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet tiene 25 años, vive con su pareja (Eduardo) de 24 años, que estudia medicina veterinaria. Ellos tienen un hijo de 6 años, que es el motivo por el cual se esfuerzan a diario y a pesar de ser jóvenes quieren salir adelante para asegurar la educación de su hijo.

Ella es técnica en enfermería y trabaja en un Centro de Salud cercano a la zona donde vive, ahí atiende desde muy temprano a los múltiples pacientes que acuden diariamente al centro en busca de ayuda médica. 
A parte de esta encomiable labor, también ayuda en la chacra a su esposo donde cultivan frutas cítricas desde hace 5 años, además él está trabajando en una veterinaria.
El trabajo en el campo es cansado, pero ellos casi no descansan con tal de asegurar su futuro y llegar a tener una chacra más grande; es así como el trabajo del cultivo sumado, a las ganancias que tienen con sus otros trabajos pueden vivir cómodamente, y a pesar de ser una pareja muy joven siempre piensan en progresar para vivir mejor en el futuro.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Yanet con MFP y promete ser cumplida y responsable son sus pagos, como lo es en su vida diaria. A su vez, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque está conformado por personas responsables. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo, porque quieren asegurar las próximas cosechas.
texts.en:
Yanet is 25 years old lives and with her partner, Eduardo, who is 24 years old and studying veterinary medicine. They have a 6 year old son, who is their motivation for their work every day. Even though they are young, they want to get ahead in life to provide for their son's education.

She is a nurse technician and works at a health center close to where she lives. Starting early in the day she tends to the many patients who come to the center each day looking for medical assistance. In addition to this praiseworthy job, she also helps in her husband's fields where they have grown citrus fruit for 5 years. He also works at a veterinary clinic.

The work in the fields is tiring, but they almost never rest so that they can provide for the future and come to have a bigger plot of land. They are able to live comfortably from the combination of their work in the fields and their income from their other jobs, and despite being a very young couple they are always thinking of progressing and living better in the future.

This is the second loan Yanet has had with MFP and she promises to repay it and be responsible with her payments, just as she is every day of her life. She is very satisfied with the work of her community bank because it is made up of responsible people. The money she is asking for now will be invested to buy fertilizers for their farmlands, because they want to feel secure of the coming harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Faafiapoto

texts.en:
Faafiapoto is 32 and married with 3 children.  She owns & operates a plantation and a vegetable garden.  She has 3 years of experience in this business.    Faafiapoto needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Faafiapoto joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faafiapoto's 2nd loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

SPBD Social Metrics for this Borrower:
Overall Social Metric Score*:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3
