loans.name: Bertha Isabel

texts.es: Bertha Isabel G. D. P. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Paz. Ella posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, así mismo venD. ropa y zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños. Bertha es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual quiere volver a surtir su negocio, ya que ella casi pierD. su negocio debido a que se dedicó D. lleno a cuidar a su esposo mientras estuvo enfermo y el cual posteriormente falleció, ahora Bertha solicita un préstamo para poder comprar todo lo necesario para que pueda surtir D. nuevo su tienda, sobre todo con productos alimenticios y así mismo comprar una mayor variedad D. ropa y zapatos. Ella necesita mucho mejorar sus ventas, ya que no tiene ningún tipo D. ayuda extra, la tienda y las ventas D. accesorios personales es la única fuente D. ingresos que ella posee para poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha Isabel G. D. P. is 41 years old and lives in the provincial department of La Paz. She has a store selling perishable food items and clothing and shoes for men, women and children. Bertha is a very hardworking woman who wants to re-stock her store. She almost lost her business because while her husband was sick, she devoted herself to caring for her him. He later died. Now Bertha requests a loan to be able to buy everything necessary to stock her store anew with merchandise, especially with food products, and likewise a greater variety of clothing and shoes. She greatly needs to increase her sales, since she has not had any type of additional help and the store and her sales of personal accessories are the only sources of income that she has to be able to continue ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishable food products and shoes

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn L. lives in Preal Village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Sen Nouch, is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces some problems because his field has infertile soil and he does not have enough money for plowing. In order to solve these problems, Mrs. Chanthorn L. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for plowing.

Mrs. Chanthorn L. is 26 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband and a child are shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe M. M. de 23 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Rosario, ubicado en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de tres años de edad. Morena posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, así mismo tiene una venta de pupusas las cual las hace en la mañana y en la noche. Ella solícita un préstamos ya que desea poder surtir más la tienda, sobre todo con golosinas y jugos, ya que la tienda esta ubicada en el parque de la Residencia Santa Isabel, siempre en el municipio de El Rosario, este tipo de producto es muy vendido en el lugar, ya que llegan mucho niños a jugar ahí. Morena espera obtener mayores ganancias ya que ella desea poder mejorar la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe M. M. is 23 years old and lives in the town of El Rosario, located in the provincial department of La Paz. She lives with her life partner and her small son who is three years old. Morena has a store which sells basic necessities along with pupusas (tortillas stuffed with cheese or meat) that she makes in the morning and at night. She requests a loan to use to stock her store with candies and juices. The store is located in the Residencia Santa Isabel Park in the town of El Rosario. These types of products are often sold in this area, since many children come to play here. Morena hopes to obtain higher earnings so that she can provide better nutrition for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishable food products

location.town: El Rosario. departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Srey Cheat's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Cheat S. is the group leader of four members who all live in Krang Krachang village in Takeo province. She is a weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more raw materials to support her business. Her husband, Mr. Reth Saroung, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a construction worker. Mrs. Srey Cheat S. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: Martha Rosa A. de 29 años de edad, reside en Olocuilta en el departamento de La Paz, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero y sus dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar.  Martha como toda mujer responsable quien trabaja muy duro para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que también anhela brindarles una mejor vida a sus pequeños hijos, posee una venta de frutas y verduras, en la cual día con día trabaja arduamente por vender más por el bienestar de sus hijos. Martha solícita un préstamo para poder comprar más frutas, sobre todo uvas y manzanas las cuales se venden mucho en esta época navideña, así mismo surtirlo con verduras y especias. Ella desea aprovechar este fin de año para poder obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera permitirle a sus hijos poder tener un fin de año lleno de mucha ilusión y alegría.
texts.en:
Martha Rosa A. is 29 years old and lives in Oocuilta, a neighborhood of La Paz. She lives together with her husband who works as a carpenter and has two young children who are going to school. Martha is a very responsible woman who works hard to so she can help her husband with household expenses. She longs to bring a better life to her young children. She owns a stand where she sells fruit and vegetables in which she works day in day out arduously to sell more for the well being of her children.

Martha is requesting a loan so she can buy more fruit, like grapes and apples which are selling well in the Christmas season. As well, she is supplying vegetables and spices. She wishes to make the most of the end of the year so she can obtain the highest profits. In this way, she can help give her children a holiday season filled with hope and happiness.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

location.town: Olocuilta en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
N. Erdenetsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student and her youngest attends a local secondary school. Her husband works as a driver and operates a small transportation service. Erdenetsetseg operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She has a 0.4-hectare field where she grows her vegetables. Erdenetsetseg started her vegetable business in 2000 and has built a stable operation over the years. She has become an experienced vegetable grower and has a loyal base of customers that like her quality vegetables. Erdenetsetseg is working hard to continue her success in the future and hopes to expand. Her wish is to expand her field to one hectare so she can increase her output. She says, “Growing my business is important because I want to save money for my children's future.” Erdenetsetseg is requesting a 2,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase extra vegetables to sell in her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase extra vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pring

texts.en: Mrs. Pring I. lives I. Preal village I. Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. I. the rice production, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to plow the rice field. Her husband, Mr. Ses Huon, is a construction worker. Mrs. Pring I. is 37 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school. The other is just 3 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to plow the rice field.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth V. D. M. D. 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en la capital del país. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad. Ella fabrica ropa interior para niños y adultos, la cual la comercializa a diferentes clientes, los cuales la prefieren por ser una persona muy responsable la cual entrega su producto siempre a tiempo y el cual se dedica a realizarlo con mucha dedicación. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar aceite para el mantenimiento D. las máquinas D. coser, así mismo desea poder comprar hilos y telas. Ella espera mejorar las ventas D. su negocio, y D. esta manera incrementar su producción. Como toda madre comprometida, Ana Ruth espera poder brindarles una mejor vida a sus hijos, es por esto que se esfuerza a diario para poder ayudar  su esposo con todos los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth V. D. M., 42, lives in the Ilopango municipality, which is located in the capitol of the country. She lives with her husband and their three minor children. She makes underwear for children and adults. She sells them to different customers. They prefer her because she is a very responsible person, and she always delivers her product on time. She works with much dedication. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy oil for maintenance on her sewing machines. She also wishes to buy thread and fabric. She hopes to improve sales in her business by increasing her production. Like all dedicated mothers, Ana Ruth hopes to be able to give her children a better life. That is why she puts forth so much effort everyday. She also does it to be able to help her husband with all of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread and fabric

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
D. Batbayar is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His two boys, ages nine and six, attend a local secondary school. Batbayar makes clothes in his town with the help of his wife. They make a variety of traditional Mongolian clothing items. He also operates a seasonal dairy and raw materials business to supplement his income. He sells dairy products during the winter when they are in high demand and he sells raw materials during the summer and fall months. Batbayar started his clothing business in 2004 and started selling dairy and raw materials in 2007. He has had success with both businesses and continues to build on his experience as a businessman. Batbayar is very hardworking man who has strong desire to accomplish his goals. For the future, he says, “All I want is to own my own workspace.” He is requesting a 1,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase dairy products to sell this winter. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Mirella Del Carmen

texts.es: Mirella del Carmen L. D. C. D. 32 años, resiD. en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos menores D. edad. Mirella posee una sala D. belleza y una barbería la cual la atienden junto a su esposo, ella se encarga D. realizar el trabaja a las clientas y su esposo se encarga D. realizar el trabajo a los clientes masculinos.  Mirella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos para el cabello como tintes y tratamientos, todo D. primera calidad, con el fin D. poder brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, D. manera que estos sean clientes fieles a ella. Mirella trabaja en conjunto junto a su esposo por el bienestar D. su familia, ya que este negocio es su única fuente D. ingresos que ellos poseen, es por ello que su mayor deseo es surtir el salón D. belleza, D. manera que puedan incrementa sus márgenes D. ganancias, que es lo primordial para brindarles una vida estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirella del Carmen L. D. C. is 32 years old and lives in the department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband and her two young children. Mirella owns a beauty salon and barbershop where she works alongsiD. of her husband. She works with the female clients while her husband works with the men.

Mirella is asking for a loan to buy good quality hair products like hair dye and hair treatments. With these products, she and her her husband will be able to offer a better service to their clients and in turn their clients will remain loyal to them.

Mirella and her husband work for the wellbeing of their family. This business is their only source of income, which is why her greatest desire is to supply the beauty salon so that they can increase their income margin. Increasing their earnings is paramount to providing a stable life for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair products

loans.name: Deisy Marlene

texts.es: Deisy Marlene A. M. de 28 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 10 y 8 años de edad. Deisy se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la cual la comercializa de manera ambulante por las calles de Colón desde hace más de tres años. Desde muy temprano ella se dispone a vender lo más posible, con el deseo de percibir alguna ganancia lo cual le permita llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Si bien es cierto su esposo también trabaja, esto no da abasto para todos los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas, es por esto que Deisy solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad y diversidad de ropa, y de esta manera poder brindarles más opciones a sus clientes y así mismo captar la atención de nuevas consumidores de su producto.
texts.en:
Deisy Marlene A. M., 28, lives with her life partner and their two daughters, who are 10 and 8 years old, respectively, in Colón, La Libertad department. Daisy has peddled clothes in Colón's streets for the last 3 years. She starts out very early in the morning in order to sell the greatest quantity possible hoping to earn profits to contribute to household expenses. Even though her husband also works, he does not earn enough to cover all the household expenses and their daughters' educational costs. This is the reason why Deisy is requesting funding which will allow her to buy a larger quantity and variety of clothing so that she can offer her customers more options and, at the same time, attract new customers for her product.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Pok N. is the group leader of six members who all live in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Phan Phat, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a fisherman. Now Mrs. Pok N. is requesting a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to earn more income. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Teav

texts.en:
Mrs. Teav P. is 27 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Im Sineth, is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) plot of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he needs some money to hire labor for plowing and to buy pesticides to support his rice field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Teav P. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes.

This couple has a child who is three years old. Mrs. Teav P.’s husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire labor for plowing and to buy pesticides to support her husband's rice field

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel R. M. de 27 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de edad. Víctor es una persona muy trabajadora, quien se ha esforzado por tener su propio negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es muy difícil de sostenerlo a flote. El posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, los cuales son fundamentales en todo hogar. Es por ello que Victor solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir la tienda con más productos tales como embutidos, pan, detergentes, entre otros más. Esto lo hace con el fin de poder mejorar su negocio y así mismo las ventas de este. Víctor se ha esforzado mucho por tener lo que hasta ahora ha obtenido, lo cual lo llena de satisfacción al verlo reflejado en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel R. M. is 27 years old. He lives in Colón, in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and their two young daughters. Victor is a hard-working person and has strived to have his own business, which is often difficult to keep afloat. He has a store that sells products for general needs that are necessary in every home. Victor is requesting a loan so that he can stock his store with more products such as cold meats, bread, and detergents, amongst others, in the hopes of improving his business and its sales. Victor has strived hard to have what he now has. It fills him with satisfaction to see it reflecting in the wellbeing of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general store supplies

loans.name: Viena

texts.en:
Viena is 51 and married with 7 children (ages 15-30).  She owns & operates a business venture, selling a variety of different products in the local community.  She has 5 years of experience in this business.    Viena needs a loan of WST $2000 to invest in renovating the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2007, Viena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Viena's 4th loan with SPBD. 

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto E. M. de 27 años de edad, reside en Colón en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos, uno de 6 años y los gemelos de a penas un año de edad. Jorge tiene un microbus (nombre por el cual se le conoce a los buses pequeños en nuestro país), en el cual transporta a persona de oficinas a sus diferentes lugares de trabajo. Jorge depende únicamente de este modo de trabajo para mantener a su familia, es por esto que él solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar los repuestos necesarios para el microbus y así mismo llevarlo a la revisión de mantenimiento del mismo. Todo esto lo hace ya que desea poder brindar un mejor servicio en el cual sus clientes puedan viajar de una manera más segura, así mismo porque se siente muy afortunado de contar con medio de transporte el cual le permite obtener las ganancias necesaria para el sostén de su familia, es por ello que para Jorge es muy importante cuidar la fuente de trabajo que posee.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto E. M. is 27 years old. He lives in Colón, in the department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife and their three children, a six-year old and twins that are barely a year old. Jorge has a microbus business (the name that small busses are called in his country), in which he brings people to offices and different workplaces. Jorge depends solely on this work to support his family, for which he requests a loan so that he can pay for the necessary repairs for the microbus and also bring it in for a tune-up. In this way, he can offer better service to his customers so that they can travel in a more secure manner. Also, he feels very fortunate to have his own means of transport that allows him to obtain earnings necessary for his family’s sustenance. For this reason, Jorge feels it very important to care for the source of his work.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for repairs and maintenance

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es: José Santos A. M. de 38 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a las labores domésticas y tres hijos de 17, 13 y  11 años de edad, respectivamente. José Santos se dedica a la venta de zapatos deportivos en una de las zonas más comerciales del pueblo de Ilobasco ubicado en el departamento de Cabañas. Debido a que el fin de años es una temporada en la cual las personas aprovechan para comprar muchos productos y sobre todo de uso personal, José Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de zapatos, así mismo desea ampliar su negocio y comprar jeans para hombre y mujer, los cuales se venden mucho en esta temporada navideña. José Santos anhela poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia en todo tiempo, es por ello que desea invertir en su negocio y de esta manera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
José Santos A. M. is 38 years old and lives in San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife, who does the housework, and his three children aged 17, 13, and 11. José Santos works in sneaker sales in the busy commercial district of the town Ilobasco, in the department of Cabañas. Because the end of the year is a season when many people are shopping, mostly for personal items, José Santos requests a loan so that he can purchase more shoes. Also, he would like to expand his business and purchase jeans for men and women, which he can sell during the Christmas season. José Santos yearns to offer the best to his family at all times. It is for this reason that he wants to invest is his business and improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes and pants

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos M. D. M. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en San José Villanueva ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad tales como café en polvo, arroz, pan entre otros más. Así mismo venD. sandalias para hombre y mujer. La señora Santos solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar granos básicos, embutidos, golosinas, y todo lo que pueda contribuir a que ella obtenga mayor clientela. La señora Santos goza D. muy buena reputación entre sus vecinos, ya que la reconocen como una persona muy respetuosa y amable, lo cual le beneficia ya que las personas prefieren ir a comprar a su tienda, es esto junto a su familia lo que la incentiva a seguir adelante y a surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Santos M. D. M., 41, lives in San José Villanueva which is in La Libertad department. She lives with her husband and two sons. She has a small grocery store where she stocks basic household items like instant coffee, rice, bread, among others. She also sells women's and men's sandals. She is requesting financing to buy basic grains, cured meats, sweets and everything else she needs which will contribute to her winning over more customers. She enjoys a very good reputation among her neighbors because she is recognized as being very repectful and kind which benefits her because people prefer to patronize her store rather than others. All this is with her family which is the motivating force behind her desire to get ahead and stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cured meats and basic grains.

location.town: San José Villanueva, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en:
Leaso F. is 61 and divorced with 4 children (ages 27 - 38).  She owns & operates a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  She has 2 years of experience in this business.    Leaso F. needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 160 talas or US $67 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Leaso F. joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Leaso F.'s 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Leaso's Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD:  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase sugar, styrofoam cups, and codial (flavoring)

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosa del Carmen G. de 30 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 11, 9, 7 años de edad. Ella posee una venta de productos varios en el mercado de San Martín, entre los productos que comercializa están los frijoles, arroz y azúcar, así mismo vende especias, leche en polvo y otros productos más. Rosa solícita un préstamo ya que desea comprar una mayor variedad de productos de primera necesidad y todas al por mayor. Con esto Rosa desea mejorar sus ventas y poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con los estudios de sus hijos, ya que como toda madre le preocupa mucho que sus hijos cuenten con la alimentación correcta y con las mejores condiciones de vida posible.
texts.en:
Rosa del Carmen G. is 30 years old and lives in San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and three children aged 7, 9, and 11 years old. She sells various products in the market in San Martín. Among the products she sells are beans, rice, sugar, spices, and powdered milk.

Rosa is asking for a loan in order to buy a variety of basic products wholesale. With the loan, Rosa hopes to increase her sales so that she can help her husband with household expenses and the school fees of her children, since like all mothers she thinks a lot about getting her children the proper nutrition and best quality of life possible.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying perishable products

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa T. is from the village of Primicias, Mapandan, Pangasinan. She is 44 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Elisa owns and operates a business running a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Elisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia S. A. de 21 años de edad, reside en San Martín, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus padres y su pequeño hijo de siete años de edad. A su corta edad Rosa debe luchar arduamente por su hijo, ya que es madre soltera y ella es la única que vela por el bienestar de su pequeño. Rosa posee una venta de ropa para niños y adultos, negocio en el cual lleva tres años y medio trabajando. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando más ropa de diversas tallas y colores de manera que pueda llamar la atención de la mayor clientela posible. Ella como muchas otras personas tiene la ilusión de poder vender más en esta época navideña, es por esto que desea surtir su negocio lo más antes posible y poder aprovechar este mes que es tan lleno de ilusión tanto para niños como para adultos.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia S. A., 21, lives in San Martín which is in San Salvador department. She lives with her parents and her 7-year-old son. At her young age, Rosa has had to struggle mightily for her son's well-being since she is a single mother and the only one who watches over him. Rosa has sold clothing for children and adults for the past 3 and a half years. She is requesting funding to stock her business with clothing of various sizes and colors so that she can attract the attention of the largest number of customers possible. She, like many others, hopes to be able to sell more during the Christmas season and this is why she wants to have her store stocked the soonest possible to take advantage of this month which is so full of hope children and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia M. R. de 53 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos. Ella tiene su propio negocio en el cual se encarga de hacer pupusas y de elaborar almuerzos. María es muy solicitada por las personas, debido a que es muy aseada y excelente cocinera, ya que posee más de cinco años de experiencia en la cocina. María solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar materia prima como maíz, frijoles y queso para la elaboración de la comida. Esto debido a que desea poder atender una mayor cantidad de clientes y esto es posible si solamente cuenta con más materia prima.
texts.en:
María Eugenia M. R., 53, lives in the La Libertad department with her husband and their three children. She has her own business; she makes “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and prepares lunches. María is is very popular because she is a very clean and excellent cook. She has over five years experience in the kitchen. María is asking for a loan to be able to buy raw material like corn, beans, and cheese to make food. This is because she wants to be able to take care of a larger quantity of customers. It is only possible if she has the raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make food

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en:
Anselmo B. is from the village of NHA, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 46 years old. Anselmo is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Anselmo owns & operates a business in the retail and service sector. His main source for generating revenue is managing a carenderia / food stall and at the same time runs a boarding house for rent in the local community. Anselmo has been running his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anselmo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and enable himself to engage in business activities. Anselmo is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Anselmo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: NHA, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia C. S. de 60 años de edad, reside en Lourdes en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su hija y dos nietos de 12 y 8 años de edad. La señora Julia posee  una venta de frutas y verduras, las cual las vende en su casa y también cuenta con una venta en el mercado Municipal de Ateos, ubicada en el mismo departamento de La Libertad. Julia ha trabajado mucho por seguir adelante con su negocio, ya que se ha esforzado por poder surtirlo con todo lo que tiene hasta ahora. Ella solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar la cantidad de frutas y verduras, ya que en la zona que ella se encuentra vende muy fácil su producto y es necesario poder contar con más para obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales son fundamentales para su economía.
texts.en:
Julia C. S., 60, lives in Lourdes, which is in La Libertad department. She lives with her daughter and two grandsons, who are 12 and 8 years old. Julia is a fruit and vegetable merchant. She sells both from her home and from a stall she has in the Ateos municipal market, which is also in La Libertad department. Julia has struggled to get ahead with her business and has made the effort to stock it with all she has up to now. However, she would now like financing to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables because the area she is located in permits her to have good sales and she could earn higher profits, which are the basis of her family finances, with a wider selection of items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Fiona's Group

texts.en: M. Fiona is a hard working and devoted lady and a single mother of three children aged 18, 15 &12 years as she takes care of orphans and grandchildren. Fiona has a drug shop in Magamaga East and when she had just started her business 12 years ago. She sells over the counter medicines that are used for treatments at home. Being a professional and having enough experience has attracted more customers to her business. She hopes to expand her drug shop to start admission sessions and to educate her children and complete building her house.

loans.use: Restocking her drug shop with more medicines.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina C. D. F. D. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella vive junto a su esposo D. 65 años D. edad y su nieto D. 16 años. Catalina es una mujer muy fuerte la cual es conocida por ser responsable y buena persona, muy colaboradora y solidaria con los demás. Ella posee una venta D. tortillas la cuales las elabora y comercializa al mediodía, las tortillas son un alimento básico dentro D. los platillos salvadoreños, es por esto que se venden en cualquier lugar del país y cuenta con mucha demanda. La señora Catalina, solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar maíz para la elaboración D. las tortillas, todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. contar con más material para poder vender más su producto y así mejorar sus ventas y contribuir junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Catalina C. D. F., 54, lives in Ciudad Arce, which is in La Libertad department, with her 65-year-old husband and her 16-year-old grandson. Catalina is a strong woman who is known for being a responsible and good person; very cooperative and helpful to others. She makes tortillas for sale at noon. Tortillas are a basic element of Salvadoran dishes so they are sold all over the country and are in high demand. Catalina is requesting funding to buy corn for her tortillas. She does all this hoping to have more supplies with which to increase production so that her sales will improve and, together with her husband, be able to cover household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Kasara

texts.en: Kasara J. is currently in the business of selling beans, sugar ,soap. etc. in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Kasara is 20 years old and is Married with a husband that is an engineer. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build her own shop.

loans.use: stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Arely

texts.es: Sandra Arely L. D. E. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Zaragoza en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a sus dos hijos uno D. 12 y otro D. 3 años D. edad.  Ella posee un taller D. costura en el cual se encarga D. realizar ropa para niños y adultos, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Dueñas en Santa Tecla, el cual es un lugar muy estratégico para la venta. Sandra solícita un préstamo, para poder comprar tela, hilos y botones para la elaboración D. uniformes y pants. Debido a que el mes D. enero es el mes en el cual las personas mandan a hacer los uniformes para sus hijos, Sandra espera contar con todos los materiales necesarios. Sandra desea aumentar sus ventas y poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, ya que es madre soltera y debe esforzarse el doble por suplir todas las necesidades D. sus hijos. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora que vela por el bienestar D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra Arely L. D. E., 34, lives in Zaragoza in the La Libertad department. She lives with her two children. One is 12, and the other is 3. She has a sewing shop where she makes clothes for children and adults. It is located in the Dueñas Market in Santa Tecla. It is a very strategic place for sales. Sandra is asking for a loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, and buttons to make uniforms and pants. January is the month when people have uniforms maD. for their children. Sandra hopes to have all of the necessary materials. Sandra wishes to increase her sales and be able to pay for all of the household expenses. She is a single mother, and she must put fourth twice the effort to supply her children with the necessities. Sandra is characterized as being a strong and hard-working woman who watches our for her children’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana L. is from the village of Oraan West Manaoag, Pangasinan. She is 56 years old. Feliciana is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Feliciana owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Feliciana has been apart of her business for over a year.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina M. is from the village of Laturan , Libona Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Saturnina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Saturnina has been working in this business for over 20 years.

In 2007, Saturnina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saturnina has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Saturnina is requesting a new loan which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Saturnina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena T. is from the village of Primicias Mapandan, Pangasinan. She is 42 years old. Rowena is married and has one child in school. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from vending of vegetables through a rolling store. Rowena has been running this business for over 1 years.

In 2009, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Rowena is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora G. is from the village of Laturan Libona Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Flora is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns, operates a business venture in the food sector making, and selling food as well in service sector.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products like viands and rice, she also accept t-shirts printing in the local community. Flora has been apart of her business for over 15 years.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia E. is from the city of Gracia Village, Urdaneta. She is 45 years old, married, and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years a month.

In 2009, Alicia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Alicia is requesting a new loan of which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alicia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith C. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio Misamis Occ. She is 22 years old. Judith is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia R. is currently in the business of selling maize and millet flour in the market and is requesting a loan to stock rice and more bags of maize to sell.  Cicilia is 48 years old and is Divorced.   She has 4 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: stock rice and more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Nsimya Group, Jinja

texts.en:
N. Jamilah is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a hardworking lady and the mother of four children. She also takes care of some other orphans.

Jamilah is a businesswoman involved in a fish selling business from Nsimya village and this has been her business for a very long time.

Before having access to loans, Jamilah’s business had limited capital. Together with her group members, she needs a loan to expand her business by buying more fish for resale so that she is able to make profits and savings for her children’s education come next year.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline A. is from the town of Cabilaoan, Laoac, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Evangeline owns and operates a business tending a canteen near the school. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Evangeline joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en: Irenia S. is from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Irenia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Irenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Irenia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji G. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock soft drinks like sodas, packed juice and water.

Keji is 40 years old and is divorced. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bigger restaurant.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock soft drinks like sodas, packed juice and water

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita E. is from the village of Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Nenita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products and snacks such as shampoo, toothpaste, canned goods, noodles, soap, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora B. is from the town of Payas, Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 37 years old and is single. Nora owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.en: Anna I. is 49 years old and married with one child. Her daughter is 28 years old, married, and takes care of 4 orphans. Anna has a retail shop and animal husbandry businesses. The shop was her first business and in order to improve the quality of life for her family. She started the animal husbandry business, although during the dry season, the food for the animals is scarce and there is high competition with her shop. In Anna’s shop, she sells sugar, salt, maize flour, etc,; with the cows, she sells milk for a daily income. She is able to make 40,000 UGX a week in profit and in the future she would like to change her retail shop into a hardware shop and to expand her animal husbandry business. She also hopes to build another residential house that is more presentable. Anna needs a loan to be able to improve the corral for the animals by buying materials to construct it. She is such a hard working lady.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for improving her corral at home.

loans.name: Suku

texts.en:
Suku C. currently sells tomatoes at her local market and is requesting a loan to purchase additional items to sell including rice, beans, and sweet potatoes.  Suku is 31 years old and her husband is a soldier. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the additional income from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a retail shop.


About BRAC
 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase additional food to sell

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: D. Lhagvasuren is 37 years old and lives with her husband and son in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a "ger". Her 15-year-old son attends a local secondary school and her husband works as a driver. Lhagvasuren operates a machine oil business in her town. She started her business in 2004 and has built a stable business over the years. This year, in addition to machine oil, Lhagvasuren started selling socks to supplement her income. For the future, she hopes to build on her past success and is focused on improving her business. She is requesting a 800,000 tugrug (550 USD) loan to purchase oil and socks for her business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: to purchase oil and socks for her business

loans.name: Darhanbat

texts.en:
D. Darhanbat is 47 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Zavhan province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian tent. His son and daughter are both university students and his wife works at the local hospital as a nurse. 

Darhanbat operates a small transportation service in his town. He drives local residents where they want to go in the area. His business has been successful and he has built a reputation as a good driver. He is saving money and hopes to expand his operation in the near future. Eventually he plans to purchase a large bus to expand his service. 

Darhanbat is working hard for the future and says, “all I want is to support my children so they will have happy lives.” He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (550 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his business.

loans.use: to purchase machinery parts

loans.name: Kabang

texts.en:
Kabang G. is currently in the business of selling bread and cakes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking flour and make cakes to sell. Kabang is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more baking flour and make cakes to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina L. is from the town of Carosucan Sta. Barbara, Pangasinan. She is 41 years old. Marcelina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marcelina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Marcelina is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Marcelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are comprised mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Normalita

texts.en:
Normalita L. is from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Normalita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Normalita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Normalita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
O. Enhbayar is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a "ger". His wife works as a cleaner for a private company and his two daughters both attend a local secondary school.

Enhbayar has operated a transportation business in his town since 2000. He previously worked as a carpenter for several years. At first he had only his personal car which he used as a taxi to transport people. After having success as a taxi driver he used his savings to purchase a truck which he uses to transport goods for people.

Enhbayar continues to work hard to grow his business. He hopes to save enough money to improve his truck and support his daughters' education. He says, “I will work hard support my daughters' future.” He is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~560 USD) loan to purchase machinery parts for his car and a new refrigerator for his home.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

She is 43 years old and married with 7 children, and also cares for 1 grandchild and 1 orphan.

The group has been together for a long time and all members agree that with the loans, life has improved a lot and this has enabled them to send their children to school. Grace would like a loan to expand her business by buying more millet since at the moment, she is able to make 150,000/= as profit a week. She is able to win more customers compared to her competitors because she has music in her bar and she chats with all her customers equally. She hopes to enlarge her bar and include the sale of beer as well as constructing a house and educating her children to university level. She needs a loan to help buy a bag of millet to increase her capital base.

loans.name: Neonita

texts.en: Neonita S. is 53 years old and her husband, Reynaldo, works as a carpenter. For the past twenty years the couple have tried very hard to have a child but they have not been blessed by one. They live in the village of Barangay Bilan, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Neonita wants only to continue her business and live a simple life. Even though she has no children to care for and prepare for their education, Neonita wants to make their living more comfortable and to save a portion of their income for their future. This triggered Neonita to open a general store. The small business is adjacent to their house where she earns a small amount because she only sells important goods for households until such time as she is able to expand her business which will benefit her. In 2001, Neonita became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and was able to get a loan for her general store. From the loan and business income, her general store is maximized and has contributed tremendously to the family. As her loans continue, her business improves and now earns a minimum of Php 10,000 per month which she uses for their expenses but saves most of it for her future. Neonita's previous loan of Php 15,000 was utilized for her general store and it was fully repaid in full and on-time without delay. Now on her 14th loan, she is borrowing the same amount of Php 15,000 as an additional working capital for her business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Raïmatou

texts.fr: Y. Raïmatou est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Raïmatou réside à Sènadé, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis environs 30 ans. Mariée à MOUSTAPHA Ibrahim, Raïmatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Raïmatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Raïmatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Raïmatou n'a fait que l'école primaire. Il y a près de 15 ans, Raïmatou vend des ustensiles de cuisine (plats, verres à boire, bols, gobelets, glacières, etc.) à son domicile. C'est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Raïmatou s'approvisionne. Raïmatou est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits dans l'institution. Raïmatou a toujours bien remboursé ses crédits. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et de développer davantage son activité, pour mieux satisfaire ses clients, Raïmatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Raïmatou Y. was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the commercial capital of Bénin. Raïmatou has lived in Sènadé, a neighborhood in Cotonou, for about 30 years. Married to Ibrahim Moustapha, Raïmatou is the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives together with her children and husband. Raïmatou assists her husband in managing the responsibilities of the household. Raïmatou herself did not receive any education past grammar school. For nearly 15 years, Raïmatou has sold dishes and cooking utensils (plates, drinking glasses, bowls, goblets, ice-boxes, etc.) from her home. She stocks her merchandise from Nigeria, a border country to Bénin. Raïmatou is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already profited from three loans with the institution, all of which she has fully repaid. After increasing her working capital and developing more business, Raïmatou seeks a fourth loan from ALIDé in order to better serve her clientele.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sets of dishes for resale
