Nadezhda is married with a grown daughter. She is a small entrepreneur from Zaporozhye where she sells jean clothing in Angolenko market. Nadezhda owns a vending kiosk in the central row of the marketplace. Her kiosk stands out as it offers a nice selection of jean clothing items of good quality at reasonable prices. Nadezhda has been n this business for eight years. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly profit is 2,000 Grivnyas. 

Nadezhda is seeking a loan of 12,400 Grivnyas to re-stock the winter clothing assortment that she offers for sale in her vending kiosk. We believe her perseverance, managing skills and enthusiasm will help her achieve her goal and succeed in business.

loans.use: To restock winter clothing

loans.name: Mohamed B

texts.en:
Mohamed B. T. is a vendor who sells VCR tapes, DVDs and mobile accessories. He is married with four children, two boys and two girls. The eldest, who is a girl, is attending the Senior Secondary School, and the rest are in primary school. Mohamed and his wife sell together to make sure their business is safe.
 
His shop is located at the center of the town and is made of wood materials. He has been in business for about seven years and he normally goes to Freetown to get his goods twice a week.

Mohamed intends to expand his shop and increase inventory as he seeks this loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: K. Aminatou est née en 1956 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Aminatou vit au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, il y a environs 30 ans. Aminatou est mariée à WABI Mounirou et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Aminatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Aminatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, Aminatou s'est mise à vendre divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sucre, lait, sardines, conserves, bougies, papiers hygiéniques, dentifrices, beurre, couscous, etc.), pour faire face à ses besoins. Aminatou s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et vend ses produits dans son quartier à Minontchou. Aminatou exerce cette activité depuis environs 25 ans. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Aminatou voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement, ce qui lui permettra de mieux développer son activité et de mieux satisfaire ses clients. C'est pourquoi, Aminatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Aminatou K. was born in 1956 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Aminatou has lived in the district of Minontchou in Cotonou, the commercial capital of Benin, for about 30 years. She is married to Mounirou Wabi and has four children, all in school. Aminatou lives together with her husband and children and helps her husband with the household responsibilities. Having stopped her schooling after high school, Aminatou began selling various products (pasta, sugar, milk, sardines, pickles, candles, toilet paper, toothpaste, butter, couscous, etc.) in order to support herself. Aminatou stocks her merchandise from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and sells her products in her neighborhood in Minontchou. She has done this for about 25 years. Aminatou is an old client of ALIDé, having already profited from three loans, which she has completely repaid. Aminatou would like to increase her working capital, which will allow her to better develop her business and better satisfy her clientele. This is why Aminatou is seeking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying foodstuffs and household goods

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a 12-year-old daughter. She sells cosmetics and perfumes in one of the local markets in Zaporozhye. Irina owns two vending locations in the same marketplace. She has a loyal clientele. Her customers buy from her because she has affordable prices in comparison to other entrepreneurs working with the same type of merchandise. Irina has been in this trade for eight years. She has 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming holiday season. Irina’s sales always get a boost at Christmas and New Year’s. She believes the generated profit will not only help her keep a stable position in the market, but will also offer a better livelihood for her family. Irina has been a role model of discipline, accuracy and responsibility. We believe perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her succeed in trade and repay her current loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia G. lives in the village of Sitio Nasug-ong, Brgy Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She is 64 years old, married to Jorge, and has three adult children. She wants only to continue improving the living conditions of her family through her business and be able to save a portion of her income for the future.

In the past, Sonia already owned a small business that helped in sustaining their family needs and increased the income of the family, especially for their children who were in school. Her business continued and earned, but Sonia wanted to sell additional products in her store for additional income. That's why, in 1995, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: to have an additional capital for her general store. She was very thankful for the loans because it contributed more income for her family. From that income, she was able to renovate their house and was able to build a concrete toilet. As her loans got bigger, the business grew and earned a minimum monthly income of 5,000 PHP. This income was used for her household needs and she saved some of it for her future.

Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP was used as an additional working capital for her general store, where she bought different kinds of new products to sell. The loan was paid on a weekly basis, on time, and was fully paid within her loan term with any delay. She maintained her good record with NWTF-PD. Her present loan is for the same amount of 25,000 PHP, which she will use for her general store as an additional working capital.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has  earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for general store

loans.name: Ogboko

texts.en:
Ogboko is a 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a printer and he also supports the home. Ogboko hopes that her children will be graduates in the future. Her eldest child is 12 years old. 

Ogboko sells beef in an open section of the market in Agbor, Delta State. She started this business 15 years ago. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more beef to sell and attract more customers to her business. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beef to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell. Rose is 22 years old and is married to an office messenger. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata S. is a vendor who sells electronic accessories. She is married to a businessman and they sell together at the shop. They have four children and four other additional dependents who help with the business. 

Aminata's shop is located at the common market area of Shenge. She has ten years of business experience and is a high school graduate. She serves as an agent for an electronic accessories shop based in Freetown. She is seeking a loan to be able to buy additional inventory to meet her market needs and attend to her family needs.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia N. lives in the village of Prk. Purita Tanulo, Brgy Pilar, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is 44 years old. Her husband, Ricardo, operates their motorboat for fishing and also helps her in running an oyster and crabs business. They have four children ranging in age from 4 to 24 years old. Alicia wants her children to finish their studies and get good jobs, to help her husband for additional income, and hopes that their businesses will continue to bring more blessings to the family.

When Alicia was still single, she would help her parents in running the business of oyster breeding until such time when her parents gave her a portion of their oyster breeding business for her to manage. She managed it well and was able to contribute income to her family. When she got married, she continued her business and her husband invested in the oyster business for expansion. 

In 2001, Alicia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to have an additional capital for her business. To expand, she needed bamboo, nets, rope and other materials for good results and better income. As the loan continued, she was able to buy a motorized boat for fishing, which was used in catching crabs. In their business she was able to earn a minimum of 10,000 PHP per month. This income was utilized for the education of their children and some were used to defray family expenses.

Alicia's previous loan of 19,500 PHP was fully utilized for her oyster breeding and the amount was fully paid on time without any delay. Now on her eighth cycle loan, the same amount of 19,500 PHP will be used for fishing and oyster breeding.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project "Dungganon" (a Hiligaynon word that means "Honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to  achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" -  a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Working capital for fishing and oyster breeding businesses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with six children. Her eldest is 22 years old and attending university. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports the home. She is 47 years old. 

She owns a stall in the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Ameru

texts.en:
Ameru D. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread. She is requesting a loan to stock more powdered milk and make more tea to sell.  Ameru is 31 years old and married to a cattle keeper. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy cows and goats for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more powdered milk and make more tea to sell

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children. Her eldest is 25 years old. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports the home. She is 40 years old. 

She owns a stall in the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits. 

She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma M. is from Dapdap, a resettlement area established after the pyroclastic flow from Mt. Pinatubo’s spectacular eruption in 1991 destroyed the village of San Roque, among others. Dapdap is located in Central Luzon in Tarlac, a municipality of Bamban Province. Alma is 45 years old, married and has five adult children. Alma owns and runs a general store stocked with a variety of different products which she sells to the local community. She has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Alma is requesting a loan from ASKI, her fourth, of 12,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Alma successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, also used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and –women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jerusalin

texts.en:
Jerusalin A., from the village of Canaway, Tibanga, is 23 years old and has an infant. To make a living, Jerusalin sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jerusalin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canaway, Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: H. Pélagie est née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKANRIN Justin, un professeur, Pélagie est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Pélagie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Irédé à Cotonou, depuis trois ans. Pélagie vient en aide à son mari dans l'entretien et l'éducation des enfants. Pélagie a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Depuis 10 ans environs, Pélagie vend des produits cosmétiques et des désodorisants à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Pélagie s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bénéficié déjà de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Pélagie a bien remboursé les trois crédits qu'elle a obtenus. Pélagie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
Pélagie H. was born in 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Justin Hounkanrin, a teacher, and the mother of two children who attend school. Pélagie has been living for three years with her children and husband in the neighborhood of Irédé in Cotonou. Pélagie supports her husband in providing for their children and paying their school fees. She herself attended school until secondary level.

Pélagie sells cosmetics and deodorants in Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. She gets her supplies from Lomé in Togo, a country adjoining Benin. She is a long-standing client with Alidé and got already three loans which she repaid on schedule. Pélagie came to Alidé and applied for a fourth loan to boost her business and better meet the demand from her customers.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy body milk, perfume and deodorants

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Бахтиер Хайдаров проживает в Вахшском районе. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Бахтиер по специальности "механик". Он более 5 лет занимается услугой такси по городу Душанбе. Кредит просит для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Bahtier H. lives in the Vakhsh district. He is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. Bahtier is a mechanic by trade. He has been providing taxi service in the city of Dushanbe for over 5 years. He is requesting a loan for the repair of his car in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita S. is a 56-year-old mother with five grown-up children. She works hard to achieve her simple dreams: to improve the living conditions of her family and to send her youngest child to college to have a good job. Nenita lives in the village of Sitio Nasug-ong, Brgy Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Oscar, helps her in the business but only for a limited amount of time because he also has a job.

Because Nenita wanted to help her husband improve their living conditions, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in the year 2000 and started her own business. She put up a general store adjacent to her house where it helps her to meet their household needs. As the loans continued, she also invested in a networking business with Avon, Natasha and MSE products. With this additional income, she earns 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month, most of which is saved for college education and household needs.

Nenita's previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used as additional capital for her general store business. This loan was repaid to NWTF-PD in full and on time. Presently, with a loan of 16,000 PHP, she purchased additional inventory for her general store and networking business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a general store

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebbeca D. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from home and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal to sell. Rebbeca is 29 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

About BRAC: BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Мухидинов Иброхим проживает в Сарбандском районе. Возраст 38 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Иброхим имеет среднее образование, он более 11 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном торгует он овощами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Ibrohim M. lives in the Sarband district. He is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. Ibrohim has secondary education. He has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 11 years. Ibrohim primarily sells vegetables. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel, 45 years old, owns a stall at the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam wholesale and retail to her customers. Yams are eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits.

Mabel is married with five children. Her eldest is 23 years old. Her husband is a welder and he also works to support the family. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is from the city of Balutu Concepcion Tarlac. She is 51 years old. Lourdes is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lourdes runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
Celyn C. is from the village of Zone 1 B, Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 26 years old. Celyn is single. To make a living, Celyn runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Celyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Celyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Celyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Celyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Zulhiya

texts.ru: Зарипова Зулхия проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, детей не имеет. Муж работает в местной строительной компании. Сама Зулхия более 2 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает скот для продажи. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Zulhiya Z. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. She is 22 years old, married and has no children. Her husband works at a local construction company. Zulhiya has been involved in animal husbandry for over 2 years. She raises livestock for sale. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Moynatou

texts.fr: M. Moynatou est née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Moynatou vit depuis près de 15 ans au quartier Minontchou à Cotonou. Mariée à ACHAMOU Ousmane, Moynatou est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Moynatou vient en aide à son mari dans l'entretien et l'éducation de son enfant. Ayant arrêté l'école au cours secondaire, Moynatou s'est mise dans la vente de sous-vêtements, et également des tissus à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Moynatou s'approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin. C'est depuis 7 ans que Moynatou mène cette activité. Moynatou est est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Moynatou voudrait augmenter son fonds de roulement et développer plus l'activité de la vente de tissus. C'est pourquoi, Moynatou sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Moynatou M. was born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Moynatou has lived in the Minontchou area of Cotonou for close to 15 years. Married to Ousmane Achamou, Moynatou is the mother of one child, who is in school. Moynatou helps her husband in providing for the education of her child. Having stopped going to school at the secondary level, Moynatou started selling undergarments as well as fabric at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Moynatou gets her supplies at Lomé in Togo, a country bordering Benin. Moynatou has run this business for 7 years. Moynatou is a longstanding client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and has already benefited from three loans through the institution, all of which were repaid properly. Moynatou would like to increase her working capital and further develop her business selling fabric. This is why Moynatou is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of fabric and undergarments

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with five children. Her husband is a trader and he also supports the home. She is 38 years old. She owns a stall in the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers. Yams can be eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits. 

She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Dembe Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Adi M. is the leader of his lending association in Jinja. This loan group is an association of taxi drivers from Jinja Taxi Park who got together because they are in the same business. They all own and operate long-distance taxis that transport passergers from Jinja to Mbale, Kayunga, Kampala, Malaba and other towns, in addition to providing in-town services. 

Adi needs a loan to help repair his taxi so that it can earn him the necessary income. He is a married man with school-going children. He is also a farmer and he employs laborers to help with his farm.

loans.use: To repair his taxi and employ laborers on his farm

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel M. is from the village of San Jose in Concepcion, Tarlac. She is 26 years old. Maricel is married. To make a living, Maricel works in a family member's business selling general farm supplies and equipment to local farmers. Maricel is just starting to work in this business.

In 2009, Maricel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to expand the business. This will be Maricel's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ifeyinwa

texts.en:
Ifeyinwa is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a trader and he also supports their home. 

Ifeyinwa is 40 years old. She owns an open space in the market in Agbor, Delta State where she sells tubers of yam and cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. In Nigeria, yams can be eaten boiled, roasted, or fried. The demand for her yams is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits. 

She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Bachira

texts.fr: S. Bachira est née en 1974 à Sakété, dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Mariée à MOUNIROU Issiaka, Bachira est mère de quatre enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Bachira vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Adogléta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis trois ans de cela que Bachira vit dans ce quartier. Bachira vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Bachira n'a fait que l'école primaire. Depuis près de 15 ans, Bachira vend des tissus (bazins) à Missèbo à Cotonou. C'est à Lomé au Togo, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Bachira s'approvisionne. C'est la première fois que Bachira sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui servira à agrandir son activité et à mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Bachira S. was born in 1974 in Sakété, in the department of l'Ouémé in Benin. Married to Issiaka Mounirou, Bachira is the mother of four children. Some of the children are in school. Bachira lives together with her children and husband in the Adogléta area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Bachira has lived in this area for three years. Bachira helps her husband provide for the family. Bachira only completed her primary education. For close to 15 years, Bachira has sold fabric (damask) at Missèbo in Cotonou. It is in Lomé, Togo, a country bordering Benin, that Bachira gets her supplies. This is the first time Bachira is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners); this loan will help her enlarge her business and better satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric (damask)

loans.name: Bibi Begam Group

texts.en:
Gull Soma is the group leader of Bibi Begam group. There are four members in this group. Gull Soma is a married woman. She is 50 years old with four children in her house. Gull Soma wants to take a loan for her son's general store. He sells different kinds of things. He wants to purchase more good quality materials for his shop. In fact, his main purpose is to attract more clients and to purchase the things which are in high demand in his market.

Bibi Begam and Hafeza want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They need six machines and a desk for their business in her house. They want to buy the necessary materials for their business. Rahema wants to take a loan for her son's business selling fuel. He wants to make his shop larger. He wants to expand and improve his business. 

They request a group loan of 40000 Afghani. They would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders who support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 35 years old and married. He has two children who are excelling in school. His youngest child is 7 years old. 

Henry has a computer center where he sells computers and trains students. He has been in this business for a long time. He is very experienced and his experience has given him an edge over his competitors in his community. In the future, he hopes to expand his business. 

He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more computers to sell. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more computers to sell

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: G. Célestine est née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Célestine est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cotonou, depuis près de 12 ans. Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine a arrêté les études au cours secondaire. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Célestine vend divers produits (conserves, pâtes alimentaires, huile de palme, plateaux d'oeufs frais, savons, mèches, etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Célestine s'approvisionne. Célestine a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'augmenter le stock de ses produits et de mieux satisfaire la demande de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Célestine G. was born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Célestine is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Célestine has lived together with her children and husband in Cotonou for 12 years. Célestine helps her husband provide for the family. Célestine ended her studies at the secondary level. For ten years, Célestine has sold various products (canned goods, pasta, palm oil, trays of fresh eggs, soaps, hair extensions, etc.). It is at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, that Célestine gets her supplies. Célestine has already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), both of which were repaid properly. Célestine is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ, in order to increase the stocks of her goods and to better satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned goods, hair extensions, trays of eggs, and cans of palm oil

loans.name: Marice

texts.en:
Marice lives in Agbor, Delta State. She has a store where she sells groceries to make a living. She started this business seven years ago. She is a focused, hard worker. In the future, she hopes to own a supermarket. She is 49 years old and married, and she has 5 children. Her husband is a clergyman. 

Marice is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits. She says "thank you" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 44 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim, a town along the coastal area in the Western Region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. 

Naomi is a trader. She sells bags of sugar and rice. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to retailers and other food vendors in her locality. Naomi has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar and rice

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married and has 2 children. He is 32 years old. He is a hard-working man who works for long hours so he can put food on the table to feed his family. He is a welder in Agbor, Delta State. 

The problem he is facing is that he is losing his customers because of unreliable electricity. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000, to purchase a generator to enable him generate an alternate power supply. He hopes that, with this Kiva loan, he will no longer lose his customers. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a generator for his welding business

loans.name: Sauda

texts.en: Sauda K. is thirty-seven years old and married. She is blessed with seven children. She owns a clothing business. She is using her loan to purchase new clothes for ladies, gents, and even children, so she can improve her business. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose aim is to set up more businesses, like a restaurant, and to expand her current business to earn more profits. More importantly, she hopes to educate her children and build a commercial house for more side income.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sha Begam Group

texts.en:
Sha Begam is the group leader of this group. There are four members in this group. Sha Begam is a married woman with six children; four daughters and two sons. They are in school. She wants to take a loan for her general store. She hopes to improve her business by bringing new changes to her business. She is confident that she will repay her loan on time and will take the second cycle loan after the full repayment of the first cycle loan soon.

Sayada and Shogofa want to take a loan for their carpet-weaving business. They want to expand their business. Gull Zada wants to take a loan for her husband’s taxi business. He needs this loan because it enables him to run his business. They have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani.

They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and Kiva for helping the poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is forty-nine years old. He is married and has given birth to four children. All of his children are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Axim in the Western Region of Ghana. Francis works hard to be able to provide for the family. 

Francis produces polythene (Polyethylene) bags. He owns a small device that cuts all types and sizes of rubber and polythene. He supplies to retailers and food vendors who use the bags to wrap products for their customers. Francis has been in the rubber production business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy rubber and polythene

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy layer chicks and feed for her existing birds.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 50 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region in Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people there.

Dora is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetable cooking oils, such as coconut oil, palm oil, etc. She buys from nearby towns and supplies to retailers and other food vendors in her locality. Dora has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
A. Musa is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to set up a commercial building and purchase more land for a farm expansion. She is 35 years old and blessed with four children, all in school. She owns a retail shop dealing in cosmetics, which she has been running since 2004. 

She is using the loan to purchase items for her business, that is to say various types of cosmetics (lotions, jelly, powders, creams, lipsticks, lip balm and so forth). She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase various types of cosmetics (lotions, jelly, powders, creams, lipsticks, lip balm and so forth)

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia R. is from the city of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Lydia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Lydia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling barbecue. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Lydia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is thirty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Dorcas is a trader. She trades yams. She buys nearby communities and sells to retailers and food vendors in her community. Dorcas has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy yams in bulk.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en: Mariatu is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Mariatu works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in cereals such as beans, maize, rice, etc. She supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Mariatu also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is sixty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Mercy is a trader in soap that she prepares out of soda, palm oil, and other ingredients and supplies to retailers. Mercy has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy soda and other soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk so she can produce on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy soap manufacturing ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is thirty years old. He is married and has four children. All of his children are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Emmanuel works hard to be able to provide for the family. He trades in second-hand clothes for men. He sells in his community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Emmanuel has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Hajera Safy Group

texts.en:
This is Hajera Safy's group. This group is made up of three members. Hajera, in the middle, is the group leader. She is 40 years old. She is married with 7 children: four sons and three daughters. She is a weaver. Her oldest son, who is 30, supports her as well. 
These three members have requested a group loan of 30000 Afghani. Gullaly is the second member of Hajera Safy's group. She wants to take a loan for her husband's general store. Through its income, he supports his family members. With the loan, he will expand his business. The last member is Hadesa, who is a tailor. She started sewing clothes during the Taliban regime because they had lots of economic problems at that time. With the Kiva loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine to start a business to support her husband and children.
They all would like to thank the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is forty years old. She is a married mother of five children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Paulina works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in footwear for both males and females. Paulina sells in her community and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. Paulina has been in business for nine years and says the loan will help her to expand her business by procuring goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy footwear in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen owns a salon where she makes lovely hair styles for her customers. She also sells drinks and hair extensions and cream at retail prices. This business is very lucrative and she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more crates of drinks and hair extensions and cream to sell. She is married with three children. Her husband is a business man and he also supports the home. He lives in Delta state, Nigeria. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and hair extensions and cream to sell.

loans.name: Kayunga Basooka Group 2, Jinja

texts.en: S. Amina is 46 years old and married with six children aged 22 to 4 years. She is a business lady making and selling samosas and clothes. She started making samosas with 2 kgs of cowpeas but now uses 6 kgs of cowpeas, and her main challenge is that during the fruit seasons, she does not make a lot of profits since the customers have a lot of choices to make. She also serves breakfast at home, and she would like to transform it into a tea/restaurant business plus starting up a retail shop for more expansion. She is successful now because of loans that have increased her capital base. She is able to put good spices in her samosas and the clothes she sells are of good quality. Amina would also like to build another building apart from that of her husband's house. Amina needs a loan to help her stock more clothes for Christmas sales and from this, she hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: Buying more clothes to be sold during the christmas season.

loans.name: Thank You Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. She is a food vendor. Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called Thank You. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Elizabeth, the group leader is first from right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Margaret works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She trades in cereals such as beans, maize, rice, etc. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Margaret also treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. She has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is a well-known business woman in Agbor, Delta state. She sells cooking oil at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to be a major cooking oil distributor in the future. She sells for long hours to support her family by meeting their basic needs. She is 42 years old, married with six children. Her eldest child is 25 years old. Her husband is a teacher in a government primary school in Agbor, Delta State. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000, to purchase more cooking oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Agnes is a hairdresser by profession. She has some apprentices under training. She has her shop by the roadside in her community. Agnes has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy more working materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair.

loans.name: Royal Bride Group

texts.en:
Rose is 42 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people in Axim. 

Rose runs a provision store and is the leader of a trust bank group called Royal Bride. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Rose, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina E. is from the city of Maloro, Tangub City. She is 38 years old. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Gina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Sofy Azam Group

texts.en:
Hazra, 47 years old, wants to take out a loan for her bakery. She is a married woman with seven children who are in school. She needs this loan to buy wood for her business and other necessary materials.

Hazra is the leader of S. A. Group. There are four members in this group. Maryna wants to take out a loan for her quilt business. She wants to improve the business. Marzya wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Nargis wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. She is new in her business and wants to develop her business to make a good income.

These woman are requesting a group loan of 30,000 afghani. With this loan, they can enlarge their businesses and support their families. They want to make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Sadi

texts.en:
Sadi D. is 51 years old. He is married and has three children. In order to support his family Sadi is selling household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and other items. He has been in this business for eleven years. Having this much experience, Sadi is able to choose the goods that meet the requirements of his clients, whose tastes are different. The business is quite successful and generates a stable income that allows Sadi to improve the living conditions of his family and to make his kids happy. Sadi has been provided with one loan from the Kiva field partner, IMON. He has shown himself as a meticulous client and has a positive credit history. Today Sadi is requesting $800 for purchasing new household goods to sell, enlarging the extent of his goods. You can be an important part of the growth of Sadi’s business.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new household goods to sell.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
N. Maruf is 30 years old. He lives in Kanibadam town. He is married and has four children. Maruf processes and sells dried fruits in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruit. Maruf is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who are working adults today, thanks to his example. He purchases fruit from local farmers at a wholesale price, and after processing, sells the dried fruit to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Maruf to make his business quite successful, and it brings in a stable income for the family. Currently, he needs a loan of $1500 to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Maruf expresses his gratitude for everyone supporting him.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for continuing to make a good product to sell.

loans.name: Djalil

texts.en:
Djalil is originally from Kanibadam, Tajikistan. For five years he has been processing and selling dried apricots. Djalil is married with two children. Family effort has been the key to his business' growth because everyone collaborates, and now he has a steady customer base due to the quality of his products. At times he even sends some of his products to Russia where dried apricots are very expensive. Currently, Djalil is seeking a loan of $1500 to buy tables and more apricots in order to fulfill the high demand of his customers. He sincerely thanks you for your support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy some tables and a supply of apricots to dry and sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is 27 years old. He is married,but has no children yet. He owns a retail business and sells baby carriages, toys and accessories. Alexander started this business seven years ago. At that time there was no competition in this business. Even today there still is none! The business goes well and many young couples come to his store to buy a baby carriage.

Alexander would like to borrow 8,000 UAH to increase the sales area as well as to purchase more carriages to sell. Alexander wants to develop his business further and make it a stable source of income for his young family.

loans.use: To increase his sales area and purchase more products to sell.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
T. Rahim is a hard-working man who has helped strengthen the family business over many years in an effort to give his children the best. With experience gained over five years in the purchase and sales of sheep, he has been able to bring stability to his family. Rahimdjon has a friendly family that always tries to help one another. Now Rahim has decided to set off on his own by buying some animals that he will raise for a short period of time. For this reason he is requesting $1100. Rahimdjon is counting on your help and thanks you very much for your love of the underprivileged.

loans.use: To purchase sheep to raise and sell.

loans.name: Maruf

texts.en:
T. Maruf is 47 years old and married, with three children between the ages of 22 and 14. Maruf manufactures, by order, carved wooden doors, window frames and partitions in the national oriental style. He has been in this business for twenty years. During that time, Maruf became a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. Because of this, his business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Maruf to improve the living conditions of his family. Now Maruf has a large order for window frames and doors, so he is requesting $1500 to purchase the wood products and materials he needs for his manufacturing. Maruf is counting on your help, and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him.

loans.name: Patrick Musyoka

texts.en: Patrick Musyoka K. offers transport services for passengers and goods on the Makongeni-Thika route, using his bicycle. He has been in this business for three years and is constantly challenged by the bike breaking down and requiring new parts.  Accordingly, he is planning to use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy a motorbike.  His goal in life is to buy another two motorbikes and expand his business.  He is married with two daughters, 2 and 5 years old.  His dream is that his wife and daughters will all eventually have good jobs.  Patrick is honest, friendly and a dedicated father.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Bibikibriyo

texts.en:
Bibikibriyo is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She is married and has four children. In search of a way to support her household, she started selling clothes twelve years ago. Her business allows her children to go to school. Her son helps her with the business in his free time.

It is very important to Bibikibriyo that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help her provide for the education of her children. She needs $1700 to buy winter clothing to sell for the upcoming season. Bibikibriyo wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve that. Let’s support this loving and hard-working mother. loans.use: To purchase new children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda G. is from the village of Migpange Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Luzminda operates a business selling coconut wine ("tuba") to use as vinegar in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $72 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Luzminda joined the Kiva field partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anne Mwelu

texts.en:
Anne Mwelu P. owns the Solang Centre on Mwatu Wa Ngoma street in Machakos town. She has been in this business for one year and sells soft drinks, stationery, phones and phone accessories. Her business challenge is strong competition from similar businesses, so she will use the loan of 30,000 KES to buy binding and photocopy machines. In addition to the Solang Centre, Anne also runs a cyber cafe which is another source of income for her.

She is 26 years old and married to a businessman. They have a five-year-old daughter. Anne describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy photocopy and binding machines.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: S. Gulsara is 56 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children. Gulsara owns a clothing business at the local market in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. She has been doing this business for about 5 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Gulsara tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. She has requested a loan of $1,500 USD to increase her product inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors as the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Gulsara will be better prepared to meet increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time. loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan H. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread and brewing local alcohol in the market, and is requesting a loan to stock baking flour and sugar to sell. Juan is 23 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery. loans.name: Pirmahmad

texts.ru: Пирмахмад Муродов проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Два старших сына находятся в России на заработках. Сам Пирмахмад более 7 лет занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Pirmahmad M. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. His two older sons currently work in Russia. Pirmahmad has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He raises and sells livestock. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr:
Madame Nar S. est une dame active de 52 ans qui habite dans la localité  de Layenne  à Yoff. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2004.Elle a une bonne expérience  dans la gestion des prêts  car elle a déjà rembourse 5 prêts  antérieurs. Elle  est mariée  et mère  d’un enfant de 28 ans. Son mari est salarie mais le couple a en charge cinq autres personnes. C’est la raison pour laquelle elle évolue  dans le commerce et la couture afin d’apporter un soutien au niveau des charges familiales.
Son activité  primaire c’est la vente de petit déjeuner  dans une école  qui est localisée non loin de son domicile. Madame Nar S. est en même temps couturière et profite de certains  événements pour développer  son activité  de vente de tissus confectionnes, activité  qu’elle a hérite  de ses parents qui étaient  presque tous des tailleurs. Ainsi elle sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs pour l’achat de denrées  a stocker pour la préparation  de son petit dejeuner,l’achat de tissus a confectionner des boubous a vendre pour la Tabaski et aussi l’achat de karité .Le karité est un produit facilement commercialise pendant la période de froid dans la mesure ou le souci permanent de Madame S. est de diversifier son commerce. C’est une passionnée  du de son expérience  commerciale .C’est en épargnant  qu’elle a pu épargner  et acheter un réfrigérateur qui lui a permis de procéder  a la vente de glace et de jus toujours dans le cadre de la diversification de ses produits.
texts.en:
Ms. Nar S. is an active lady, aged 52, who lives in the Layenne area in Yoff. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC fund (one of Kiva's field partners) since January 2004. She has good experience in managing loans, as she has already repaid 5 previous loans. She is married and has one child who is 28 years old. Her husband earns a salary, but the couple have five other people in her care. This is the reason why she entered the business and dressmaking fields, in order to bring some support in providing for the family. Her main business is selling breakfast meals at a school located not far from her home. At the same time, Ms. Nar S. is a dressmaker and has profited from certain events to develop her business to include the sale of manufactured fabric, an activity she inherited from her parents, who were almost all tailors. Thus, she is seeking a loan of 250,000 frs to buy foodstuffs to stock for the preparation of her breakfast meals, to buy fabric to make boubous (flowing West African robes) for sale during Tabaski, and also to buy karité (shea butter). Karité is a product easily sold during the cold season, insofar as the Ms. S.'s constant concern is to diversify her business. She is enthusiastic about her commercial experience. It is by saving that she has been able to save up and buy a refrigerator, which has allowed her to go into selling ice cream and juice, all within the framework of diversifying her products.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Fania

texts.en: Fania J. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase plastic tables and chairs in order to seat more customers. Fania is 25 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big hotel. loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie B. is from the city of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 36 years old. Connie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Connie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Connie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Connie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Connie is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Connie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling cooked foods in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elvira is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvira from GDMPC. loans.name: Family Affairs Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Family Affairs' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern city of Makeni. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, making more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children; pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them fall sick. 

Ibrahim J. (right) is the leader of this group. Ibrahim was born in Makeni. He is twenty-eight years of age, married to a businesswoman, and they have one child who is two years old. Ibrahim is a carpenter. He makes beds, chairs, benches, and tables. He has been a carpenter for eight years now. He will use this loan to buy working materials like boards, nails, and a saw.

loans.use: Buy working material like boards, nails, and a saw

loans.name: Mahmadrachab

Mahmadrachab K. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 53 years old, married and has 8 children. His son currently works in Russia. Mahmadrachab has been involved in animal husbandry for over 7 years. He raises and sells livestock. He has consistent clients. Mahmadrachab is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy supplies of boxes of powdered milk, blue band rice etc.for resale

loans.name: Constantin

texts.en:
Constantin is 33 years old and is single. he lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here Constantin has owned a shop selling foodstuffs including cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc., since 2007 working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Constantin realized that his profit is still too low to expand meaningfully and he believes that a small amount of additional capital would change his business progressively. To do this, he is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. he will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs such as rice, flour, etc., so that he may attract new customers and increase his sales and (hopefully) profits as well.

With the continued success of his business, Constantin will be able to build a secure future for his business as well as saving to cover any financial problems.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil, salt, sugar and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 43 years old and is married with seven children. She and her family live in Kicukiro, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Penina has been in the business of selling shoes for the past five years. She employs two people from her community and the hours of business are from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every weekday.

Penina is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase more shoes for sale in order to make her business more competitive as well as satisfying the high demand for shoes from her customers. Through this expansion, she hopes to supply to larger markets than before.

If this expansion succeeds, Penina will build a financially sound future for her business as well as provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for sale

loans.name: Chidiebere

texts.en: Chidiebere is a well known business man in Agbor, Delta state. He sells cooking oil at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time.
