He hopes to be a major cooking oil distributor in the future. His greatest joy in his business is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He sells for long hours to enable him support his family and meet their basic needs. He is 37 years old, married without children. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more supplies of cooking oil to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio B. is from the village of Mialen Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old. Rogelio is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rogelio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport services. Rogelio has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rogelio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Rogelio is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rogelio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle to provide a better transportation service

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is 31 years old, is married with three children with ages between 2 and 10, and takes care of one dependent. She lives in the city of Gisenyi, in Rubavu district in the West Province of Rwanda which is approximately three hours drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

For the past seven years Monique has been a self-employed hardworking businesswoman selling different goods in her shop such as sugar, rice, beans, cooking oil, etc. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day except Sunday.

Monique, after having the idea of extending her business through creating many sources of income, is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of purchasing additional goods including drinks such as soda and beers.

If this business expansion is successful, Monique will use one portion of the profit to reinvest in some other sources of income which she plans to create. The other portion will allow her to pay school fees for her children and provide more food for them.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is married and has one child. His child is 22 years old. Benson is 58 years old and hopes to lift his family and business above poverty. He sells clothes and shoes at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a boutique in the future. Benson has been in this business for a long time and loves this business. His customers pay cash when they come to purchase shoes and clothes. He would like to borrow a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell. He says a big thank you to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and is married with six children, the youngest being 9 years old. Her husband is a businessman.

Helen loves cooking and so she commercialized her cooking skill by having a restaurant in the market in Agbor, Delta State. Her stall is strategically positioned in the market and this makes a lot of people patronize her stall. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods like fufu (cassava dough), rice, beans, boiled yam, stew and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time.

Helen is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en:
Ngozi sells stock fish (fish dried in the sun) at retail prices to her customers. Stock fish is used in the preparation of Nigerian soup like melon soup. She sells for long hours to enable her meet the basic needs of her family.

Ngozi is 48 years old and is married with six children. Her husband is a trader and he also supports the home.

Ngozi is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

The demand for Ngozi’s stock fish is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more stock fish to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock fish to sell

loans.name: Sabine

texts.en:
Sabine is a 38-year-old widow with two children aged 13 and 15. She lives in Rwamagana, a region in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. For the past three years she has been successful in her business making handcrafts for sale. She employs two people to work full time in her business. Her working hours are from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily except Sunday.

Sabine is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase additional raw materials for making more attractive handcrafts for sale. With these additional raw materials, Sabine is expecting to satisfy her customers as well as attracting a wider number of them and earning more profit.

This profit will allow Sabine to do savings, which she expects to use in the future so that she can be financially stable. Beside that, she will continue to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials for makinghandcrafts

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope loves cooking so she commercialized her cooking skills by opening a restaurant at the market in Agbor, Delta State. Her stall is strategically located and lots of people patronize her stall. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian foods like fufu (cassava dough), rice, beans, boiled yam, stew and drinks.

Hope is 50 years old and married with six children. The eldest child is 6 years old. Her husband is a businessman. She has been in her business for a long time. Hope is requesting a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 27 years old, is single, and takes care of three dependents aged 10, 13 and 15. She lives in Gasabo district, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Diane has been a tailor for the past two years and she is still going strong! She employs two people from her community and they work from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. everyday except Sunday.

Diane is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase two additional sewing machines so that she may expand her sewing business and create two more jobs. With this additional business, Diane will sew different styles which are highly demanded by young people.

If this strategy is successful, Diane will be able to reinvest a portion of the revenue through the creation of more sources of income in order to ensure the financial stability of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth for sewing clothes and and two additional sewing machines

loans.name: Florence  Bonareri

texts.en:
Florence Bonareri M. sells baby clothes to repeat and walk-in customers on Ngong Road in Nairobi. She has been in this business for one year and her main challenge is strong competition which leads to low demand from customers. She is using her loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sweaters. Her goal in life is to own a maize mill shop.

Florence is married with three children ranging in age from 3 to 15. She is hardworking and patient.

loans.use: To restock baby sweaters

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday sells medicines at retail prices to his customers. He is 49 years old and married with four children. His youngest child is 9 years old. His children are in primary and secondary schools. His wife is a teacher and she also supports the family. Friday has been in his business for a long time. He hopes to own a maternity home in the future. He will use his loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is a 43-year-old widow with seven children aged between 10 and 22. She lives in Gasabo, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Julienne has been successful in the business of selling Irish potatoes for the the past five years. She employs one person to work full time in her business. Julienne's working hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily except Sunday.

Julienne needs to increase her capital so that she may expand her business through purchasing more Irish potatoes. To achieve this, she is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this additional business, Julienne is expecting to satisfy her current customers as well as attracting new customers and earning more profit.

This profit will allow Julienne to accumulate savings, which she expects to use in the future for more sources of income.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is married with four children and she is 45 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Loveth has a restaurant where she sells Nigerian cooked foods to make a living. She starts the preparation of her cooked foods at 4:30 a.m. daily. She has been in this business for a long time.

Loveth is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to cook and sell

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a farmer. She owns five acres of land where she plants cassava, plantain, pineapple, yams and okra. She loves farming because it gives her joy when she sees her customers eating her farm produce.

Christiana is 58 years old and is married with five children. Her husband sells building materials to support the home.

Christiana is hoping for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Clementina

texts.en:
Clementina is 46 years old and is married with four children. She has been farming for a long time and farms for long hours to enable her to support her home. She plants cassava, plantain, pineapple, yams and okra. Her husband is also a farmer.

Clementina hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Joseph Kimani

texts.en:
Joseph Kimani W. owns “The Leatherman” where, for the last seventeen years, he has made and sold shoes to teachers, students and walk-ins. His business is in a busy area with minimal competition. His business challenge is lack of funds to buy leather and shoe soles.

Joseph is using the proceeds of his KES 80,000 loan to buy leather, shoe soles, and clothes so as to expand his business. His dream is to become a wholesaler of shoe soles and leather.

Joseph is married to a farmer and has six children ranging in age from eight to twenty-three years. He describes himself as humble, ambitious and generous.

loans.use: To buy leather, shoe soles and clothes

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a farmer and is a hardworking woman. She plants plantain, cassava and pineapple on her farm. Her greatest joy in her farming business is during the harvest when her crops are sold. Her husband is a mechanic.

Alice is 46 years old. She has three children and her youngest child is 12 years old.

Alice hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant on her farm. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Raphel

texts.en:
Raphel sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a mechanic shop in the future. He is a focused, hard worker. His wife is a tailor. He is 43 years old and has four children. His children are excelling in school. 

Raphel hopes for a loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. With this business, he hopes to meet the basic needs and necessities of his family. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale

loans.name: Hastings Kyalo

texts.en:
Hastings M. Kyalo has made and sold animal statues to wholesalers and retailers in Mombasa market for the past 15 years.  His business challenge is lack of a market for export. He has previously taken two loans, which he has fully repaid. 

He is using the proceeds of 50,000 KES to buy more materials for making animal carvings. Hastings' dream is to have an international market where he can export his goods (animal carvings).  He is married with three children and describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making animal carvings

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 38, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their child. Mohammad has been working as a taxi driver since 1999. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Mohammad has requested a loan. Mohammad is special in his work because of his punctuality. His clients can be anyone. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work and improve his income. 

In the future, he plans on improving by purchasing a van for school transportation.

loans.use: Maintenance on his taxi car

loans.name: Abd Al Halim

texts.en:
Abd A. Halim, 49, lives in Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Abd A. Halim has been working as a car painter since 1993. Abd A. Halim is speciA. in his work because of his clean and clear work. He decided on doing this business because he wanted to have independent work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase some painting tools for his work. 

This is the first time that Abd A. Halim has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools

loans.name: Lucky

texts.en:
Lucky is a farmer. He plants plantains, cassava and pineapples on his farm. He is a focused, hard worker. His greatest joy in his farming business is during the harvest when his crops are purchased. 

Lucky, 46, is married with four children and his wife is a trader. Lucky has been in the farming business for a long time. He hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant on his farm. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance is 30 years old and married with three children. Endurance is a commercial farmer. He plants yams, cassava and pineapples. His greatest joy in his farming business is during the harvest when his crops are purchased. 

Endurance hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more seedlings to plant on his farm. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 39-year-old woman who lives in Bekaa with her husband and their four children. Saada has owned a grocery store since 2001. She sells all types of canned food, pasta, home cleaning products, beverages and more. Saada requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her third cycle and she has always paid on time. 

Saada is speciA. in her business because she knows how to treat her clients, and she has a good reputation. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of merchandise. Saada decided on doing her business to supplement her husband’s income, and she always wanted to open a shop for herself. In the future, she plans on expanding her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maisam

texts.en:
Maisam is a 31-year-old man who lives in Bekaa. Maisam has been working as a car repairman since 2004. Maisam is special in his business because of his clean and clear work. He decided to do this business because he wanted to have independent work. However, when he first started his business he had to face competition, especially since he wasn’t very known in his region. His clients are his friends and neighbors. 

Maisam has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase car oil for his work. This is the first time that Maisam has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase car oil

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond has a grocery store where he sells books and groceries to make a living. He is 40 years old and married with three children. His wife is a trader. Raymond has been in this business for a long time. He is a very hard working man. 

Raymond is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to enable him to purchase more groceries and books to sell to his customers. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and books to sell

loans.name: Julias Juma

texts.en:
Julias Juma Kitenyo owns Mazoea Carving Suppliers, where he has been making and selling assorted wood carvings to wholesalers and retailers for the past 17 years. His business is located at Changamwe in a coastal town of Kenya. His business challenge is marketing his products, especially the with an export market and low awareness. The business also depends highly on tourism, which is cyclical. 

He will use the proceeds of 50,000 KES to buy raw materials for making carvings. Julias' dream is to have an international market for exporting his goods and to be able to invest in his business. He is married and has four children. Julias describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making wood carvings

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 50-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children.

Walid has been working as a blacksmith since 1996. He is special in his work because he is known for the good quality of his work. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as having previous experience. However, when he first started his business he didn’t have enough cash to purchase all the required tools for his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

Walid has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and a car. This is the first time that Walid has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving.

loans.use: To purchase all the required tools for his work and also a car

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 40-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children.

Khaled has been working as a builder since 1986. He has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Khaled is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work as well as having previous experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Mhamad Joumaa

texts.en:
Mhamad Joumaa is a 31-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa. He has been working as a carpenter since 2000.

Mhamad Joumaa requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools and wood for his work. This is his third loan and he has always repaid on time.

Mhamad Joumaa is speciA. in his work because he does it well and is punctuA.. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty excepting making himself known to the public. He decided on doing his business because, since he was young, it has been his hobby and he decided to make it his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and wood for his work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She sells for long hours to make more profits to support her home. She is 48 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports the household. She has been in this business for a long time.  She request the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell

loans.name: Joseph Owino

texts.en: Joseph Owino O. owns the Moke engineering shop and sells windows, doors, gates and chairs to neighbouring schools and walk-ins.  He has three employees and has been working in the business for the last twenty years.  His business challenge is price undercutting by competitors and the short ordering period of customers. He is using the proceeds of KES 50,000 to buy a grinding and drilling machine. Joseph is married and has seven children.  He describes himself as hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy grinding and drilling machines

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 36-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hassan has been working as a car painter for twelve years. Hassan requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a machine for his work. This machine will help him improve his work, as well as his quality of work. Hassan has been a micro-credit client for six years now and has always repaid on time.

His previous loan helped his improve his work by being more efficient and improving his work quality. Hassan is special in his work because of his efficiency. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Hassan first started his business, he had to face competition. Hassan decided on doing his work because of his experience and because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for his work

loans.name: Dorca

texts.es:
Dorca J. es una mujer emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella iene 32 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace dos años; el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender. Ahora Dorca necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de pescado que luego comercializará a sus clientes. 
La meta de Dorca es construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes con variedad de productos comestibles.
texts.en:
Dorca J., 32, is an enterprising woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has two minor children and she, together with her husband, is a fish merchant. She has been a member of the "Madres Corajes" communal bank for the last 2 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy fresh and dehydrated fish to sell. Now, Dorca needs a 900 new sol loan to buy fish to sell to her customers. Dorca's goal is to build her house and to have a grocery store stocked with a variety of food items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Roseline is 34 years old. She sells groceries at retail prices to make a living. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.                                                                                                                                                                                                         .

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Sarita es comerciante ambulante de bolígrafos, pañales, pañuelos higiénicos y otros; el esposo trabaja en una empresa como chofer. Así complementan sus  ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia.

Vive en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Villa Tunari.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de más productos, indicados arriba, para la temporada navideña, para lograr ingresos extras.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sarita peddles pens, diapers, sanitary napkins and other items. Her husband is employed as a driver. Together they pool their earnings to cover family expenses. She lives in the city of El Alto which is in Villa Tunari zone. The financing will be used to buy more products like those listed above to earn extra income during the Christmas season. This is her second loan with Impro and her evaluation indicates that she qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pens, diapers, sanitary napkins,etc.

loans.name: Duke

texts.en: Duke sells medicines and groceries in Agbor Delta State. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the demand of his customers.  He is married with 3 children; his wife is a petty trader. Duke is very happy with his business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is very honest and hard-working. He requests the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines and groceries to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser has been a car painter since 1987. His clients are people in his neighborhood, relatives and their friends. His special relationship with his clients is a positive incentive for improving his work. In the future, he plans on improving and expanding his business and income by owning a big painting oven. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a car and start a small car trading business.

Yasser is a 46 years old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children.

loans.use: To buy a car and start a small car trading business

loans.name: Jaber

texts.en:
Jaber is a fisherman who started fishing as a hobby in childhood and who loves the sea. He also sells used furniture. His clients are all those living in his area. He plans to improve and expand his work in the future by owning his own gallery. He requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to strengthen the furniture business for a better income.

Jaber is a 41-year-old man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their four children.

loans.use: To strengthen a furniture business

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia M. es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos de ellos son menores. Katia se dedica a la venta de verduras para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte público. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace tres años y nos cuenta que con el primer crédito que recibió que fue de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo invertir en su negocio.
En la actualidad Katia necesita en crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra  de verduras al por mayor para posteriormente ser vendidas en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. La meta de Katia es educar a sus hijos y seguir apoyando a su esposo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Katia M., 42, is a dynamic and hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has four children, two of which are minors. She is a vegetable merchant. Her husband, who works in public transportation, supports her work. She has been a member of the "Madres Corajes" communal bank for the last 3 years and she tells us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her business. Currently, Katia needs 1000 new soles to buy vegetables at wholesale to be resold later at Pucallpa's Bellavista market. Katia's goal is to see her children educated and to continue to support her husband so that all of them can get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 58-year-old widowed woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her child. Majida has been the owner of a mini market near her house since 1997. Her clients are neighbors, relatives and passersby. Majida requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise which will help increase her capitA.. It will also help with her son’s marriage arrangements.

This is Majida’s ninth year with microcredits and she has an excellent payback history. She plans to improve and expand her work in the future by opening a supermarket with a wide variety of choices to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Progreso Okinawa Group

texts.es: Las características del grupo “Progreso Okinawa” es que son personas que desean progresas para sacar adelante a sus familias a través de su trabajo y dedicación a sus negocios. Son personas muy trabajadoras como lo demuestra su representante la señora Ignacia que se dedica a la venta de Patasca que es un producto muy tradicional en Santa Cruz, el resto de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de pan, jugos, comida y al servicio de albañilería y empleos domésticos. La competencia con respecto a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que todos tienen que trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante sus negocios. El crédito será utilizado para la adquisición de materia prima, insumos y herramientas para poder elaborar un producto en menor tiempo y con mayor eficiencia y calidad para ofrecer al mercado. A pesar de ser si primer ciclo ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidaR. gracias a  créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, con la cual están agradecidas por la confianza y el apoyo económico que ayudara a cumplir sus metas y mejorar mas sus ingresos brindándoles una mejor educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The characteristics of “Progrsso Okinawa” group are that they are people who want to move their families forward though work and dedication to their businesses. They are hard workers as demonstrated by Señora Ignacia that sells Patasca, a typical product in Santa Cruz. The rest of the members sell bread, juice and food. Others are dedicated to bricklaying and domestic help. The competition with respect to their businesses is intense so they have to work hard so they can move ahead with their businesses.

The credit will be used in the acquisition of raw materials, consumables and tools to make products in less time and with better efficiency and quality to offer in the market. Despite the fact that this is their first loan cycle, they already have experience with solidarity groups thanks to credit from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are appreciative of your confidence and economic support that helps them to accomplish their goals and raise their income helping provide a better education for their children and a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es:
Tesalia P. es una mujer dinámica y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un hijo menor de edad y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su casa y paralelamente por las tarde vende comida como juanes, pescado ahumado, tacacho, etc.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año y nueve meses y el primer crèdito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de golosinas.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de manteles, sillas y cubiertos que utilizará en la venta de comida. 
La meta de Tesalia es tener un bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Tesalia P. is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 26 years old. She is a single mother of a young child and she sells candy in her home and also, in the afternoon, she sells food like Juanes (a rice based dish), smoked fish, tacacho(a food made with green banana), etc. She has been a part of the Community Bank “Madres Corajes” for a year and nine months y her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles that were used to purchase candy.

Now, she needs a loan for 800.00 nuevos soles that will be used to purchase tablecloths, chairs and silverware that will be used for selling food. Tesalia’s goal is to have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tablecloths, chairs and silverware that will be used for selling food.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon. He has owned a grocery shop since 2001 and has twelve years of experience. He also deals with an olive oil business as extra income. His clients are neighbors, relatives and passersby.

Mohamad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a pick-up truck to widen his work in wholesale. He has had five years of experience in micro-credits and has proved his credibility. He plans to expand his trade to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a pick-up truck to widen his work in wholesale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with three adult children. They live in Mukachevo town.

Valentina sells clothing at one of the local markets located next to the bus station. She launched this venture two years ago. During this time she has been able to gain many repeat clients and to develop her business.

The type of clothing Valentina sells people often buy as a gift. That is why Valentina would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment for the coming Christmas season.

Valentina desires to develop her business further and make it a stable source of income for her big family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon, with her husband and their three children. She has owned a grocery store since 2006. She also sells candies, canned food, home cleaning products, etc.

Fadia requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her fourth loan and she has always repaid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work by diversifying her merchandise and offering more products.

Fadia is special in her work because she opens early in the morning and closes late in the evening. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and traders. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to purchase a lot of merchandise. Fadia decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, and also because she always wanted to work for herself.

In future, Fadia plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells garri (cassava flakes) at retail prices to her customers in the market. She has been in this business for a long time. She is very hardworking and believes in supporting her husband in providing for the family. She hopes to expand her garri business in the future.

Elizabeth is 45 years old with five children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state. Her husband is a farmer.

Elizabeth is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Elizabeth hopes for a loan NGN 50,000 to purchase more garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LASKMI tiene 34 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa.      
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la confección de chompas artesanalmente. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los meses confecciona chompas según los pedidos lo que los clientes deseen, hay veces que tiene que invertir hasta mucho dinero en confeccionar, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables y para esta época del año es cuando más vende. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más lana para confeccionar más chompas. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Laskmi is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and is a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the Patron Santiago de Santiago Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. As well as taking care of household duties, Laskmi knits traditional sweaters. She has been doing this for several years and the business has done well thanks to her hard work. Every month she makes sweaters in response to the orders placed by her customers. Sometimes she has to invest a lot of money in her business since she has regular customers, and also this is the time of year when she sells the most items. Laskmi is hardworking, enterprising, and is supporting her family well. She requires a loan to buy more wool for the sweaters. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool for more sweaters

loans.name: Oula

texts.en:
Oula is a 31-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their five children. Oula has owned a grocery store since 2008. She sells candies, canned food, beverage, etc. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store to be able to expand her stock and diversify her merchandise. It will help her answer her clients' needs. This is the first time that Oula has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and traders. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her products. Oula decided doing her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, as well as because she likes trading. In future, she plans to keep on improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Diegane

texts.fr: Monsieur D. est un villageois sérère  originaire de Foundiougne .Il s’est installe a Dakar depuis 1999 dans l’objectif de trouver un emploi, gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Ainsi  par l’intermédiaire  d’un ami  il est devenu employé dans une société  de gardiennage dénommée  Raam Daan  qui assure la sécurité  au niveau des caisses  de L’U –IMCEC a Dakar. Il  est âgé  d’une quarantaine d’années et   habite a Grand Yoff dans une des banlieues de Dakar. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 5 an. Son salaire mensuel est insuffisant et ne lui permet pas de résoudre certains  besoins sociaux  ou d’entreprendre certains projets .C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs. L’objet de ce crédit est d’acheter du ciment pour faire des briques qui lui permettront de construire un bâtiment  de 3 chambres  pour améliorer  les conditions d’habitation de sa mère  et de sa petite famille car ils logent dans des cases en paille.
texts.en:
Mr. D. is a villager of Serer ethnicity from Foundiougne. He moved to Dakar in 1999, with the goal of finding a job, earning a living, and helping his family. Thus, through a friend, he became an employee of a security agency named Raam Daan, which ensures the security of the holdings of U-IMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) in Dakar. He is about forty years old and lives in Grand Yoff, a suburb of Dakar. He is married and is the father of one child, aged 5. His monthly salary is insufficient and does not allow him to resolve some social needs or to start up certain projects. It is for this reason that he is seeking a loan of 200,000 frs. The aim of this loan is to buy cement to make bricks that will allow him to construct a 3-room building to improve the living conditions of his mother and his small family, since they live in straw huts.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest

loans.name: Karla Rosa

texts.es:
Karla Rosa es una socia joven con ganas de superación, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de jugos y sándwichs actividad que realiza con su madre. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas”.
Karla necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de implementos de la juguerìa. 
El sueño de Karla es tener una fuente de soda y apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Karla Rosa, 19, is a young woman with a strong desire to do well. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She is single and sells juices and sandwiches with her mother. She is a member of the "Las Fresitas" communal bank. She needs a 300 new sol loan to buy supplies for the juice bar. Karla's dream is to have a soda fountain and help her parents with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for her juice bar.

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 24 years old, married with 2 children, aged 2 and 5. Solange and her family live in Gasabo, a district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Solange has been selling clothes for the past 5 years, and the hours of her business are from 8 AM till late in the evening hours every day except Sunday. She employs 4 people in her business as helpers.

Solange is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of adding to her working capital so that she can purchase additional styles of young people's clothing which are in demand. With this additional business, Solange hopes to sell at better prices in order to attract new customers and earn more profit.

Through accessing this loan, if her expansion plans are successful, Solange will to continue her life as a self-employed businesswoman with a successful enterprise and build a secure future for her family.

loans.use: Purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mery Luz

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MERY tiene 40 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa.      
 
La socia alterna sus actividades de la venta de comida. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Todos los días prepara comida en su domicilio, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables y para esta época del año es cuando más vende. Nuestra socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y verduras para preparar más platos de comida. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Mery is 40 years old, lives with her partner, and is a native of the city of Cusco. She belongs to the Patron Santiago de Santiago Community Bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. As well as taking care of household duties, Mery sells food. She has been doing this work for several years, and her business has done very well thanks to the hard work she puts in. Every day she prepares meals in her home. She has very responsible regular customers, and also this is the time of year when she sells the most.Mery is hardworking, enterprising, and is supporting her family well. She requires a loan to buy more ingredients such as rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and vegetables for the dishes she makes. She is grateful for the opportunity to obtain a loan and promises to make repayments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the meals she prepares

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 35-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Bassem has been working as an electrician since 1994. When he first started his business, he had to face competition especially since he wasn’t really known in his region.

Bassem is special in his work because he is trustworthy and is known for his good work. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical wire for his work. This is the first time that Bassem has requested a loan.

His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by working in surrounding villages.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wire for his work.

loans.name: Nkechi

texts.en: Nkechi is 39 years old, married with five children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the household. Her children are excelling in school and they attend a government school. Nkechi sells melons at wholesale and retail prices to her customers.The machine besides her is used to break the melon. Melon is used in Nigerian cuisine in the preparation of 'egusi' soup. The demand for her melons is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. She is requesting NGN100,000 as a loan to purchase more melons to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more melons to sell

loans.name: Esperence

texts.en:
Esperence is 34 years old, married with three children, aged 4, 9, and 10 years and she takes care of five dependents from another family. Some of her children and dependents are of school-going age. Esperence and her family live in Kicukiro, a district of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Esperence has owned a restaurant for the past three years. She employs 5 people and the working hours are from early in the morning until the last customer leaves.

Esperence is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs for cooking in her restaurant so that she can satisfy her customers since they keep increasing day by day. With this loan, Esperence will also buy some additional equipment and paint the walls of her restaurant so that the area of her business may look smart as well as attracting many customers.

Esperence hopes that if this strategy is successful, she will earn more profit. Esperence will save a portion of any profit earned, since a major goal for her is to pay school fees and provide more food for her children. In addition, she will build a secure financial future for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs and equipment

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario del Pilar es una socia emprendedora y jovial, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es divorciada y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace dos años y se dedica a la venta de gaseosas.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en la compra de cajas de gaseosas.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de gaseosas y néctares. 
La meta de Rosario es terminar su carrera de técnica en enfermería y construir una fuente soda.
texts.en:
Rosario de Pilar is an enterprising and good-humored member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali Region. She is 34-years-old, divorced, and the mother of two young children. She has been a member of the "Las Tigresas" Village Bank for two years; she earns her living selling soft drinks. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which they allowed her to invest in cartons of soft drinks. Currently she is seeking a loan for 300 soles, which she will use to buy soft drinks and fruit juices. Rosario's goal is to end her career as a hospital technician and open a sweet shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She'll use her loan to buy soft drinks and fruit juices.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Hussein has been working as a home painter since 1992. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties excepting making himself known to the public. He decided on doing his business because of his experience.

Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and painting tools for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

Hussein is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of the new painting fashions; he does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 20-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Hassan has owned a barber shop for over two years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat and an air conditioner and to repaint his shop's interior. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him to do up his shop. Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of new haircuts. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties except finding the proper place to open his shop. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new seat and an air conditioner and to repaint his shop's interior.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 22-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife and their little baby girl. Hassan has been working for over two years as a builder. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a van for his work. This van will help him carry his tools and move along faster between his different building sites. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. Hassan is special in his work because he does it well and is committed to his work. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty buying the required tools for his work because he didn’t have enough cash. Hassan decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase a van for his work.

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
Eldith es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayal. Ella tiene 47 años de edad y es madre de tres hijos mayores de edad (independientes).
Eldith tiene una panaderìa y junto con ella trabaja su esposo hace muchos años que gracias al esfuerzo va prosperando.
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace tres años y empezò con un crèdito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra de sacos de harina para la preparaciòn de panes y tortas.
En la actualidad Eldith necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles que seràn utilizados en la compra
de insumos para panes y panetones.
El anhelo de Margarita es mejorar su negocio y poder tener una pastelería bien implementada.
texts.en:
Edith, 47, is a dynamic, hard-working woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She has three adult children. She and her husband have had a bakery for several years which, thanks to their efforts, has been making progress. She has been a member of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the last 3 years. She began with a 300 new sol loan which she used to buy sacks of flour for bread and pastry making. Currently, Edith needs 3000 new soles which will be used to buy ingredients for breads and panetones [(typical bread of Milan, usually prepared and enjoyed for Christmas and New Year around Italy, and one of the symbols of the city. In Latin America, especially in Argentina, Brazil, Bolivia, Chile and Peru, it is a Christmas dinner staple and in some places replaces roscón de reyes (Kings cake)]. Margarita's wish is to improve her business and have a well-equipped pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredient for bread and panetones.

loans.name: Bamu Group 1, Jinja

texts.en: N. Asha is 35 years old and married with six children aged 5 to 18 years old. She is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. Asha is a friendly lady with a business selling produce. She started as a trader in the village 20 years ago and now works from Amber Court Market with her own stall. She is able to make 50,000/= profit per week. Asha ensures that she has quality produce for sale, hence attracting more customers. She hopes to expand her business further as well as educate her children to the highest levels possible. Asha needs to buy more produce for resale to make more profit.

loans.use: To buy more produce like matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava, etc for resale.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 50 years old, married with five children. Her husband works with the government and he also supports the home. Her children are excelling in school and they attend a government school. Rhoda sells melons and yams at wholesale and retail prices to her customers. Melon is used in Nigerian in the preparation of 'egusi' soup. The demand for her melons is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers.The machine besides her in the picture is used for breaking the melon. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 as a loan to purchase more melons and yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and melons to sell

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Hussein has had a snack food restaurant for over two years now. He does all types of sandwiches and burgers; he also makes “falafel” sandwiches and “kebab”.

Falafel is very popular in the Middle East as a fast food. As a main dish, it is served as a sandwich, stuffed in pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, and tahini. As an appetizer, it is served on a salad, or with hummus and tahini. As for the Kebabs or also known as "shish kebab": Shish kebab is translated to 'skewer of grilled meat' and includes many variations of the kebab; therefore, there are several spellings, such as kabob, kebob, kebap, kabab, and kebab.

When Hussein first started his business, he had to pass through some financial issues because he wasn’t really known and didn’t have his own customers. Hussein decided on doing his business because of his experience. Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his restaurant and a coffee machine. This machine will help him to start serving coffee and expand his snack food into a real restaurant. This is his second loan and he repaid the first loan on time. His customers are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his restaurant and a coffee machine

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una socia trabajadora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 59 años y es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
Juana se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y productos de belleza, actividad que realiza diariamente, por lo que da crédito y cobra diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Libertadoras” desde hace ocho años y està en el movimiento Manuela Ramos el cual le ha permitido generar ingresos y apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de artículos de belleza.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 2100.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de prendas de vestir. La meta de Juana es tener un local propio para construir su boutique.
texts.en:
Juana is a hard working, enthusiastic woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 59 years old and the mother of three adult children. Juana sells clothing and beauty supplies to her customers for cash and credit. She has been part of the communal bank, “Las Libertadoras” for the past eight years and is part of the " Manuela Ramos" movement (an organization in Peru that works to improve opportunities for women), which has allowed her to generate income so that she could help her husband pay for their children's educations. Her first loan was for 300 PEN (~$100) which she invested in beauty supplies. Now she is requesting a loan of 2100 PEN ($750) which she will invest in clothing for resale. Juana's goal is to someday own a location where she can build her own boutique.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock of bicycle and motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Hind has been selling shoes since 2003. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her work. This is her second loan and she repaid the previous one in a timely manner.

Hind is special in her work because she offers all type of shoes like high heeled shoes, sport shoes and more. Her customers are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Hind decided on doing her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her work

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with her two children. Sahar has owned a grocery store since 2007. She sells canned food, candies, beverages and also fruits and vegetables. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Sahar has requested a loan. 

Sahar is special in her work because she does her best to suit her customers' needs. Her customers are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. Sahar decided on doing her business because she needed to work after her divorce in order to be financially independent. In the future, she plans to keep on improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa D. Lima - Juli” desD. hace 8 años atrás, del distrito D. Juli, provincia D. Chucuito, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 60 años D. edad, estudiò secundaria completa, es casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Zoila se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró ganado ovino y porcino.
Actualmente solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà un toro.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir co su esposo D. la mejor manera posible. 
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones, donD. las socias son muy puntuales.
texts.en:
Zoila, 60, has been a member of the "Santa Rosa D. Lima-Juli" communal bank, which is in the Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department for the past 8 years. She completed secondary school, is married, and has 3 children. She raises cattle. With her first, 300 new sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, she bought sheep and pigs. Currently, she is requesting 1600 new soles to buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to be able to live as comfortably as possible alongsiD. her husband. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings and the meetings, where her fellow members are very punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull.

loans.name: Bamu Group 2, Jinja

texts.en:
I. Musa is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is 53 years old and married with eight children aged from 28 to 6 years. He also takes care of a blind brother.

Musa has sold tomatoes from Amber court market for twelve years and his biggest challenge is the fluctuating price of produce although he is able to make 80,000/= as profits a week. He has good customer care skills and this, in addition to the quality of his tomatoes, makes a plus for him.

Musa hopes to expand his business as well as own a car for his business plus build a house for his family. He is a hardworking and friendly man and he wishes to increase his business capital by having more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce like tomatoes and eggplant for resale

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 23 year old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Sawsan has owned a clothing shop for over a year. She sells scarves and clothes for veiled women. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is the first time that Sawsan has requested a loan. 
Sawsan does her best to suit her client’s needs. Her clients are women from her region. Sawsan decided on doing her business because of her experience in sales since she used to work as a saleswoman before she opened her shop.When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough cash to diversify her merchandise. In the future, she plans to keep improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 52 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primariso completos, es casada y tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos viven con ella y los otros cuatro tienen familia.
Paula se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró una oveja y un chancho.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio capital. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro, las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Paula, 52, has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli" communal bank which is in Juli district, Chucuito province, Puno department for the last 4 years. She completed elementary school, is married, and has 6 children, two of whom still live with her, four have their own families. Paula raises livestock and she relates to us that she used her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement to buy a sheep and a pig. She now is requesting 500 new soles to buy black face sheep. Her wish for the future is to have her own capital. What she enjoys the most about her communal bank are the savings, the meetings, and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy black face sheep.

loans.name: Aleman Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Alemán” esta representado por la señora Dilcia conformada por 14 miembros que se encuentran ingresando a su 2º ciclo demostrando cumplimiento en sus pagos y esmero por sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios donde una gran mayoría se dedica a la elaboración y distribución del pan, el resto se dedica a la de venta de abarrote en tiendas de barrio, cosméticos por catalogo, ropa y al servicio de  panadería y empleados en diferentes empresas. La competencia en este tipo de negocios es alta pero las socias ya tienen sus contratos de entrega de pan y tratan de mantener la calidad y el precio para que no baje el requerimiento de las diferentes clientes, el resto de las socias tienen competencia pero saben como salir adelante ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familia ya que muchas de las socias representan el pilar fundamental para el sustento de sus hogares. La mayoría utilizaran el crédito para la adquisición de materia prima, insumos y herramientas para ayudar a genera un producto de mayor calidad y con mayor eficiencia, el resto de las socias comprará mercadería para surtir sus tiendas.
texts.en:
The Alemán Community Bank is represented by Sra. Dilcia. There are fourteen members in the group, and this is their second loan cycle. They have shown responsibility in the repayments and a desire to see their small businesses make progress. The majority of the members make and sell bread; the others sell groceries in neighbourhood stores, cosmetics via catalogue, clothing, assist in a bakery, or work in various businesses. Competition in these types of businesses is high, but the members already have orders for bread. They try to maintain the quality and the price so that the orders from their different customers keep coming in. The other members also face competition, but they know what they have to do to get ahead since their families depend on them. Many are the sole providers for their families. The majority of the members will use the loan to buy ingredients and tools to enable them to produce a high-quality product more efficiently. The others will buy merchandise to stock their stores.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is a 35 years old and married with three children. Her children are excelling in school. Elizabeth sells plantains and melons. She is requesting for a loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more plantains and melons to sell. Melon is used in Nigeria in the preparation of egusi soup. The demands for her melons are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Elizabeth says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains and melons to sell

loans.name: Cosmas Osogo

texts.en: Cosmas Osogo M. runs a hotel in a busy market in a rural part of Kenya. He also sells food, snacks and beverages to the people in the market and to passersby. He has had this business for the last 5 years. In the past he has also been a carpenter. Cosmas Osogo also grows and sells vegetables. He is asking to borrow KES 30,000 to renovate his hotel  to meet health requirements, otherwise the business may be closed by the local authorities. His major business challenge is the rising cost of supplies and competition from other businesses. Cosmas Osogo is married and his wife helps in the farming. Together they have four children. His dream is to educate his children and ensure they have a bright future. He also expects to have a big hotel in the area in 5 years time. Cosmas Osogo describes himself as polite and hardworking.

loans.use: To renovate his hotel to meet the health requirements

loans.name: Wainah Group, Jinja

texts.en: Jesca M. is the leader of her lending group in Jinja. She is a married lady with 4 school age children.  She also takes care of other dependents. Jesca sells manufactured clothes from Jinja as well as making clients’ clothes to order. Jesca is also a farmer with a plantation and cows that give her milk for sale every day. She also has a fridge from which she hopes to start selling cold drinks.  Although this contribution may seem very small, it can help pay for some family needs. Jesca needs a loan to be able to stock more new clothes for the Christmas season.

loans.use: Buying new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 33 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his parents. Jihad has owned a barber shop for ten years. Jihad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Jihad has requested a loan. 
Jihad is speciA. in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors.  He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as business  experience. In the future, Jihad plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is a 27-year-old man who lives with his parents in Aley, Mount Lebanon.

Rabee has been working as a builder for ten years now. He is special in his work because, thanks to his experience, he does it well and has good networking. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

Rabee requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Rabee has requested a loan.

Rabee decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work, as well as having experience in the business. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: El Naranjal Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “El Naranjal” esta representado por la señora Norah y conformada por 15 miembros que van cusrando ya juntos su segundo cclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas de sacar a delante sus pequeños negociso con la yuda economica que les brinda la institución, ellas se dedican a actividades como la venta de empanadas y refrescos, verduras frescas, comida tipica, ropa para niños, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio y otros se dedican a actividades de transporte, sastrería y al empleo en diferentes empresas. El nivel competitivo en los rubros a los que se dedican las socias es elevado pero saben como salir adelante gracias a su entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. El destino del financiamiento es para para la adquisisción de mercadería, insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos los cuales les servira para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias ya trabajaron con la fundacion y desean seguir creciendo junto a nuestra institución para buscar un futuro mejor para sus hijos y para su familia.
texts.en:
The El Naranjal Communal Bank is represented by Norah. It is comprised of 15 members who are in their second cycle together. They demonstrate responsibility and the desire to get their small businesses ahead with economic help offered by the institution. They work in activities like selling empanadas and soft drinks, fresh vegetables, typical food, children’s clothes, and groceries in neighborhood stores. Others work in transportation, tailoring, and as employees in different businesses. The level of competition in their fields is high, but the members know how to get ahead thanks to their enthusiasm and desire to succeed. The loan is for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and materials to increase their sales and their income. The income will serve to improve the quality of life for their families. As far as experience goes, the members have already worked with the foundation. They want to keep growing together with our institution to look for a better future for their children and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John sells electronics to make a living. He is 31 years old and single without children. He sells at the market in Agbor, Delta State.  He loves his business because it is highly competitive. He has been in this business for 5 years.

He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. He hopes to own an electronics company in the future. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha es una socia muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 49 años, es casada, es madre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes y su esposo es empleado del sector salud.
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor, negocio que funciona en su casa y paralelamente vende se dedica a la venta de menùs al mediodìa. 
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las Rosas” desde hace cuatro años y està contenta de ser parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le diò la oportunidad de comenzar con el negocio propio.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra de gaseosas y néctares.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos para su bodega. 
La meta de Bertha es tener una tienda grande bien implementada y seguir apoyando a su esposo en el hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha, 49, is a hard-working, married, mother of three adult children. Her husband is employed in the health sector. She lives in Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She is a retail grocery merchant; she has a small store set up in her house. She also sells prepared meals at noon. She has been a member of the "Las Rosas" communal bank for the last 4 years and she's happy to be part of the Manuela Ramos Movement because it gave her the opportunity to start her own business. With the first, 300 new sol, loan she bought soft-drinks and fruit nectars. Currently, she is requesting financing of 500 new soles to buy stock items for her store. Bertha's goal is to have a big, well-stocked, store and to continue to be a support to her husband at home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food stock items for her store.

loans.name: Welekema Group

texts.en:
Lorpu N. K. is the leader of a group of 4 borrowers called 'Welekema'. She is married with 11 children aged 9-29 years old, and their educational levels are kindergarten-high school graduate. She also cares for 4 nieces and nephews.

Lorpu is an illiterate due to lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia. Her business is the sale of general goods. She buys goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga.

Lorpu has been running this business for 4 years, and is hoping to improve her business to a real shop. She faces problems with high transportation rates from wholesalers to her retail site. Lorpu needs this loan to purchase new goods to improve her business. She dreams of giving her family the best education to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Juana Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - J.” desde hace 12 años atrás, del distrito de J., provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella.
Juana se dedica a la artesanìa y ganaderìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en J..
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
For twelve years Juana has been a member of the "Santa Rosa de Lima--J." Village Bank in the J. District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 42 and did not complete primary school. She's married and has three dependent children. She earns her living making handicrafts and raising cattle. She tells us that she used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, to buy groceries, including sugar, rice, and noodles. She is seeking a loan for 500 soles which she'll use to buy fabric. Her dream for the future is to have her own house in J.. What she likes most about her village bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
La Señora Jenny, hace dos años que se dedica a la elaboracion D. murales, piñatas, canastas y todo en cotillon, para fiestas infantiles, matrimonios y fiestas D. quince años, todos los días trabaja en los pedidos que tiene desD. las 7:00 D. la mañana, hasta las 10:00 D. la noche y cuando tiene mucho trabajo hasta el amanecer, tiene su taller en su mismo domicilio, como es fin D. año ella necesita capital para preparar sus cotillonerias para las fiestas D. fin D. año, ella está contenta con su trabajo y se siente muy úil puesto que con sus ingresos ayuda al sustento D. su hogar y la educacion D. sus hijos, por lo que esta muy contenta D. contar con el apoyo que le brinda la institucion y esta muy comprometida en no fallar, para ser un ejemplo para su familia.

La Sra. vive en la zon del Plan 3000, que es uno D. los sectores más poblados D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz. Allí radican una gran cantidad D. pobladores nacidos en esa ciudad conjuncionados con residentes migrantes D. diferentes departamentos Oruro, Cochabamba, La Paz, Sucre, Potosí, etc.
texts.en:
For the last two years, Jenny has been making styrofoam wall displays, piñatas, baskets and all kinds of novelty items for children's parties, weddings, 15th-birthday parties, etc. She begins work on her orders daily at 7am and works until 10pm. Sometimes, when she has a lot of work, she will work until dawn. She has her workshop in her home and, as it is now end of year, she needs financing to prepare her novelty boxes for the end-of-year festivities. She is happy with her work and feels very useful because her earnings help support her household and pay for the education of her children. She is happy to be able to count on the support given by the institution and is committed not to fail so as to set a good example for her family. She lives in the Plan 3000 zone, which is one of the most populous sectors of the city of Santa Cruz.
