Nuestra socia JACKELIN tiene 21 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia JACKELIN tiene una hija que se llama Colin y tiene un año y medio.  
        
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de comestibles. Ella tiene en su propio domicilio una tienda de abarrotes en “Siete Mascarones” en el distrito de Santiago. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como arroz, azúcar y fideos. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. La socia en la foto esta acompañada de su esposo Frank y su hija Colin.
texts.en:
Jackelin is 21 years old and lives with her husband in the city of Cusco. She belongs to the village bank “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” in Asociación Arariwa. Jackelin has a daughter named Colin who is a year and a half old.

She alternates her home duties with selling foodstuffs. She has a small grocery store in her home in "Siete Mascarones" in the district of Santiago. She has been in this business for several years and thanks to her hard work she has done very well. She is a young mother, a hard worker, and enterprising to improve her family's situation. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise like rice, sugar, and pasta.

She is thankful for the offered opportunity and promises to pay back the loan on schedule. She is pictured in the photo accompanied by her husband Frank and her daughter Colin.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Lila

texts.es:
Lila es una socia dinámica y muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 60 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijas mayores de edad quienes la apoyan.
Lila se dedica al alquiler de motocar y a la venta de gaseosas. Forma parte de el Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace dos años donde se ha caracterizado por su puntualidad.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con lo que comprò abarrotes para vender al por menor.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles que utilizará para dar la cuota inicial de un motocar. La meta de Lila es tener una bodega bien surtida y hacerla conocida.
texts.en:
Lila is a dynamic and hard-working member. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali region. She is a 60 year old widow. She has three grown daughters who help her. Lila rents out a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), and she sells soft drinks. She has been part of the Las Rosas Communal Bank for two years. In the bank she is known for her punctuality. With the first loan she received for 300 PEN she bought groceries for retail sales. She currently needs a loan for 900 PEN to make the initial payment on a motocarro. Lila’s goal is to have a well stocked convenience store and to make it well known.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make first payment on a motocarro

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed D. trades in different types of used clothing. He is married to a businesswoman who owns her own business at the same marketplace.

They have three children, a boy and two girls, and three other dependents. These people give help to the business and house activities when he goes out of town to get his goods.

Mohamed has been in business for about six years and hopes to buy more used clothing, cater to his family and start construction of a building.

loans.use: To buy additional used clothing

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 39 años, es madre de tres hijos (uno de ellos mayor de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.
Esther se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también es físico terapeuta. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las tigresas” desde hace tres años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra de cremas para el cuerpo.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de cremas para su negocio y en la compra de artículos de belleza. La meta de Esther es tener un un local amplio donde pueda dar mejor atención al público.
texts.en:
Esther, 39, is a hard-working and dynamic woman from the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is an adult. She can count on her husband to support her efforts at work. She sells beauty products and is also a physical therapist. She has been a member of the "Las Tigresas" communal bank for the last 3 years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy body creams. Currently, she needs 1200 new soles to buy creams and other beauty products for her business. Esther's goal is to have a spacious location from which she can offer better service to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es recientemente socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli”, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 33 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secunadrios incompletos, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de chifles.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar detergente, jabón, 5 cuchillos y ayudin.
Su sueño para el futuro es comprarse su carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las facilidades de préstamo.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a recent member of the communal bank, "Santa Rosa of Lima - Juli" in the district of Juil, province of Chucuito, department of Puno. She is 33 years old, did not complete her secondary education, is married and has 3 children. She sells chifles (a local food like fried bananas). She is asking for a credit 500.00 soles with which she will buy detergent, soap, 5 knives, and ayudin (a type of cleaning product). Her dream for the future is to buy a car and for her children to be professionals. The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the ease of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soap, detergent, 5 knives, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia HERNESTINA es madre soltera, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene una hija que se llama Elizabeth que tiene 18 años y se esta preparando para ingresar a la universidad.   
       
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene su stand en el mercado de “Cascaparo” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas y verduras como cebollas, repollos, lechugas y muchas más. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Hernestina is a single mother who was born in the city of Cusco. She belongs to the Arariwa Association's "Patron Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. She has a daughter, Elizabeth, who is 18 years old and preparing to enter the university. Hernestina divides her time between her work at home and her business selling fruits and vegetables. She has a stand in Cusco's “Cascaparo” market. She has operated this business for several years, and it has gone very well for her, thanks for all of the effort and dedication she puts into her work. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial mother who is helping her family get ahead. She needs a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as onions, cabbage, lettuce, and much more. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this manner, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits and vegetables such as onions, cabbage, lettuce, etc.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ADELA tiene 32 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene dos hijas: Lizbeth tiene siete años y Caty tiene nueve años ambas están en el programa social “URPI WASI” donde estudian y viven.   
      
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene su puesto de venta en los mercados de “Cascaparo” y “Huancaro” de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más frutas y verduras como cebollas, repollos, lechugas y muchas más. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   La socia en la foto esta acompañada de su sobrina Mariela de siete años.
texts.en:
Our partner, Adela, age 32, is from Cusco and lives with her partner. She belongs to the village bank "Patron Santiago de Santiago", part of the Arariwa Association. She has two children. Lizbeth is only 7 years old and Caty is 9 years old. They are both in the social program Urpi Wasi where they go to school and live. Adela spends some of her time selling fruits and vegetables from her home, and some of her time selling from her stall in the Cascaparo and Huancaro markets of Cusco. She has had this business for several years, and it has done well thanks to all the effort she puts in to her work. She is a hardworking, enterprising mother who has helped move her family forward. She would like a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables like onions, cabbage, lettuce and much more. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this loan and promises to complete her payments according to the schedule. She is pictured with her niece, 7 year old Mariela.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “EL PORVENIR“se encuentra en su 4º Ciclo, consta D. 12 mujeres. Todas viven en el Barrio tienen diferentes negocios, L. reunión se lleva a cabo en L. casa D. L. Presidenta Sra. Mairene. Los Negocios D. las socias son diversos por ejemplo Sra. Mairene tiene una venta D. comida en su hogar, L. Sra. Maribel vive al lado D. L. casa D. reunión y tiene una pensión, otra señora venD. empanadas, refresco, otras venden comida, también venden ropa y cosméticos. Las socias mencionan que existe gran cantidad D. competencia en relación a este crédito pero ellas hacen L. diferencia que Agrocapital trabaja D. manera transparente, y le da muchas ventajas y accesibilidad a este crédito. Generalmente las socias indican que el crédito lo sacan para sus negocios, para aumentar su capital, asimismo puedan crecer con sus negocios. En su mayoría tienen experiencia en Banca Comunal ya que trabajaban en otras entidades financieras. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos y cumplen con los requerimientos D. L. Institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “EL PORVENIR“ is on their 4th loan cycle and consists of 12 women. They all live in the Barrio and have different businesses. They meet in the house of President Mrs. Mairene. The businesses of the members are diverse. For example, Mrs. Mairene sells food in her home. Mrs. Maribel lives next door to the house where the meetings are held and she receives a pension. Another woman sells empanadas and drinks while others sell food as well as clothes and cosmetics. The members mention that there is a lot of competition to get this loan, but they make a difference in that Kiva partner Agrocapital works transparently, and provides advantages and access to this credit. Generally, the members say that the loan they are taking out is for their businesses and to increase their capital. This way, they can grow their businesses. The majority of the members have experience with communal banking since they worked in other financial institutions. They have good credit history and comply with the requirements of the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational Capital

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana que en estos momentos cuenta con 38 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, junto a su esposo de 46 años y sus tres hijos; de 21, 18 y 15 años de edad respectivamente. La Sra. Roxana es promotora de la afamada línea de cosméticos "avon" desde hace más de tres años. Su esposo es trabajador fijo, seguro y antiguo de una industria de aceites. Actividades que realizan por varios años, por eso sus experiencias. La competencia es mediana en cuanto al comercio de cosméticos, porque hay otras personas con la misma actividad, pero lo importante es que ella es antigua en el negocio y ya tiene sus clientes asegurados. En cuanto a su esposo eso no existe, porque es empleado fijo y seguro. Roxana invirtió la mayor parte del crédito que saco en el pago de los estudios de sus hijos. Este es el noveno préstamo de la Sra. Roxana y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado excelentemente. Tiene una deuda vigente en otra entidad financiera, la misma que está pagando puntualmente.
texts.en:
Roxana is 38. She lives in her own house, which is located in the western part of the area. She lives with her 46 year old husband and their three children; 21, 18, and 15. For over three years Roxana has been selling cosmetics for the well known Avon line. Her husband has a steady, secure, and long time job with an oil industry. They have been in their activities for many years, and they are experienced. Competition in selling cosmetics is average. There are other people who do the same thing, but the important thing is that she has been in the business a long time and has her regular customers. For her husband, competition does not exist because his job is steady and secure. Roxana used the greatest part of the loan she got to pay for her children’s education. This is Roxana’s ninth loan. She paid back all of the previous loans excellently. She has a standing debt with another financial entity. She is paying that punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La Sra. Benigna tiene 50 años de edad, es separada de su esposo desde hace mas de 15 años por lo cual ha tenido que criar sola a sus hijos los cuales ya son grandes pero viven en la misma casa. La Sra. Benigna tiene su casa propia bien ubicada en la populosa zona de la localidad. En su domicilio tienen una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida atendiendo a toda la vecindad y público en general que visita su barrio, su tienda esta bien ubicada y es bien conocida  por la vecindad, ya lleva más de 5 años en esta actividad. La ventaja de la Sra. Benigna es que su nuera hace pan todos los días el mismo que ella vende en su tienda incrementando sus ventas por este producto. No hay muchas tiendas en su barrio por lo que tiene gran número de clientes fijos. El crédito tiene como fin el inyectar capital de trabajo para su negocio de tienda de abarrotes lo cual le generara mayores ingresos en estas fiestas de fin de año.  La Sra. Benigna ha tenido un buen comportamiento de pagos en todos sus créditos demostrando responsabilidad y organización, es una cliente conocida que esta en su 6to. Crédito.
texts.en:
Senora Benigna is 50 years old and has been seperated from her husband for more than 15 years, thus she has had to raise her children by herself. Now they are grown but still live with her. Senora Benigna has her own house located in a heavily populated part of town. In her home she has a small but well stocked grocery store which attracts both neighbors and people who visit her neighborhood. Her store is well located and well known in the area and she has been running it for over five years. One advantage for Benigna is that her daughter-in-law bakes bread every day and Senora Benigna sells it in her stores, increasing her sales. There aren't a lot of other stores in the neighborhoods so she has a great number of loyal clients. She is asking for a loan for working capital for her grocery store which will generate more income during the holiday season. Senora Benigna has always payed back her loans back on time, demonstrating responsibility and organization. She is a well known client on her 6th loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Manzanos Group

texts.es: Es el primer ciclo del grupo, es decir primera vez que participan en banca comunal de Agrocapital  y se caracterizan porque son personas muy unidas y pertenecen a un solo sindicato de comercio de la localidad son muy trabajadores, muy puntuales y muy responsables en cuanto a las obligaciones que tienen cada uno de ellos. La mayoría de este grupo se dedica a lo que es la venta de ropa (toallas, colchas, poleras, pantalones para damas, varones, y niños), porque en la localidad es una zona de mucho movimiento económico (es sobre la carretera principal) y es lo que las socias aprovechan para hacer sus ventas. La zona es de mucho movimiento económico, lo que hace que sea de un potencial enorme, la competencia es media pero por el crecimiento demográfico existe una tendencia a crecimiento de la demanda. El mercado no esta sectorizado por completo y en un pequeño espacio se pueden encontrar diferentes tipos de negocio. El destino del crédito solicitado por este grupo fue directamente para la inversión de todo lo que es la compra de mercadería que traen de las ciudades principales y así poder hacer crecer sus negocios. En cuanto a la experiencia de las socias de este grupo en su gran mayoria participan en lo que son los créditos relámpagos de otras entidades financieras donde también demuestran la puntualidad en cuanto a sus pagos. Es decir créditos en los que las instituciones no solicitan grandes garantías.
texts.en:
This is the first loan cycle for the group, meaning it is the first time they have worked with Kiva partner Fundacion AgroCapital. The members are known for being very united, as they belong to the only labor union in their town, and are very hard-working, punctual and responsible with their obligations. The majority of the members make a living selling clothes and other items (T-shirts, pants for men, women and children; towels, bedspreads). Their area is known for its busy economic activity since it is on the main highway, and the members take advantage with their sales. Because of the economic activity there is enormous business potential and the amount of competition is average, but with the growth in population in the area there will be a growth in demand. The market is not fully utilized, and in a small space a lot of different types of businesses can be found. This loan will be directly used to invest in all the merchandise the members bring in from the main cities, and thus they will be able to grow their businesses. As for the members' experience with the process, the vast majority of them have participated in loan programs from other financial institutions that did not require large guarantees and have demonstrated punctuality with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Jerusalen Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal  “JERUSALEN” se encuentra en su quinto ciclo y consta D. 12 mujeres. Todas viven en el mismo barrio tienen diferentes negocios, la reunión se lleva a cabo en la casa D. una D. las socias  Sra. Yolanda que desD. que se inicio el grupo ella pertenece al Banco Comunal es la socia más antigua se podría decir la fundadora. Los negocios D. las socias son diversos por ejemplo Sra. Martha, presidenta del grupo, tiene una venta D. comida en su hogar y también sale a la calle a vender, Encarnación vive en el barrio su negocio es la venta D. joyas D. fantasía, Elia venD. comida/cena (pollo, Panchitos, locro), refrescos, otras venden otro tipo D. comidas, también venden ropa. Las socias mencionan que existe gran cantidad D. competencia en relación a este crédito pero ellas hacen la diferencia que Agrocapital trabaja D. manera transparente, y le da muchas ventajas y accesibilidad a este crédito. Las socias indican que el crédito lo sacan para sus negocios, para aumentar su capital, asimismo puedan crecer con sus negocios. En su mayoría tienen experiencia en Banca Comunal y sus antecedentes crediticios están sobre los requerimientos D. la Institución.
texts.en:
The "Jerusalen" Community Bank is in its fifth loan cycle and consists of 12 women. All the members live in the same neighborhood and have different businesses. Their meetings take place at the home of Yolanda, who has belonged to the group since its inception and is its oldest member, so you could call her the founder. The members' businesses are diverse. For example, Martha, the group's president, sells food out of her home and also on the street. Encarnación sells jewelry. Elia sells meals (chicken and other regional dishes), refreshments and other types of food, and also sells clothing. The members say there is a high level of competition for their businesses, but they work with Kiva partner AgroCapital transparently and it gives them a lot of advantages and access to credit. The loan will be used to raise capital and grow their businesses. The majority of the members have experience with the community bank, and their work with the previous loans went above the institution's requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es: Jorge cuenta con 59 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 4 hijos los mimos que ya son independientes y viven junto a su ex conyugue, actualmente vive en una casa en alquiler la misma que es de unos compadres. Jorge se dedica al transporte urbano de pasajeros, para el efecto cuenta con un taxi propio, en el rubro cuenta con 12 años de experiencia. En el transporte existe bastante competencia sin embargo Jorge por la antigüedad y la experiencia sabe de lugares y horarios estratégicos para poder obtener buenos ingresos. El destino del crédito es para la compra del parabrisas de su automóvil, el mismo que fue dañado en la calle mientras el descansaba dentro su hogar. Jorge cuenta con algunos retrasos en algunas cuotas en Agrocapital lo cual hizo que su promedio se elevara sin embargo no es por mala fe ya que el mismo cuenta con una buena voluntad de pago. No cuenta con creditos en otras instituciones es cliente fiel con nuestra institución por el servicio que recibe de la misma.
texts.en:
Jorge is 59 years old, single and has four children, all of whom are grown up and live with his ex-wife. He currently lives in a house he rents with some friends. Jorge makes a living in public transportation and has his own taxi. He has 12 years of experience in the business. There is quite a lot of competition, but Jorge, with his age and experience, knows the strategic places and schedules to go to earn a good income. The loan will be used to purchase a windshield for his vehicle, which was damaged on the street while he was asleep in his home. He has had some delays with past repayments to Kiva partner AgroCapial, which raised his rates, however, it was not in bad faith and he has maintained his will for repayment. He has had no loans with other institutions and he is a faithful client to AgroCapital for the services he receives.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a windshield for his taxi

loans.name: Crisolito Group

texts.es: El grupo estas conformado por 11 PERSONAS, todos viven en la misma zona, tienen su actividad económica en la misma zona donD. se realizan las reuniones D. cobro. Además una gran parte D. estas personas empezaron a tener experiencias con créditos con nuestra institución, ya que nunca antes habían sacado créditos en otra institución financiera. Como mencionaba anteriormente existen 3 varones en el grupo, los cuales se dedican: sastre y confección D. trajes, sacos para varón, otro es taxista con coche propio, y el ultimo es contratista D. construcciones por la misma zona. Las mujeres que componen este grupo una gran mayoría se dedican a la comercialización D. frutas, abarrotes, y una D. ellas es costurera D. pantalones jeans en una industria la cual ella gana por producto terminado. Las personas componentes D. este banco comunal le ponen mucho empeño al trabajo que desempeñan tratando siempre D. entregar al mercado un mejor servicio para así tener más ingresos. Las que se dedican a la comercialización D. frutas utilizan el dinero para viajar y traer en camiones frutas las cuales las venden en los mercados D. su zona, las que se dedican a la venta
texts.en:
This group consists of 11 members, all who live and work in the same area where they carry out their meetings. The majority of the members started their loan experiences with Kiva partner Fundacion AgroCapital, and none of them has taken out loans from other institutions. As mentioned in previous descriptions, three of the members are men, and one makes a living as tailor making suits and sports coats for men, while another drives his own taxi, and the other is a construction contractor. The majority of the women in the group make a living selling fruits and groceries, and one of them is a seamstress at a jeans factory. The members put a lot of effort into their work and are always trying to deliver a better service so they can increase their income. The members who sell fruit will use to the loan to travel in trucks and bring in the fruit to sell at the area's markets.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Las Cabañas Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal LAS CABAÑAS es un grupo de 10 personas, de algunas de ellas este crédito será su segundo ciclo, de otras el primero; esto es fruto de otros bancos donde se fueron las socias conflictivas. Las socias que se mantienen desde la fundación del banco están por el 6º ciclo. La mayoría de las socias venden cosméticos, dos en particular hacen dulces de leche, pan para vender, otras en cambio tienen una pequeña tienda (snack) de barrio donde se vende soda, asaditos etc. La competencia es regular en lo que respecta a la venta de comidas, a lo que se refiere a la venta de cosméticos es fuerte ya que no son las únicas y tienen que esforzarse mucho para poder tener un pedido de productos que les permita tener ganancias. El crédito será utilizado para incrementar su capital y tener una mayor fuerza de trabajo todas en su conjunto tienen experiencia de trabajar con esta modalidad de créditos comunales.
texts.en:
LAS CABAÑAS community bank consists of 10 members, some of whom are on their second loan cycle and others are on their first after coming over from other community banks where they had conflicts. The members who have been with the group since the foundation are on their sixth cycle. The majority of the members sell cosmetics, while two sell sweets and breads, and others have small snack stands in the neighborhood. There is regular competition in respect to the sale of food, and although the members say that cosmetic sales are strong, they are not the only ones and have to work very hard to have enough product orders to make profits. The loan will be used to increase their working capital and work force. As a whole, all the members have experience with this type of community credit.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 45 años de edad su estado civil es casada, tiene 2 hijos dependientes, la familia vive en una vivienda que es alquilada. Con la actividad de venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa en las ferias de la localidad y la ciudad, cuenta con 23 años de experiencia en el negocio, el esposo se dedica a la venta de llaveros, con 2 años de experiencia. Su competencia es media, porque Virginia es responsable con sus clientes. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería al por mayor “papa, chuño y tunta”. Este es su tercer crédito, en sus créditos anteriores trabajo de manera optima, tiene obligaciones con otras entidades financieras en las cuales esta trabajando de manera optima.
texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with two dependent children; her family lives in a rented house. At street markets in her neighborhood and city, she sells potatoes and two kinds of dried potatoes, chuño and tunta. She has 23 years of experience in this business. Her husband has two years of experience with selling keyrings. Her competition is average, because Virginia is responsible with her clients. The loan will be used for purchasing wholesale merchandise, including potatoes and dried potatoes.This is her third loan, and her previous loans as well as her obligations to other financial institutions are all in good standing.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of merchandise including potatoes and dried potatoes (chuño and tunta)

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 36 años de edad, cuenta con estudios superiores incompletos, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos.
Luz se dedica a la venta de artesanìa y ganaderìa y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, plumón y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su negocio propio. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz has been a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli Community Bank for the past year. She lives in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. Ms. Luz is 36 years old and did not finish college. She lives with her common law husband and has 5 children. Luz sells crafts and livestock for a living. She would like the lenders to know that with the first loan she obtained from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 500 new soles, she bought supplies to make crafts. She has asked for another 500 new soles so that she can buy wool, down and flannel. She hopes to own her own business one day. Her favorite thing about Banco Comunal is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool and flannel

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria es una socia activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, Región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 45 años, es madre de cinco hijos(tres mayores de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al ensamblado de motos. Hilaria se dedica a la venta de comidas típicas de la región, actividad que realiza todos los días por las tardes.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò utensilios para su negocio.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos al por mayor para la elaboraciòn de la comida.
La meta de Hilaria es llegar a tener un restaurant propio y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilaria is an active member. She lives in the District of Campo Verde, in the Ucayali region. Hilaria is 45 years old, and has five children (three of them are adults) and she has the support of her husband, who earns a living assembling motorcycles. To make a living, Hilaria sells typical food dishes from the region in the afternoons. She has been a member of “Las Nazarenas” Community Bank for the past year. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, which she used to buy utensils for the business. She has now asked for a loan of 800 new soles. She will use the money to buy food products at wholesale. Hilaria’s goal is to own her own restaurant and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products to prepare food dishes

loans.name: Mirtha Luz

texts.es:
Mirtha Luz es una mujer perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 51 años, es soltera y madre de ocho hijos mayores los que la apoyan.
Se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Mirtha Luz forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace un año. 
El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en su negocio de comidas.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sacos de arroz, aceite y otros insumos para la venta de sus platos. 
La meta de Mirtha Luz es tener una tienda de golosinas bien implementada.
texts.en:
Mirtha Luz is a persevering woman. She lives in Pucallpa, a city in the Ucayali region. She is 51 years old, single and mother of eight adult children, who are all supportive of her. She makes her living by selling food from her home in the evenings. Mirtha Luz has been a member of Madres Corajes Community Bank for the past year. The first loan she received was for 300 new soles, which she invested in her food business. She has asked for a loan of 900 new soles to buy rice in large bags, oil and other supplies for making the food she sells. Mirtha Luz’s goal is to own a well-stocked candy shop.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy rice, oils and other supplies for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 1 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 24 años de edad, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.
Verónica se dedica a la venta de artesanìas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para hacer las artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su negocio y capital propio. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Ms. Veronica has been a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima-Juli Community Bank for the past year. She lives in the District of Juli, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. Ms. Luz is 24 years old and finished high school. She is a single mother and has 1 child. Luz sells crafts for a living. She would like the lenders to know that with the first loan she obtained from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, in the amount of 500 new soles, she bought supplies for craft-making. She has asked for a loan of 600 new soles to buy wool and flannel. She hopes to one day own her own business and be able to finance it on her own. Her favorite thing about Banco Comunal is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WOOL AND FLANNEL

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La señora Eugenia es socia del Banco Comunal “Tupac Amaru I” desde hace 2 años atrás del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 59 años de edad, no cuenta con estudios, es casada y tiene 7 hijos (2 de ellos viven con ella y 5 son independientes).
Eugenia se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital comprando conejos y chanchos.
Actualmente solicitará un crédito de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar dos ovejas cara negra y gallinas.
Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su alimentación y vivir tranquila. 
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 59, has been a member of the "Tupac Amaru I" communal bank in Yunguyo district and province, Puno department, for the last 2 years. She never went to school, is married, and has 7 children (2 live with her, 5 are independent). Eugenia raises cattle and tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy rabbits and pigs. Currently, she needs 500 new soles to buy two black face sheep and chickens. Her dream for the future is to improve her diet and to live in peace. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two black face sheep and chickens.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 47 años, es madre de seis hijos(5 son mayores de edad e independientes).
Ella se dedica junto con su esposo a la venta de camu camu y frutas de la región para lo cual cuenta con una chacra que es donde cosecha los frutos para luego llevarlos a vender al mercado de bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò envases para colocar las frutas.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 1500.00 nuevos soles los que invertirà una parte en el transporte de las frutas y otra en artículos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.) para la venta en la bodega de su casa.
La meta de Maritza es tener una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida.
texts.en:
Maritza is a hard-working and active woman. She lives in the Campo Verde district, in the Ucayali region. She is 47 years old and is the mother of six children (5 are grown up and independent). Together with her husband, they sell camu camu (a fruit native to the area) and other fruits of the region that they grow on their farm and then take to the bellavista market in the city of Pucallpa. She has been a part of the Community Bank “Las Nazarenas” for six years and her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles. She bought containers to hold the fruit. Now she needs a loan of 1500.00 nuevos soles. She will invest part of the money in the transportation for the fruit and part in basic needs products (rice, sugar, noodles, oil, etc.) to sell in the grocery store in her home. Maritza’s goal is to have a well stocked grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for transportation for the harvested fruit and to buy basic needs products

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa D. A. es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años de edad, es madre de tres hijas mayores de edad y se dedica a la venta de comida en el puerto de Yarina Cocha. 
Forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace siete años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò implementos como mesas, sillas, manteles, cocina a carbón, etc. 
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 2500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà bebidas al por mayor para implementar su negocio. 
La meta de Teresa es tener una distribuidora de bebidas y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa D. A., 42, is an enthusiastic, enterprising woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has three adult daughters and she sells prepared meals in the Yarina Cocha port. She has been a member of the "Las Fresitas" communal bank for the last 7 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she used it to buy such things as tables, chairs, tablecloths, a coal stove, etc. Currently, she needs 2500 new soles with which to buy beverages at wholesale to stock her business. Teresa's goal is to be a beverage distributor and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale beverages.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza es una socia entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 53 años, es madre de seis hijos(3 de ellos mayores de edad)y se dedica a la venta de dulces por lo que sale a vender por las tardes por diferentes lugares de la localidad. 
Esperanza forma parte del Banco Comunal “Perlas de Pucallpa” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en frutas para la venta desde su casa.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà dulces y frutas. 
El anhelo de Esperanza es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes al por menor.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a very enthusiastic and hard working woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the region of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are full grown. She sells sweets in the afternoon in different locations around town.

Esperanza is a member of the village bank "Perlas de Pucallpa" (Pearls of Pucallpa). She has been a member for a year and a half and her first loan was for 300.00 nuevos soles which she used to buy fruit to sell from her home.

Now she needs a loan of 600.00 nuevos soles to buy sweets and fruits. Esperanza dreams of having a small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sweets and fruit

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Carla es una socia emprendedora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, cuenta con estudios de Contabilidad y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que fueron utilizados en la compra de productos de belleza.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas de vestir para la venta a sus clientes y amistades.
La meta de Carla es terminar sus estudios de Contabilidad y tener una tienda de artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Carla is a hardworking member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and is studying accounting, and she dedicates herself to the sale of beauty products, an activity that she does from her home. She is part of the Tigers Community Bank and her first loan was for 300 PEN which was used in the purchase of beauty products. Currently she needs a credit of 800 PEN with which she will buy clothes to sell to her clients and acquaintances. Carla's goal is to finish her accounting studies and have a store with home goods.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of clothing for men and women

loans.name: Ahliman

texts.en:
Ahliman A. is a 42-year-old trader who sells different types of electrical appliances, such as vacuum cleaners, kettles, and meat choppers. He has 15 years of experience selling electrical goods. His business is the only source of income for his family. Ahliman is married and has three children. His dream is to provide his children with best education and pass his business to one of his two sons. 

Ahliman would like to expand his business so he applied for a $1600 USD loan to purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more appliances to sell

loans.name: Habil

texts.en:
Habil Q. is a 36-year-old trader who sells mobile phones in the city center of Lankaran. He has 8 years of experience in this field and, during these hard years, he built his own store. He has two sons, of whom is he very proud because they are studying in high school and are very smart guys. He believes that they could be scientists one day. 

Habil applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to a open new store in the other part of city.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for a second store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa S. es una socia emprendedora y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de un hijo mayor de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es albañil. Rosa tiene una bodega de abarrotes que funciona en su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes” desde hace cinco años donde siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una socia muy puntual. 
El primer crédito que recibió en este banco fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que compró golosinas para la venta desde su casa.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que será utilizado para surtir su negocio. 
La meta de Rosa es tener una tienda con todo tipo de artículos y seguir trabajando para salir adelante. 
Además comenta que està agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la confianza que han depositado en ella.
texts.en:
Rosa S. is a hardworking and collaborative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 29 years old and mother of one child who is older. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a mason. Rosa has a grocery store which she runs out of her house. She has been part of the Courageous Mothers Community Bank for 5 years where she has always been very punctual. The first credit she received was for 300 PEN with which she bought sweets to sell out of her house. Currently she needs a credit of 500 PEN which will be used to stock her business. Rosa's goal is to have a business with every type of article and to continue to work to succeed. Furthermore, she is thankful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for the confidence they have in her.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of necessities

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel S. is 26 years old. Aysel owns a successful clothing sales business at the central market in Lankaran. She has been running this business for 5 years. Her business has benefited from a good sales location and constant demand for her products. Aysel tries to offer good prices to her customers while still making a profit. 

Aysel has requested a loan of 1600 AZN to increase her inventory. This is a busy time for many market vendors, because the cold season is coming and everyone is preparing for the winter season. By purchasing additional inventory, Aysel will be better prepared to meet the increased demand and earn a good income. We believe her perseverance and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for winter season

loans.name: Nena

texts.es:
Nena es una mujer activa y entusiasta en el trabajo, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali. Ella tiene 58 años y es madre D. cinco hijos(4 D. ellos mayores D. edad e independientes). Nena se dedica a la venta D. comida todos los días por las tardes desD. su casa y cuenta con el apoyo D. una nieta, pues su esposo se encuentra delicado D. salud.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desD. hace dos años y empezó su negocio con un crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra D. golosinas para la venta desD. su casa. 
Actualmente necesita un crédito D. 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra D. arroz, aceite, condimentos, azúcar y otros productos necesarios para su negocio. 
Su meta es tener un lugar donD. ofrecer sus comidas y seguir generando ingresos para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Nena is an active woman and enthusiastic in her work. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 58 years old and mother of five children, 4 of whom are now older and independent Nena is dedicated to selling food every day in the afternoons from her house and counts on the support of a granddaughter, since her husband is in poor health. She has been part of the Las Rosas Community Bank for 2 years and started her business with a loan of $125 which she used in the purchase of sweets to sell from her house. Currently she needs a loan of $350 which will be used for the purchase of rice, oil, condiments, sugar and other products necessary for her business. Her goal is to have a place to offer her food and continue to generate profits to continue to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil, condiments, sugar and other products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris N. es una mujer dinámica y perseverante; su negocio está ubicado en la región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años, su esposo es motocarrista y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace tres años donde ha demostrado su puntualidad.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de artículos comestibles para su bodega.
En la actualidad Doris necesita un crédito de 2000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos para su bodega. 
La meta de Doris es ampliar su negocio y vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Doris N. is a dynamic and perseverant woman; her business is located in the Ucayali region. She is 42 yars old, her husband is a car driver and dedicated to selling groceries in retail. She has been part of the "Las Nazarenas" Community Bank for 3 years where she has demonstrated her punctuality. She first loan that she received was for $125, which she used in the purchase of groceries for her store. Currently Doris needs a credit of $700 with which she will buy additional products for her store. Doris' goal is to grow her business and sell goods by wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and grow her store

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
la sra. Balbina G. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en union libre y tuvo 7 hijos de los cuales solo cuatro dependen de ella, ya que los otros ya formamon sus hogares.
Balbina se dedica a la venta de baleadas, panqueques, osmil, café, leche con cereal, rosquillas y tamales. estas comidas tiene mucho tiempo de venderlas en la ciudad de langue; negocio con el cual le a dado el sosten a su familia durante muchos años, su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas honorables y buenos profesionales.
Balbina necesita el credito para poder comprar los ingredientes para la fabricacion de sus comidas, comprandolas al por mayor tiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Balbina G. is 54 years old and she has a common-law marriage. She had seven children, only four of whom still depend on her as the others have set up their own homes. Señora Balbina sells baleadas (a wheat-flour tortilla filled with beans and other ingredients), pancakes, osmil (oatmeal), coffee, cereal with milk, rosquillas (ring-shaped pastries) and tamales. She has been selling this food in the town of Langue for a long time. This business has allowed her to support her family for many years. Her greatest wish is for her children to be honorable and professional people. Señora Balbina needs a loan to buy the ingredients with which to prepare the food she sells. She purchases the ingredients wholesale to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, firewood, beans, butter, cheese, honey, coffee, milk and oats

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
Leovina es una mujer trabajadora y activa, vive en el distrito de Campo Verde, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y ropa de segundo uso la cual ofrece a diferentes caseríos del distrito y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas” desde hace tres años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en la compra de ropa de segundo uso.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de productos como son: arroz, leche, fideos, azúcar, etc. para ser vendidos en la bodega que pondrà.
La meta de Leovina es surtir su negocio de abarrotes y mejorarlo.
texts.en:
Leovina is a hardworking and active woman, who lives in the Campo Verde district of the Ucayali region. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children who are older in age. She dedicates her profession to the sale of sodas and second-hand clothing which she offers at different farmhouses of the district, and her husband is dedicated to agriculture. She has been part of the Las Nazarenas Community Bank for 3 years and the first credit she received was for 300 PEN which she invested in the purchase of second-hand clothing. Currently she needs a credit of 500 PEN which she will use in the purchase of products such as rice, milk, noodles, sugar and other goods to sell in the store she will have. Leovina's goal is to grow and improve her grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foodstuff to sell in a store out of her home

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una socia emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali.
Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es conductor de motocar. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes que funciona en su casa donde vende al por menor.
Miriam es socia nueva y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” y necesita un crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà para comprar productos de primera necesidad. 
La meta de Miriam es llegar a tener una tienda de abarrotes bien implementada para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam is a hardworking member, who lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 37 years old, is the mother of two young children, and counts on the support of her husband, who is a driver. She has a grocery store that she runs out of her house where she sells retail. Miriam is a new member and is part of the Las Fresitas ("the strawberries") Community Bank. She needs a credit of $125 which she will use to buy necessities. Miriam's goal is to have a well-established grocery store to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of necessities

loans.name: Jackeline Benita

texts.es:
La sra. Jackeline tiene su tienda de venta de licores, es muy conocida por la zona y lleva dos años con esta actividad, vive en la casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus dos hijos, son una familia muy unida, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de diseño gráfico, y los fines de semana la ayuda en el negocio. El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de bebidas para fin de año como whisky, singanis y rones.						
						
La zona es bastante populosa, se encuentra cobijado por el majestuoso nevado de Illimani, aprovechando las fiestas de fin de año, quiere mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Jackeline has been managing a liquor store for two years and is well-known in the area. She lives in the house of her mother-in-law with her husband and two children. They are a close family. Her husband works at a graphic design company and helps with her business on the weekends. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase beverages for the New Year, such as whiskey, brandy, and rum.

The area where she is located is quite popular because it is sheltered by the snow-capped Illimani. Jackeline wants to take advantage of the New Year celebrations to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase liquor

loans.name: Macaria

texts.es:
la sra. Macaria I. tiene 59 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de ella, los otros ya tienen hogares establecidos y en ocasiones le ayudan economicamente.
Macaria se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo para hacer: chicharrones, tocino, patas, costilla de cerdo, tajo tambien vende aguacates, tiene vario tiempo de realizar esta actividad, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Langue, dicho negocio le a ayudado para sustentar a su familia.
en estos momentos Macaria necesita comprar mas carne de cerdo ya que en esta epoca de navidad las carnes se venden mucho y desea obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Macaria I. is 59 years old. She lives in a common law marriage, and has 8 children. 2 of her children depend upon her and the other ones already have their own houses and sometimes help her financially.

Macaria is dedicated to the selling of pork products such as pork rinds, bacon, paws, pig feet, and pork ribs. She also sells avocado. It has been a long time that she does this activity. Her business is located in the Langue market. She says that her business has helped her support her family. Currently, Macaria needs to buy more pork meet, since during Christmas time this product sells a lot and she wants to earn more profit.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy pork meet

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz R. is a young and very enterprising man who is 26 years old. He is a mobile phone repair specialist. Parviz started his business in 2005 and, since that time, he become very successful and popular among local people. He has wide range of clients who have confidence in his work. Parviz is single and lives with his parents. He believes that, one day, he can build his own workshop and save enough money to make a good wedding party. We wish him good luck and ask you to support this very enthusiastic man.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Aggieagnes

texts.en:
Aggieagnes is 25 and married with one 4-month baby.  She owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    Aggieagnes needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 200 talas or US $83 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Aggieagnes joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Aggieagnes's 1st loan with SPBD. 

In addition, SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a "3 out of 3" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a "2 out of 3" = secondary/high-school, and a "1 out of 3" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. 

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

Aggieagnes's Overall Social Metric Score:*               1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.4 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. 

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Zaid

texts.en: Zaid Q. is a 46-year-old man who has been selling mobile phones for 10 years. He is married and has 2 children. Zaid started his business with $100 USD and now his monthly revenue is about $500-600 USD a month. But main achievement is that he built his own store and is not paying for rent any more. His aim is to provide a good quality education to his daughter and son. For this purpose, he applied for a 1600 AZN loan to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for his mobile phone business

loans.name: Santos Esmeralda

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Esmeralda Z. I. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene una pequeña pulperia, su negocio tiene 3 años de estar funcionando, anteriormente Santos trabajaba en una empresa estatal, pero como ya esta de edad decidio retirarse del trabajo y poner su propio negocio para pasar en su casa descanzando y atendiendo a sus clientes. dice sentirse mejor de salud en estos momentos.
este negocio le a generado ingresos para poder cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar, ya que con su esposo se comparten dichos gastos.
Santos tiene los deseos de ampliar mas su negocio, su negocio cada dia va creciendo mas y siente que ya no le ajusta el espacio fisico para poner toda su mercaderia, es por tal razon que Santos necesita el credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Santos Esmeralda Z. I. is 51 years old and lives in the Villanueva neighborhood. She has had a small grocery store for three years. Previously, Santos worked for a state company. Since she’s getting old, she decided to retire and open her own business to be able to stay home, be more relaxed and attend to her customers. She has been feeling healthier. This business has provided the income to be able to cover some of the household expenses that she shares with her husband. Santos wants to expand her business. It’s growing on a daily basis and she feels the space is too small for all her merchandise. This is the reason Santos is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her grocery store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina K. is a happy mother of two children. She is 37 years old and married. 

Zamina is a trader. She has been running her own grocery business to help her husband financially. For more that 15 years, she has been selling food, such as sweets, preserved foods, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many others in her grocery store.

Zamina wishes is to expand her business and offer different types of foods to customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind:  to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children who are all the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. 

With this opportunity, and with the immense love Zamina feels as a mother, and her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to increase the range of her goods.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell

loans.name: Francis Jaqueline

texts.es:
la señoa Francis Jaqueline B. A. tiene 37 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con sus hermanos, se dedica al comercio vende todo tipo de productos para damas de uso personal, su negocio lo tiene en la calle del comercio en la ciudad de San Lorenzo Valle.
 
Francis tambien vende cds, fajas, gorras, juguetes, perfumes, desodorantes.
 
esta solicitando el credito para surtir mas su negocio.
Su deseo en esta epoca es que dios derrame bendiciones a todos los hogares del mundo.
texts.en:
Señora Francis Jaqueline B. A. is 37 years old, single and without children. She lives with her brothers. She sells all types of women’s personal use products. Her business is located on the street of commerce in the city of San Lorenzo Valle.
Francis also sells CDs, belts, caps, toys, perfumes and deodorants. She is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise. Her wish for this season is that God blesses all the households in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.en:
Damaris started her business fifteen years ago to help her husband with the household income. She began by selling her merchandise door-to-door. She also took requests from customers and she would find the specific items that they were looking for. Through sacrifice, she has invested in her business and has been able to maintain and improve it. 

She will use this loan to buy merchandise to sell, such as pants, t-shirts, suits for children, and blouses. Damaris is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000. She has used previous loans to improve her business and increase her income. 

Damaris is married and has three children, ages 6, 8 and 12, who are all in school. Damaris dreams of having a real store and improving her house, but, mostly, she wants to help her children advance.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia SONIA tiene 34 años, es conviviente, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene cuatro hijos tres mujeres y un varón.  
 
La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de helados “Lamborgini”. Ella se levanta muy temprano y va a la fábrica de helados y en la carretilla lleva los helados y los vende en las plazas calles y mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella vende de lunes a viernes entre 70 a 80 y 90 nuevos soles por día. Ya son cinco años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más helados pues para esta época del año es cuando más vende.
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
SONIA is 34 years old and lives with her domestic partner in the city of Cusco. She is a member of the communal bank “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. Sonia has four children, three daughters and one son. Sonia alternates her household activities with selling “Lamborgini” ice cream. She wakes up very early to go buy ice cream at the factory. She pushes her ice cream cart around the streets, markets and plazas in the city of Cusco. She sells from Monday to Friday anywhere from 70, 80 and 90 nuevos soles daily. She’s had her business for five years and it has been doing well due to the effort she puts into her work. Sonia is an enterprising, working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She is requesting this loan to buy more ice cream since this is the season when she sells the most. Sonia is very thankful for the opportunity she has been given through this organization and she promises to pay on time.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hilda Luz

texts.es:
La señora HILDA LUZ R. B. tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito De La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores de educación primaria pero refiere que no ejerce por falta de vacantes en los colegios nacionales;es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. 
Hilda se dedica a la venta de aretes, colects, pulseras, pilimiles, juguetes,etc. de forma ambulatoria en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Trujillo.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò aretes, juguetes, pulseras, colects y aumentò su mercaderìa.
Ella solicitarà un crédito de 1,500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprará juguetes para niñas y niños por campaña navideña. 
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un mercado donde pueda vender màs tranquila su mercaderìa.
texts.en:
Sra. Hilda Luz R. B. is 35 years old, lives in the Esperanza district in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department in Peru. She belongs to the New Hope Community Bank. She has completed primary education but did not progress because of the lack of spots in the national colleges. She lives with another and has two children who depend on her economically. Hilda is dedicated to the sale of earrings, bracelets, toys and other goods in the different markets in the city of Trujillo. WIth her first credit of $125, she bought earrings, bracelets, toys and other goods to increase her stock of goods. She is requesting a credit of $525 with which she will buy toys for girls and boys for the Christmas holidays. Her dream is to lease a stand in a market where she will be able to sell her goods more tranquilly.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
el señor Esteban R. tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y tiene una hija que estudia y en vacaciones le ayuda ha vender su mercaderia. 

su negocio es la venta de ropa y reparacion de zapatos, dicho negocio esta ubicado en el mercado 
viejo de San Lorenzo, este negocio lo tiene desde hace varios años. Sus ventas son diarias de lunes a
sabado, esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir su negocio ya que se aproxima la navidad en donde la demanda es mayor. 
 
Su sueño es tener su propia casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo, dice que para ella trabaja.
texts.en:
Esteban R. is 47 years old. He is married and has one daughter who is a university student; during her vacations, she helps him sell his merchandise. His business is selling clothing and repairing shoes. The business is located in the traditional market of San Lorenzo, and he has operated it for several years. His sales stall is open daily from Monday to Saturday. He is requesting the loan in order to stock his business, since Christmas is approaching, when the demand is greater. His dream is to have his own house, in order to provide a higher quality of life for his daughter, which is what he wants most in this world; he says that he is working for her sake.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ladies' and men's clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una joven dinámica y emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 21 años, es madre de un niño, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella tiene una bodega y paralelamente se dedica a la venta de menús, actividad que realiza desde su casa.
Margarita esta contenta de ser socia D. Movimiento Manuela Ramos ya que ahora tiene un pequeño capital propio y esto le permite progresar en su negocio. Forma parte D. Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtiò en productos de abarrotes.
En la actualidad Margarita necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà un carrito sanguchero para vender por las tardes y asì aumentar sus ingresos. 
La meta de Margarita es surtir su bodega y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is a dynamic and hardworking young person who likves in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 21 years old and married with one child, and her husband is dedicated to selling clothing. She has a store and she also sells menus, which she does out of her house. Margarita is content to be a partner in the Manuela Ramos Movement, now that she has a little personal capital which helps her progress in her business. She has been part of the Las Rosas Community Bank for a year, and the first credit she received was for $125 which she invested in the purchase of groceries. Currently Margarita needs a credit of $350 with which she can buy a cart from which to sell in the evenings, and in that way increase her profits. The goal of Margarita is to stock her store and improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of a cart

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.en:
Maria is 29 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 5. She lives with her partner. 

Maria has had her clothing business for three years. It began as a way for her to help her husband cover the family expenses. Maria primarily sells clothing and cosmetics and will use this loan to buy a large amount of merchandise so that she will have a good inventory to resell. 

This is Maria’s fourth loan from Fundación León 2000 and she will continue to seek loans to finance her business. Maria’s business is still very small and she does not yet have a store to maintain. Maria wants to continue to invest in her business so that it can grow and provide the necessary income for her family. Maria also hopes that her children will grow to have professional careers of their own and that they will be able to meet the challenges that await them in life.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.en:
Teresa is 26 years old and is married. She and her husband do not yet have children. 

Teresa raises pigs and sells pork. She will use her loan to buy pigs that she will raise and then sell for their meat. Teresa sells pork and "nacatamales" (corn cakes filled with vegetables and meat and steamed in banana leaves), the traditional Nicaraguan weekend meal, on foot. She started this business ten years ago when she needed a way to earn an income. 

Teresa says that this business has provided a good income, and the loans that she has received from Fundación León 2000 have helped to stabilize her household. Maria’s mother is in poor health and, as a result of all the years that she has had this business, she has problems with arthritis.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria Esther es una socia jovial, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante; vive en distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 19 años, es madre de un pequeño y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de telèfonos.
Maria se dedica a la venta de abarrotes al por menor y paralelamente vende caldo de gallina junto a su madre desde hace un año en la vereda de su casa.
Ella es una de las socias que integra el Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año donde se ha caracterizado por ser puntual. Nos comenta que està contenta de participar en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos porque le ha dado la oportunidad de comenzar con su propio negocio y ayudar a su esposo en la economía D. hogar. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizó en la compra de gaseosas. 
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos comestibles (aceite, fideos, arroz, azúcar, leche, etc). 
La meta de Maria es llegar a tener un restaurante de comidas típicas de la región Ucayali.
texts.en:
Maria Esther is a joyful, hardworking member with much desire to succeed. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali region. She is 19 years old, is mother of a small child and counts on the support of her husband who is dedicated to selling telephones. Maria is dedicated to the retail sale of groceries and also sells chicken broth along with her mother, which she has been doing for the past year from the sidewalk in front of her home. She is one of the members who has been in the Las Rosas Community Bank for one year where is known for being punctual. She is pleased to participate in the Manuela Ramos Movement because it has given her the opportunity to begin her own business and help her spouse support the home. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN which she used for the purchase of sodas. Currently she needs a loan of 600 PEN with which she will buy food products such as oil, noodles, rice, sugar, milk and other products. Maria's goal is to have her own restaurant with food typical of the Ucayali region.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of food products

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
La sra. Emma se dedica a la confección de deportivos para niños y adultos, llega con sus productos al público en general, vive en la casa de su suegra junto a sus esposo y sus hijos, el esposo trabaja como entrenador de futbol de niños, y ambos se contribuyen para los gastos de la familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de tela para confeccionar deportivos para niños para las fiestas navideñas. 						
						
Por lo general la práctica del deporte es un icono en las familias, el Presidente Evo construye varias canchas de futbol con cesped sintético, logrando así la práctica de futbol en su mayoria por los niños.
texts.en:
Emma makes sportswear for children and adults which she sells to the general public. She lives in the home of her mother-in-law with her husband and children. Her husband works coaching children's soccer and together they contribute to the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy material for making children's athletic clothing for the holidays.

Generally sports are an important part of family life. President Evo (Morales) constructed various soccer fields with artificial turf, allowing the majority of children to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary material

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli” desde hace 4 años atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, cuenta con estudios primarios completos, es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos.
Catalina se dedica a la venta de artesanìas y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró los materiales necesarios para hacer sus artesanías.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con los que podrà comprar lana y bayeta.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su granja de truchas en Juli. 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Catalina has been a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima - Juli Community bank for 4 years, of the Juli district in the Chucuito province of the Puno department. She is 49 years old, has completed her primary education, is divorced and has 2 children. Catalina is dedicated to the sale of artisanal goods and has had a loan of $125 through the Manuela Ramos movement, which she used to buy the materials necessary to make her goods. She is requesting a loan of $125 with which she can buy wool and dishcloths. Her dream for the future is to have a trout farm in Juli. What she likes most about the Community Bank is the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool and dishcloths

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
