la señora Elsa Marina R. Marinez tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que estan estudiando en el colegio. Elsa se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace 10 años, su familia depende de ella no tiene casa propia, alquila un lugar para vivir.
Esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas ingredientes para fabricar sus golosinas y comidas y asi atender mejor a su clientela ya que en estos dias han estado llegando muchas personas en busca de comida y no esta cumpliendo con todas las exigencias de sus clientes. 
su deseo es que esta navidad sea de un tiempo de paz, amor y prosperidad
texts.en:
Señora Elsa Marina R. M. is 41 years old, is a single mother and has 2 children that study at college. She has worked selling food and sweets for 10 years, and her family depends on her. She doesn't own her own house, but rents a place to live. She is seeking a loan to buy more ingredients to make her sweets and food, and thereby better attend to her clientele now that many people are arriving in search of her food and she can't meet all the demands of her clients. Her dream is that this Christmas be a time of peace, love and prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy refreshments, chicken and pork meat, tortillas, vegetables, butter, salt, spices, beans, water, plates, disposable cups.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Izkra

texts.es:
Nuestra socia IZKRA tiene 26 años, es soltera, es natural de la ciudad de Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.  
 
La socia estudio administración en turismo y tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y repuestos de carros. La socia de lunes a viernes junta mercadería que compra de Cusco, Tacna o Desaguadero, después la socia lleva todos los sábados la mercadería a la ciudad de Huaypetue del departamento de Madre de Dios y lo vende o distribuye en el mercado a sus clientas. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven, trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como pantalones y polos pues para esta época del año es cuando más vende.
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Izkra is 26 years old, single, a native of Cuzco. She is a member of the “Emprendedores de San Cristóbal” [San Cristobal Entrepreneurs] Communal Bank, part of the Arariwa Association. Izkra studied tourism management, and has a small business selling clothing and auto parts. Every Saturday she carries her merchandise to Huaypetue in the Madre de Dios department. She has had the business for a few years, and has done well, because of all the effort she devotes to it. This member is a young, hard-working entrepreneur who will be successful. She needs a loan to buy additional merchandise, such as pants and polo shorts, for this is the right time of year to sell those items. She is grateful for the opportunity offered herein, and commits to repayment as required by the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of clothing

loans.name: Nidia Odili

texts.en:
Nidia’s business is the fabrication of copper and aluminum pots. She is married and has three children, ages 5, 6, and 7. She will use this loan to buy supplies, such as aluminum and fuel for her stove. She has had loans before fromh Fundación León 2000 and says that they have helped her to increase her income. 

Nidia has a workshop in her house where she works with copper and aluminum. It was her father’s workshop, but he left the family to be with another woman. With her mother’s permission Nidia began to work in the shop and she has maintained it for the past five years. Nidia’s dream is to build her own house and to achieve more for her children.

loans.use: Working capital for her metal shop

loans.name: Gerardo Alberto

texts.es:
Gerardo tiene 23 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a dos de sus hermanos en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el pueblo joven San Martín, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero de construcción civil desde que tenía 13 años. Ayudaba a su padre en sus tiempos libres y poco a poco fue aprendiendo esta labor. Actualmente trabaja diariamente gracias a que es conocido por la zona y siempre lo llaman cuando hay obras de construcción. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad cubre sus gastos personales y ayuda al sostenimiento de su familia. 

Gerardo está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de algunas herramientas y accesoR. necesaR. para ejercer su labor de manera segura y eficaz.

Su más grande anhelo es instalar una tienda con la cual pueda seguir ayudando a sus padres. El es un joven muy conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y por las personas que trabajan con el: ellos lo consideran un muchacho responsable.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 23 years old and single. He lives with two of his brothers in their parents' home, located in the young village of San Martín, in the city of Lambayeque, about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in civil construction since he was 13 years old. He used to help his father during his free time, and little by little he learned the trade. Today he has work every day, thanks to the fact that he is known throughout the area and people always call him when there are construction jobs. With the income that he receives from this work he covers his personal expenses and helps support his family. Gerardo is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 nuevos soles. He plans to invest in the purchase of some tools and equipment necessary to do his work safely and efficiently. His greatest desire is to open a store, which will enable him to continue helping his parents. His neighbors and colleagues know him well and respect him: they consider him to be a very responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools and equipment for civil construction work

loans.name: Vicky Jicela

texts.es:
la joven Vicki Jicela A. C. tiene 25 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad, su compañero de hogar es taxista y se ayudan mutuamente con los gastos de la casa. Vicky se dedica  a la venta de pescados fritos, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas pescados, ingredientes para hacer los pescados fritos y refrescos.
su sueño es tener su propia casa y darle un techo digno donde vivir a su hija.
texts.en:
Vicky Jicela A. C. is a 25-year-old young woman who lives in a common-law marriage and has a three-year-old daughter. Her partner is a taxi driver and they help each other with household expenses. Vicky sells fried fish and has done this type of work for five years. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase more fish, ingredients to fry them, and soft drinks. Her dream is to own her own home and put a proper roof over her daughter's head.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase fish, butter, tortillas, cabbage, soft drinks, lemons, salt, and spices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.en: Roger, a  32-year-old single man, sells automotive glass and operates a taxi business. All of this began seven years ago when Roger used some of his savings to begin his own business. He had experience working as a construction assistant and had assisted in a similar business, so he decided to start his own business. Roger says that the loans he has received from Fundación León 2000 have allowed him to improve his living conditions, accumulate his own savings and  expand his business to include the taxi service. His dream is to build a bathroom in his house and to pay off his loans to Fundación León 2000. He will use this loan to cover the costs of his businesses and buy more automotive glass.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kamine

texts.es:
Kamine es una socia jovial y dinámica , vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante.
Kamine se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde su casa y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace dos años donde se ha caracterizado por su entusiasmo.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprò cremas faciales para venderlas a sus clientes.
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà para comprar productos de belleza.
La meta de Kamine es tener una tienda de artículos para el hogar y seguir colaborando en los gastos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Kamine, 31, is a dynamic and cheerful woman from the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has three minor children and her husband is a merchant; she can count on his supporting her work efforts. Kamine sells beauty products from her home. She has been a member of the "Las Fresitas" communal bank for the last two years; she is noted for her enthusiasm. The first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy facial creams to sell to her customers. Now, she needs 800 new soles to buy beauty products. Kamine's goal is to have a houseware store and to continue to contribute to meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela Nolorbe es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 55 años, es viuda y madre de ocho hijos mayores de edad los cuales la apoyan.
Se dedica a la venta de verduras en el mercado de Bellavista-Pucallpa.  
Es nueva socia y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Madres Corajes”. El primer préstamo que recibirá es de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizará en la compra de frutas y verduras regionales. 
La meta de Marcela es llegar a tener una tienda de golosinas y seguir apoyando a su familia en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Marcela Nolorbe, 55, is a dynamic, optimistic woman from the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is a widow and has 8 adult children who help support her. She is a vegetable merchant in Pucallpa's Bellavista market. She is a new member of the "Madres Corajes" communal bank. The first loan she will receive will be for 300 new soles that she'll use to buy regional fruits and vegetables. Marcela's goal is to have a sweet shop and to continue supporting her family with household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy regional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Guadalupe

texts.en: For many years Martha Guadalupe has had a clothing sale business which she started because she needed to cover the household expenses when her husband abandoned her. Martha will use this loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for men, women and children and also cosmetics and shoes. Her goal is to maintain her business and to better meet the needs of her clients in the future. She says that every day the price of items increases and as a result fewer people can afford to buy things. Martha Guadalupe has two children, a 24-year-old son who is in school and a 27-year-old daughter who has her own family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de tres hijos(2 de ellos mayores de edad) y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es pescador.
Marlene se  dedica al alquiler de botes de pesca, actividad que realiza en el puerto de Yarina Cocha.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace ocho años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de hielo para la conservación de los pescados que luego fueron vendidos a diferentes mercados.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà insumos para la pesca. La meta de Marlene es tener una tienda de abarrotes en general y seguir apoyando en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlene is an active and hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children (two of them grown).

Marlene’s business is renting fishing boats in the port of Yarina Cocha. She has been a member of the “Las Tigresas” [Lady Tigers] Communal Bank for 8 years. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was used to purchase ice to chill fish that she sold at various markets. Now she is seeking a loan of 3000 soles to buy fishing supplies. Her goal is to have a grocery store, and to continue supporting the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing supplies

loans.name: Nuris Narda

texts.en: Nuris, a single 27-year-old single woman with one child, sells clothing on foot, travelling to the city of Chinandega to buy merchandise and then going to the smaller city of Somotillo to sell. Her business started 11 years ago when a friend loaned her money at a low interest rate so that Nuris was able to buy a bit of merchandise to begin selling clothing.  As she gained established clients she has been able to offer them credit lines. In this way Nuris has been able to provide for herself, and she says that the loans form Fundación León 2000 have greatly helped her. The challenge that she faces is a lack of working capital, but she nonetheless dreams of having her own cart so that she can become more established as she travels to visit clients.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Zoila Ladislada

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ZOILA tiene 54 años, es viuda, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa. La socia tiene 4 hijos los cuales tres son mayores y la menor Zenaida tiene 18 años y estudia en el colegio “Comercio 41” del Cusco.     
 
La socia vende ropa usada en “El Baratillo” para una pequeña empresa. La socia lava, plancha la ropa y después lo vende. Ya son varios años con el trabajo y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre, trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y quiere abrir su propio negocio de venta de comida al paso. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar un triciclo y en ahí llevar comida y vender afuera de los mercados. En esta época del año es cuando más se vende comida por las fiestas navideñas.
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member ZOILA is 54 years old, widowed, and is a native of Cuzco City. She belongs to the communal bank “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She has 4 children, of which three are grown up, while the youngest, Zenaida, is 18 years old and studies in the “Comercio 41” high school in Cuzco. Zoila sells used clothing in “El Baratillo” for a small business. She washes and irons the clothes, then sells them. She has been doing this work for quite a few years and it has been going very well for her thanks to all the dedication and hard work she puts into her work. She is a mother, a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman, who has been able to help her family prosper. She wants to open her own business selling food to go. She needs this loan to buy a tricycle to carry her food and thus sell food outside of the markets. This is the season when she sells a lot of food for Christmas parties. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her through these means and therefore she promises to make all her payments according to her time line.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs this loan to buy a tricycle to carry her food and thus sell food outside of the markets.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa es una socia muy trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 46 años, es separada y madre de dos hijos mayores de edad.
Elisa se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza, actividad que viene realizando hace cuatro años y que gracias al prèstamo que le da el Movimiento Manuela Ramos sus ventas han aumentado, pues trabaja dando crédito y cobrando diariamente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de productos de belleza.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà prendas de vestir y juguetes que serán vendidos a sus clientes. 
La meta de Elisa es llegar a tener una boutique y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elisa is a very hard-working and dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 46, separated, and has two grown children. She sells beauty products. She has been doing this for four years. Thanks to the loan she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement, her sales have increased. She works giving credit, and she charges daily. She has been part of the Las Tigresas Communal Bank for six years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought beauty products. She currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN, which she will use to buy articles of clothing and toys to sell to her customers. Elisa’s goal is to have a boutique and to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy articles of clothing and toys for children

loans.name: Aerepaquita Nidia

texts.en: Aeropaquita is a nurse by profession, but the business that she started on her own is the sale on foot of used clothes as well as medicines. She has been managing this business for ten years and is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000.   She reports that her loans always help her to live a little more comfortably.  Aeropaquita has been struggling a little with her health but says that little by little she is getting better. Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to establish it in her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
En el departamento de Estelí, el señor Carlos L. con mucha dedicación se esfuerza para continuar manteniendo su núcleo familiar por lo que tiene el deber de brindarle buenas condiciones de vida a sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar.

Es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha buscado la manera de cómo llevar el sustento a su hogar y para ello es importante destacar que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de ganado ya que tiene experiencia en la crianza de animales y por estas razones cree que por medio de la actividad del ganado se beneficiará grandemente y mejorará las condiciones de vida de  su familia.
texts.en:
In the Estelí district, Mr. Carlos L., with a lot of dedication, is working hard to continue providing for his nuclear family. He feels he has the duty to offer a good quality of life to his two young, elementary-school-aged sons. He is a very hardworking person, who has always sought the means to provide sustenance to his household. For him it is very important to emphasize that he is seeking this loan to purchase cattle, since he has experience raising animals. Because of this experience, he believes that through the activity of raising cattle he will successfully earn a great profit and will be able to improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Donna

texts.es:
Donna es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 29 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es chofer de motocar.
Donna se dedica a la venta de comida criolla todos los dìas por las mañanas desde su casa y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Rosas” desde hace un año y medio. 
El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que utilizò en la compra de carbón, plátanos y frutas para luego venderlos a sus conocidos.
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà productos como aceite, fideos, arroz, azúcar, etc. para la preparación de sus comidas. 
La meta de Donna es tener un restaurante propio en su casa y aumentar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Donna is a very hard working and active member of her village bank. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 29 years old, the mother of one young son, and her husband works as a chauffeur. Donna sells sells criolla food every morning from her home. She is a member of the village bank "Las Rosas" (The Roses") and has been for the past year and a half. The first loan she took out was for 300 nuevos soles and she used it to buy charcoal, plantains, and fruit to sells to her neighbors. Now she needs a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy products like oil, pasta, rice, and sugar to prepare her foods. Donna's goal is to own her own restaurant in her house and increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying foodstuffs to perpare food to sell

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.en: Aeropaquita is a nurse by profession but the business that she started on her own is the sale of used clothes, though she also sells medicines. She has been managing this business for ten years; she began selling clothing on foot. Aeropaquita is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000, she reports that her loans always help her to live a little more comfortably.  She does not have any children. Aeropaquita has been struggling a little with her health but says that little by little she is getting better. Her dream is to improve her business and to be able to establish it in her home.

loans.use: working capital
